original: 'khrul pa yin par khyad med kyang //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin par khyad med kyang //
translated: There is no difference in their error.

original: ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
analyzed: ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
translated: But there is a difference in their ability to perform a function.

original: de ltar ji bzhin don min yang //
analyzed: de ltar ji bzhin don min yang //
translated: In the same way, although they are not real objects,

original: rjes dpag dang ni der snang dag //üîΩdon byed pa dang rjes 'brel bas //
analyzed: rjes dpag dang ni der snang dag // don byed pa dang rjes 'brel bas //
translated: Inference and the appearance of the objectüîΩAre posited as valid cognitions

original: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag //üîΩces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag // ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are related to the performance of a function.

original: nor bu'i 'od sgo gseng nas shar ba dang sgron ma'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa'i blos phan tshun khyad par med par snang ste /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od sgo gseng nas shar ba dang sgron ma'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa'i blos phan tshun khyad par med par snang ste /
translated: The light of a jewel that shines through a hole in a wall and the light of a lamp are not different in appearing to the mind that is mistaken about the jewel.

original: 'di ltar sgron ma'i 'od la nor bu'i blo skyes pa don dam pa'i nor bu 'dzin pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgron ma'i 'od la nor bu'i blo skyes pa don dam pa'i nor bu 'dzin pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: In this way, the mind that arises in regard to the light of the lamp is not a concealer that apprehends the ultimate jewel.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'dzin pa'i blo yang nor bu 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'dzin pa'i blo yang nor bu 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the mind that apprehends the light of the jewel as a jewel is not a concealer that apprehends the jewel.

original: de bas na nor bu'i blo des mngon par rgyug pa'i skyes bu gnyi ga yang 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin par khyad par med kyang nor bu dang phrad par byed pa la khyad yod de /
analyzed: de bas na nor bu'i blo des mngon par rgyug pa'i skyes bu gnyi ga yang 'khrul pa'i shes pa yin par khyad par med kyang nor bu dang phrad par byed pa la khyad yod de /
translated: Therefore, although the mind that is the thought of the jewel is not different from the mind that is the thought of the lamp in being a mistaken consciousness, there is a difference in their ability to bring one into contact with the jewel.

original: nor bu'i blo kha cig gcig gis phrad par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i blo kha cig gcig gis phrad par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: like the mind of one who is mistaken about a rope being a snake.

original: de bzhin du ji bzhin pa'i don can ma yin pa la 'khrul pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang der snang ba de dag don byed pa la khyad par yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji bzhin pa'i don can ma yin pa la 'khrul pa yang rjes su dpag pa dang der snang ba de dag don byed pa la khyad par yod de /
translated: Likewise, even though there is error in regard to the object as it is, there is a difference in the performance of a function by inference and by the appearance of that object.

original: 'khrul pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi stobs las skyes pas brgyud nas 'brel ba'i phyir phrad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags kyi stobs las skyes pas brgyud nas 'brel ba'i phyir phrad par byed pa yin no //
translated: Even though there is error, inference is a means of valid knowledge because it is produced by the power of a reason having the three modes, and thus it is indirectly related to its object and thus performs a function.

original: der snang ba ni 'brel ba dang bral ba'i phyir phrad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der snang ba ni 'brel ba dang bral ba'i phyir phrad par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The appearance of that object is not a means of valid knowledge because it is not related to its object and thus does not perform a function.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni don byed pa'i ngo tshar ma nyid yin gyi der snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni don byed pa'i ngo tshar ma nyid yin gyi der snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference is a means of valid knowledge in regard to the performance of a function, but the appearance of that object is not.

original: yang na der snang ba'i sgra ni mngon sum la brjod de /
analyzed: yang na der snang ba'i sgra ni mngon sum la brjod de /
translated: Or else, the term ‚Äúappearance of that object‚Äù refers to perception.

original: de bas na mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang don byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pas tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag par blta'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa yang don byed pa dang rjes su 'brel pas tshad ma nyid du rnam par gzhag par blta'o //
translated: Therefore, like perception, inference is also a means of valid knowledge because it is related to the performance of a function.

original: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa dngos po snang ba ma yin na ji ltar ma mthong ba la 'jug par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa dngos po snang ba ma yin na ji ltar ma mthong ba la 'jug par byed ce na /
translated: But if inference does not perceive an existent thing, how can it engage an imperceptible object?

original: nor bu ma thong yang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur mngon par zhen nas zhugs na phrad par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
analyzed: nor bu ma thong yang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur mngon par zhen nas zhugs na phrad par 'gyur ba ma yin na /
translated: Even if one does not see a jewel, if one enters into the water thinking ‚ÄúThis is a jewel‚Äù because of its radiance, one will not find the jewel.

original: 'khrul par gyur kyang thams cad mtshungs pa ma yin te /üîΩthams cad du rgyu'i khyad par gyi khyad par can du 'gyur ba @35a * //
analyzed: 'khrul par gyur kyang thams cad mtshungs pa ma yin te / thams cad du rgyu'i khyad par gyi khyad par can du 'gyur ba @35a * //
translated: But it is not the same for all errors.

original: srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that all errors are distinguished by the distinction of their causes.

original: shes pa yin pa tsam gyis thams cad 'khrul pa'am ma 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa yin pa tsam gyis thams cad 'khrul pa'am ma 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because not all errors are the same.üîΩFor example, some cognitions are erroneous and some are nonerroneous.

original: dper na shes pa la la 'khrul pa yin zhing la la ma 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du 'khrul pa yang mi bslu ba yang dag pa'i shes pa dang tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na shes pa la la 'khrul pa yin zhing la la ma 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du 'khrul pa yang mi bslu ba yang dag pa'i shes pa dang tshad ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, an erroneous cognition can be a valid cognition and a nonerroneous cognition.

original: 'brel pa med bas slu ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa med bas slu ba'i shes pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But a deceptive cognition is not a valid cognition because it is not related to its object.

original: 'o na gal te 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar mi bslu bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar mi bslu bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it is erroneous, how can it be nondeceptive?

original: 'khrul pa yin yang 'brel pa can gyi dngos po las skyes pa'i phyir slu ba med par 'gyur te /üîΩ'khrul pa yang don las brgyud nas skye ba mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang 'brel pa can gyi dngos po las skyes pa'i phyir slu ba med par 'gyur te / 'khrul pa yang don las brgyud nas skye ba mthong ba yin te /
translated: Even though it is erroneous, it is nondeceptive because it arises from a related object.

original: dper na nor bu'i 'od la nor bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nor bu'i 'od la nor bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, the light of a gem is seen to arise from a related object, the gem.

original: gzhan yang gal te rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if inference is not a valid cognition because it is erroneous,

original: mngon sum tshad mar mi 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum ma byung na tshad mar mi 'gyur la /üîΩmngon sum yang rjes su dpag pa ma skyes par tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon sum tshad mar mi 'gyur te / 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum ma byung na tshad mar mi 'gyur la / mngon sum yang rjes su dpag pa ma skyes par tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then direct perception would not be a valid cognition.üîΩFor inference is not a valid cognition if direct perception does not occur.üîΩAnd direct perception is not a valid cognition if inference does not arise.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa ma gtogs par dang po 'jug par byed pa ma yin zhing 'jug byed med par yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa ma gtogs par dang po 'jug par byed pa ma yin zhing 'jug byed med par yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: For direct perception is not an initial engagement without inference, and it is not a valid cognition without an engagement.

original: 'on te mngon sum med par rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug gi rjes su dpag pa med kyang mngon sum yod pa'i phyir tha dad do zhes slob dpon gsung ba ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i mngon sum ni rang rig pa tsam la dgongs pa yin la
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum med par rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug gi rjes su dpag pa med kyang mngon sum yod pa'i phyir tha dad do zhes slob dpon gsung ba ni rjes su dpag pa med pa'i mngon sum ni rang rig pa tsam la dgongs pa yin la
translated: He intends that direct perception without inference is mere reflexive awareness.

original: / rang rig pas ni tha snyad gang la yang mi 'jug pa ma yin na /
analyzed: / rang rig pas ni tha snyad gang la yang mi 'jug pa ma yin na /
translated: But it is not the case that reflexive awareness does not engage any conventions.

original: de bas na dang po tha snyad 'dogs par nus pa can rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dang po tha snyad 'dogs par nus pa can rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, first, inference is what has the ability to posit conventions.

original: 'on te mngon sum dang por rjes su dpag pa la ma ltos par 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum dang por rjes su dpag pa la ma ltos par 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: But direct perception engages without relying on inference first.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum med kyang 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum med kyang 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: Inference engages even without direct perception.

original: 'di ltar du ba las me rjes su dpag pa mngon sum med kyang 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba las me rjes su dpag pa mngon sum med kyang 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: For example, inferring fire from smoke engages even without direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid las don de thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid las don de thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the object is obtained from inference itself.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: rjes su dpag pas me la sogs pa shes pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas me la sogs pa shes pa ni /
translated: The cognition of fire, etc., by inference

original: de'i chos can gyi khyad par rtogs pa la mngon sum med na ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i chos can gyi khyad par rtogs pa la mngon sum med na ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be, if there were no perception, a cognition of the particular of the subject?

original: rjes su dpag pa ni yul khyad par med par me rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni yul khyad par med par me rig pa yin te /
translated: Inference is the cognition of fire, etc., without the particular of the object,

original: 'di ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas cho da pa'i me ni yul nges pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas nges par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsig pa la sogs pas cho da pa'i me ni yul nges pa nyid du rjes su dpag pas nges par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the fire, etc., obstructed by a wall, etc., is not ascertained by inference as to the particular of the object.

original: rtsig @35b pa'i pha rol gyis phyogs gang yang rung ba tsam du spyir dpog par byed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rtsig @35b pa'i pha rol gyis phyogs gang yang rung ba tsam du spyir dpog par byed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: But it is not that the inference infers a mere generality, any place whatsoever, beyond the wall.

original: mngon sum gyis yul nges par 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis yul nges par 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: It is perception that apprehends the particular of the object.

original: nges par med pa can gyi med ni don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi grogs can no //
analyzed: nges par med pa can gyi med ni don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi grogs can no //
translated: Because that which is not ascertained cannot perform a function, inference is a companion of perception.

original: nor bu'i 'od las nor bur shes pa yang yul nges pa can du ma bzung ba'i phyir de nyid kyi skyon gyis tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od las nor bur shes pa yang yul nges pa can du ma bzung ba'i phyir de nyid kyi skyon gyis tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: And the cognition of the gem from the light of the gem is not a valid cognition because of the same fault, since it does not apprehend the particular of the object.

original: the tshom zab dang phyin ci log dag kyang don nges par thob bar mi byed par mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: the tshom zab dang phyin ci log dag kyang don nges par thob bar mi byed par mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Doubt and error are also the same in that they do not cause the attainment of a definite object.

original: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa gzhan du 'jug pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: But if you say that a valid cognition is not a valid cognition because it is a mistaken consciousness that engages its object in a distorted way,

original: the tshom za ba ni res 'ga' de la yang 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom za ba ni res 'ga' de la yang 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and that doubt is a valid cognition because it sometimes engages its object in a non-mistaken way,

original: gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa the tshom zab ma yin nam /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha la dmigs pa the tshom zab ma yin nam /
translated: then is not doubt a consciousness that observes both aspects of a dichotomy?

original: ji ltar 'jug par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug par byed par 'gyur /
translated: How could it engage its object?

original: 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni phyin ci log gis 'jug par byed par rigs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni phyin ci log gis 'jug par byed par rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable that a mistaken consciousness engages its object in a distorted way.

original: nor bu'i 'od las shes pa ni 'khrul pa yang phyis 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pas shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od las shes pa ni 'khrul pa yang phyis 'byung ba'i rjes su dpag pas shes pa yin gyi /
translated: The consciousness that arises from the light of a jewel is a mistaken consciousness, but it is a consciousness that is an inference that arises later.

original: tshad ma gzhan las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition that arises from another valid cognition.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa ni tshad ma nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa ni tshad ma nyid du bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the consciousness that is the valid cognition that apprehends the light of a jewel is not distinguished from the valid cognition that apprehends the jewel.

original: 'on te nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
translated: But if you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the valid cognition that apprehends the jewel in the light of the jewel?‚Äù

original: de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid do //
translated: This is direct perception itself.

original: 'o na mngon sum 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum 'khrul par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can direct perception be mistaken?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: It is not true.

original: 'khrul pa'am ma 'khrul yang rung ste slu ba med pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'am ma 'khrul yang rung ste slu ba med pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Whether it is mistaken or not mistaken, the absence of deception is valid knowledge.

original: de skad du yang //
analyzed: de skad du yang //
translated: Thus it is said:

original: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
analyzed: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //
translated: Valid knowledge is nondeceptive cognition.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: 'on te 'khrul pas ji ltar slu ba med ce na /
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pas ji ltar slu ba med ce na /
translated: But if it is mistaken, how can it be nondeceptive?

original: 'di 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa nyid do zhes slu ba med pa ma gtogs pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ;üîΩ'on te gnod pa med pa ni ma 'khrul pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa nyid do zhes slu ba med pa ma gtogs pa ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur ; 'on te gnod pa med pa ni ma 'khrul pa'o zhe na /
translated: How can it be established as nondeceptive except by saying it is nonmistaken?üîΩBut if it is undeceiving because it is nonmistaken,

original: gnod pa med pa yang slu ba med kyi shes pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa yang slu ba med kyi shes pa ma yin na /
translated: then being undeceiving is not a cognition.

original: slu ba las thams cad 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: slu ba las thams cad 'khrul par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Since all cognitions are mistaken due to deception,

original: slu ba med pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa kho na ste /
analyzed: slu ba med pa yin yang rjes su dpag pa ni 'khrul pa kho na ste /
translated: even though it is nondeceptive, inference is mistaken.

original: de mngon sum gyis gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir dpyod pha ba'i lta ba rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de mngon sum gyis gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir dpyod pha ba'i lta ba rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: Since it is seen otherwise by direct perception, it is not reasonable to analyze it.

original: 'jig rten rgya nga pan pa'i lugs kyang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgya nga pan pa'i lugs kyang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: The system of the Lokayatas is also untenable,

original: 'khrul ba thams cad tshad ma ma yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba thams cad tshad ma ma yin par khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they accept that all error is not a valid cognition.

original: 'o na gal te 'khrul pa tshad ma yin na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na /üîΩgsal ba dang @36a * //
analyzed: 'o na gal te 'khrul pa tshad ma yin na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la khyad par ci zhig yod ce na / gsal ba dang @36a * //
translated: Well, if error is a valid cognition, then what is the difference between perception and inference?

original: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference in the form of the clear and the unclear.

original: de bas na mngon sum gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid 'khrul pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid 'khrul pa med pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the nature of perception is non-erroneous,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rang bzhin la ltos nas 'khrul pa med pa dang / slu ba med pa la ltos nas kyang 'khrul pa med pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rang bzhin la ltos nas 'khrul pa med pa dang / slu ba med pa la ltos nas kyang 'khrul pa med pa mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: and inference is not the same as non-erroneous in relation to the nature, and non-deceptive in relation to the object.

original: de bas na 'khrul pa dang 'khrul pa med par bstan pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa dang 'khrul pa med par bstan pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to teach error and non-error.

original: de lta na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: de lta na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ji ltar mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin /
translated: In that case, how are perception and inference different in their characteristics?

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal bas so zer na /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal bas so zer na /
translated: Because of the clear and unclear.

original: snang ba tha dad pa de nyid gang las yin /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa de nyid gang las yin /
translated: What is the basis of those different appearances?

original: 'on te rang dbang ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de gsal bar snang ba can nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rang dbang ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de gsal bar snang ba can nyid yin la /
translated: Or is it that the apprehension of the independent is the one that appears clearly,

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni lkog tu gyur pa'o zer na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ni lkog tu gyur pa'o zer na /
translated: and the apprehension of the nature of another is the one that is hidden?‚Äù

original: de lta na ni rang dbang can 'dzin pa dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa gang gis de dag tha dad pas yul tha dad pa dang tshad ma tha dad par 'gyur ba'i de dag nyid ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / gang la don gyi nus pa las //
analyzed: de lta na ni rang dbang can 'dzin pa dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa gang gis de dag tha dad pas yul tha dad pa dang tshad ma tha dad par 'gyur ba'i de dag nyid ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / gang la don gyi nus pa las //
translated: In that case, how could those apprehensions of the independent and the nature of another be different, since they are different, and how could the objects and the valid knowledges be different?

original: rjes su 'gro ldog can gyi blo //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ldog can gyi blo //
translated: Objection: The mind that is concomitant with the capacity of the object

original: de la 'dzin pa rang dbang can //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa rang dbang can //
translated: Is the independent apprehension of that.

original: de las gzhan dngos dbang po 'das //
analyzed: de las gzhan dngos dbang po 'das //
translated: The apprehension of the nature of another is beyond the senses.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Reply:

original: shes bya gang la dngos po'i nus pa yod pa dang med pa dag las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi blo yod pa dang med pa dang ldan pa'i don de ni rang dbang can te mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya gang la dngos po'i nus pa yod pa dang med pa dag las rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi blo yod pa dang med pa dang ldan pa'i don de ni rang dbang can te mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The object that is the basis of the power of the object of knowledge, which is the object of the cognition that is concomitant with the presence or absence of the object, is independent, and is apprehended by perception.

original: mngon sum 'dzin pa de las gzhan par rang dbang can du mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum 'dzin pa de las gzhan par rang dbang can du mi 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is not apprehended as independent, other than the apprehension of perception, is not perception.

original: 'on kyang sngar mthong bas bskyed pa'i bag chags sad pa las byung ba 'dzin pa dngos po de ni dbang po las 'das pa ste mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar mthong bas bskyed pa'i bag chags sad pa las byung ba 'dzin pa dngos po de ni dbang po las 'das pa ste mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
translated: However, the apprehension that arises from the activation of the latent impressions produced by previous seeing is beyond the senses, and is not perception.

original: de la dbang po'i byed pa mngon sum med par snang ba can yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang po'i byed pa mngon sum med par snang ba can yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the appearance of the activity of the sense faculty is not without perception.

original: mngon sum du byed pa'i rnam pa med na gzhan du rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa'i rnam pa med na gzhan du rtogs pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no aspect that is perceived, there is no other realization.

original: de bas na rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi don yin la /
analyzed: de bas na rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni mngon sum gyi don yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which is realized is the object of perception.

original: mngon sum du rtogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum du rtogs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni lkog tu gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is not directly perceived is hidden.

original: dbang po dang phrad pa med pa las lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang phrad pa med pa las lkog tu gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not hidden because it is not in contact with a sense faculty.

original: dbang pos kyang ngo bo nyid kho na mthong bar byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang pos kyang ngo bo nyid kho na mthong bar byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that a sense faculty sees only the intrinsic nature?

original: de yang gal te rjes su dpag pas shes na ni lkog tu gyur pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gal te rjes su dpag pas shes na ni lkog tu gyur pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is known through inference, then there is no hidden object.

original: 'on te ngo bo nyid mi shes na de lta na rjes su dpag pa dngos po la reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te ngo bo nyid mi shes na de lta na rjes su dpag pa dngos po la reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the intrinsic nature is not known, then inference does not touch the object.

original: de @36b bas na lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de @36b bas na lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po ni rang gi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a hidden object is not known by its intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na gal te lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po mi shes na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po mi shes na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: But if a hidden object is not known, how can inference be a means of valid knowledge?

original: de'i blo ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid can ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i blo ni lkog tu gyur pa'i don brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid can ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the cognition of that object of the nature of an imagined hidden object?

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here we say:

original: de yi rang bzhin mi snang bdag //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin mi snang bdag //
translated: Its intrinsic nature is not manifest to us.

original: rtogs pa 'di rten don gzhan de //
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di rten don gzhan de //
translated: This cognition of the object is based on something else.

original: gal te de rten dang 'brel can //üîΩ'gyur na de tshe go byed yin //
analyzed: gal te de rten dang 'brel can // 'gyur na de tshe go byed yin //
translated: If it were related to a basis,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then it would be the indicator.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i nges su mi rung ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni mi snang ba'i bdag nyid de de'i don rtogs pa ste nges par gyur pa /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i nges su mi rung ba'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni mi snang ba'i bdag nyid de de'i don rtogs pa ste nges par gyur pa /
translated: That which is not suitable as a visible object is the invisible self. The cognition of that object is the ascertainment.

original: bsgrub par bya ba las tha dad pa'i don gzhan la brten pa yin gyi rang dbang can 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba las tha dad pa'i don gzhan la brten pa yin gyi rang dbang can 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is based on an object that is different from the object to be established, and it is not an independent apprehension.

original: 'o na gal te gzhan mthong ba la gzhan du rtogs par byed na ha cang thal ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gzhan mthong ba la gzhan du rtogs par byed na ha cang thal ches par 'gyur te /
translated: Now, if one makes the cognition of one thing in regard to seeing another thing, there would be an extreme fallacy.

original: gang cung zad mthong ba la gang ci yang rung ba 'ga' zhig tu rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang cung zad mthong ba la gang ci yang rung ba 'ga' zhig tu rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Whatever is seen, anything at all, would be cognized as anything at all.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: mi snang ba'i bdag nyid de nyid kyi rten gang yin ba dang 'brel pa can du gyur na de'i tshe go byed yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i bdag nyid de nyid kyi rten gang yin ba dang 'brel pa can du gyur na de'i tshe go byed yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that very invisible self were related to a basis, then it would be the indicator.

original: yang na chos can de la brten pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chos can de la brten pa'i mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel pa can du gyur pa'i zhes bya bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, it should be viewed as that which is related to the impermanence, etc. that is based on that subject.

original: 'di dag gis ni tshul gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni tshul gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: These [three] indicate the three modes.

original: 'brel pa las dran par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'brel pa las dran par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: [Objection:] But isn't memory produced from a relation?

original: de yang goms pa la sogs pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid thal ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang goms pa la sogs pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir de nyid thal ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since that [relation] is produced from habituation, etc., it follows that [memory] is excessive.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: [Reply:] It is not so.

original: goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pa ni gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pa ni gzhan du yang srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because memory that is produced from habituation is possible in other cases as well.

original: 'di ltar goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pas ni yul dang dus nges pa can gyi don ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa las skyes pa'i dran pas ni yul dang dus nges pa can gyi don ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, memory that is produced from habituation does not indicate an object that is restricted to a particular place and time.

original: rtags las skyes pa'i dran pas ni yul dang dus nges par ston pa'i dngos po ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa'i dran pas ni yul dang dus nges par ston pa'i dngos po ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: But a thing that is indicated by memory that is produced from a sign is a valid cognition, because it is restricted to a particular place and time.

original: 'on te rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa rnam pa mtshungs pa can gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te rtags las skyes pa'i shes pa rnam pa mtshungs pa can gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa yin gyi /
translated: Or else, that cognition that is produced from a sign and has a similar aspect is inference.

original: bzlog pa ni tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the opposite of that is a different kind of valid cognition,üîΩwe reply:

original: smras pa // de tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //
analyzed: smras pa // de tshe go byed rjes 'gro ba //
translated: Then, because it follows the understood,

original: spyi yi ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
analyzed: spyi yi ngo bo nyid du rtogs //
translated: it is understood to have a universal nature.

original: de phyir lkog gyur don thams cad //
analyzed: de phyir lkog gyur don thams cad //
translated: Therefore, all hidden objects

original: khyad par du ni rtogs mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par du ni rtogs mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are not understood in particular.

original: go bar byed pa'i rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i rtags kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, because it follows the understood reason,

original: go byed rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: go byed rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: it follows the understood.

original: de ni spyi'i ngo bo nyid rjes su dpog pa de'i tshe rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni spyi'i ngo bo nyid rjes su dpog pa de'i tshe rtogs pa ste /
translated: That is, it is understood that it is inferred to have a universal nature.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @37a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid du khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i @37a * //
translated: It is understood to have the nature of following.

original: tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: de'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad khyad par du ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i don thams cad khyad par du ste /
translated: Therefore, all hidden objects

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: are not understood in particular, that is, in a unique nature.

original: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rigs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i rigs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: But, it is indeed a reasoning that arises from a reason having the three modes that has a universal aspect.

original: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma'o zhes bya ba 'di gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma'o zhes bya ba 'di gang las shes she na /
translated: In that case, from what is it known that inference itself is valid cognition?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / 'brel pa can gyi chos dag las //
analyzed: smras pa / 'brel pa can gyi chos dag las //
translated: From the properties that are related,

original: chos can la rtogs skye ba gang //üîΩde ni rjes dpag de nyid kyis //
analyzed: chos can la rtogs skye ba gang // de ni rjes dpag de nyid kyis //
translated: The cognition of the subject arises.üîΩThat is inference.

original: lkog gyur sgrub byed gcig yin no //
analyzed: lkog gyur sgrub byed gcig yin no //
translated: By that alone, the hidden is established.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa can chos du ba la sogs pa las yul la sogs pa'i chos can la me la sogs pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin ba de nyid kyis /
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa can chos du ba la sogs pa las yul la sogs pa'i chos can la me la sogs pa'i shes pa skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa gang yin ba de nyid kyis /
translated: from the properties that are related to the probandum, such as smoke, the cognition of the subject, such as the hill, arises. That is inference.üîΩBy that alone,

original: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po rnams rjes su dpag pa gcig pu sgrub byed yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po rnams rjes su dpag pa gcig pu sgrub byed yin gyi /
translated: the hidden things are established.

original: tshad ma gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no other valid cognition.

original: 'o na gzhal bya gzhan gyi yul can gyi tshad ma yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gzhal bya gzhan gyi yul can gyi tshad ma yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don't other valid cognitions exist that have other objects of comprehension?

original: de ji ltar tshad ma gnyis kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar tshad ma gnyis kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How are there only two valid cognitions?

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /üîΩbam po lnga pa //
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /üîΩbam po lnga pa //
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa las //
analyzed: mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa las //
translated: From the manifest and the hidden.üîΩ

original: gzhal bya gzhan ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan ni yod ma yin //
translated: There is no other object of comprehensionüîΩapart from the manifest and the non-manifest.

original: de phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis //
analyzed: de phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid kyis //
translated: Therefore, because there are two objects of comprehension,

original: tshad ma dag ni gnyis nyid bzhed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshad ma dag ni gnyis nyid bzhed // ces bya ba la /
translated: only two means of valid cognition are accepted.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin pa las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir /
translated: With respect to this, because there is no object of comprehension other than the manifest and the non-manifest,

original: gang gis de'i yul can gyi tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis de'i yul can gyi tshad ma gzhan du 'gyur ba yin /
translated: by what would there be another means of valid cognition that is its subject?

original: de'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pas tshad ma gnyis kho nar rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis nyid yin pas tshad ma gnyis kho nar rigs so //
translated: Therefore, because there are two objects of comprehension, it is logical that there are only two means of valid cognition.

original: 'o na gzhal bya gnyis su 'thad par tshad ma gnyis kyis byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na gzhal bya gnyis su 'thad par tshad ma gnyis kyis byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Well, if it is tenable that two means of valid cognition are established by two objects of comprehension,

original: tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i sgrub byed yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni gzhal bya'i sgrub byed yin no zhe na /
translated: are the means of valid cognition the establisher of the objects of comprehension?

original: yul gyi tshad ma sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi tshad ma sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of the means of valid cognition is not established,

original: rang rig pas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established by reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid can mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bstan la /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa nyid can mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no zhes bstan la /
translated: The aspect of consciousness itself, which has the aspect of clarity and unclarity, is the object of direct perception and inference.

original: da lta ni rnam pa gnyis po rigs pas tshad ma gcig ma yin la /
analyzed: da lta ni rnam pa gnyis po rigs pas tshad ma gcig ma yin la /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that both aspects are not a single valid cognition,

original: gsum yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and that three are also not reasonable, he says:

original: gsum gcig grangs ni gsal ba'am //
analyzed: gsum gcig grangs ni gsal ba'am //
translated: The number three is eliminated because

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: two objects are seen.

original: de lta bas na gzhal bya gnyis yin pas gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir grangs gsum @37b bsal ba'am /
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhal bya gnyis yin pas gzhal bya gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir grangs gsum @37b bsal ba'am /
translated: Thus, since there are two objects, the number three is eliminated because another object does not exist.

original: gzhal bya gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir grangs gcig bsal bar blta'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis su bstan pa'i phyir grangs gcig bsal bar blta'o //
translated: Since two objects are demonstrated, the number one is eliminated.

original: med pa gzhal bya ma yin phyir //
analyzed: med pa gzhal bya ma yin phyir //
translated: Since the nonexistent is not an object,

original: gcig nyid yin na kho bo 'ang 'dod //üîΩces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin na kho bo 'ang 'dod // ces bya ba ni /
translated: we also assert that it is one.

original: 'on te khyad par can gcig pu gzhal bya yin la /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par can gcig pu gzhal bya yin la /
translated: If you say that the singular, particular is the object,

original: de las gzhan pa ni med pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni med pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan gyis gzhal bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and since there is nothing other than that, it is not to be evaluated by another valid cognition,

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: then in response to that, he says:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin pa 'di ni kho bo la yang 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa'i gzhal bya yod pa ma yin pa 'di ni kho bo la yang 'dod pa yin te /
translated: We also accept that there is no object of comprehension other than its own characteristic.

original: de yang spyi ni gzhal bya ma yin la rang gi mtshan nyid gcig bu gzhal bya yin te /
analyzed: de yang spyi ni gzhal bya ma yin la rang gi mtshan nyid gcig bu gzhal bya yin te /
translated: Moreover, a universal is not an object of comprehension, but only its own characteristic is an object of comprehension,

original: de nyid rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can zhes brjod do //üîΩgzhan yang // gzhal bya min na med pa yang //
analyzed: de nyid rang gi ngo bo dang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid dag gis rtogs pa'i phyir spyi dang khyad par gyi mtshan nyid can zhes brjod do // gzhan yang // gzhal bya min na med pa yang //
translated: because it is understood by means of its own nature and the nature of another.üîΩMoreover, if it is not an object of comprehension,

original: yin phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: yin phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: nonexistence is not established.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: With respect to this,

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi med pa yang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi med pa yang gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir /
translated: nonexistence, the nature of nonexistence prior to the existence of something, is an object of comprehension.

original: gzhal bya ma yin bar bsgrub pa la med pa'i gtan tshigs ni ma nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhal bya ma yin bar bsgrub pa la med pa'i gtan tshigs ni ma nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, with respect to establishing that it is not an object of comprehension, the reason of nonexistence is not established.

original: ma nges pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no //
analyzed: ma nges pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no //
translated: That which is not established is not a reason.

original: snga na med pa la sogs pa la rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir nges pa'i tha snyad thams cad bzlog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snga na med pa la sogs pa la rigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir nges pa'i tha snyad thams cad bzlog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Because of the absence of a reason, is not all ascertainment of non-existence refuted?

original: de bas na gnyis su med pa nyid 'ba' zhig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na gnyis su med pa nyid 'ba' zhig yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, non-duality alone exists.

original: de nges yod na tshad gnyis yin //
analyzed: de nges yod na tshad gnyis yin //
translated: If it is ascertained, there are two means of valid knowledge.

original: med la dbang skyes blo ma yin //
analyzed: med la dbang skyes blo ma yin //
translated: But if it does not exist, it is not the cognition born of the sense-faculties.

original: don gyi stobs las skyes phyir ro //üîΩdon nus pa la'ang ltos med na //
analyzed: don gyi stobs las skyes phyir ro // don nus pa la'ang ltos med na //
translated: Because it arises from the power of the object.üîΩIf it is independent of the capacity of the object,

original: tshod pa la sogs yod na yang //
analyzed: tshod pa la sogs yod na yang //
translated: then even if there is a sense-faculty, etc.,

original: dbang skyes blo ni skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni skye bar 'gyur /
translated: the cognition born of the sense-faculties will arise.

original: zhes bya ba ni med pa de nges pa yod na ni tshad ma gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni med pa de nges pa yod na ni tshad ma gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: This means that if the non-existence is ascertained, there are two means of valid knowledge.

original: 'on te dbang po las skyes pa'i blo nyid kyis med pa'i tha snyad sgrub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po las skyes pa'i blo nyid kyis med pa'i tha snyad sgrub po zhe na /
translated: But if the ascertainment of non-existence is established by the cognition born of the sense-faculties themselves,

original: ma yin te med pa la dbang po las skyes pa'i blo mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te med pa la dbang po las skyes pa'i blo mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: no, because the cognition born of the sense-faculties does not engage with non-existence.

original: med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: What is called non-existence is not the domain of the sense-faculties.

original: mngon sum du snang ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du snang ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what is directly perceived is only the nature of the blue, etc.

original: de la tha dad pa ni mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa ni mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: and the difference is not perceived.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin zhing /
translated: Therefore, it is not the domain of the senses, because it does not have the nature of that.

original: yul la sogs pas chod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la sogs pas chod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it obstructed by objects, etc.

original: snang ba med pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba med pa nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a non-appearance.

original: 'on te med pa la dbang po las skyes pa'i mi 'jug go zhes bya bar ji ltar shes te /üîΩgang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dmigs pa nyid kyis med @38a * //
analyzed: 'on te med pa la dbang po las skyes pa'i mi 'jug go zhes bya bar ji ltar shes te / gang gi phyir bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dmigs pa nyid kyis med @38a * //
translated: But how do you know that the non-existent does not arise from the senses?

original: par nges so zhe na /
analyzed: par nges so zhe na /
translated: Because the non-existence of the pot, etc. is ascertained by the perception of the place devoid of the pot, etc.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: don gyi stobs las dbang po'i shes pa skyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don gyi stobs las dbang po'i shes pa skyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the sense perception arises from the power of the object.

original: de don gyi stobs las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir don nye ba'i ngo bo nyid snang ba can du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de don gyi stobs las skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir don nye ba'i ngo bo nyid snang ba can du rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is reasonable that the nature of the appearance is the object, because it arises from the power of the object.

original: bzlog pa'i dngos po de la nye bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: bzlog pa'i dngos po de la nye bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is the opposite not present there?

original: ji ltar de mngon sum gyi yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de mngon sum gyi yul du 'gyur /
translated: How can it be the object of direct perception?

original: mi snang bar gyur pa na des khong du mi chud pa'i med pa ji ltar shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur pa na des khong du mi chud pa'i med pa ji ltar shes par 'gyur /
translated: When it is not manifest, how can one know that it does not exist, since one does not understand it?

original: 'on te don gyi stobs las skyes par khas mi len te /
analyzed: 'on te don gyi stobs las skyes par khas mi len te /
translated: But you do not accept that it arises from the power of the object.

original: dbang po stobs las mngon sum skye ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po stobs las mngon sum skye ba'o //
translated: Direct perception arises from the power of the sense faculty.

original: de la yul snang ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yul snang ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the object is only manifest,

original: skyed par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na ;
translated: but it is not the producer.

original: de lta na 'o na ni gal te dbang po las skyes pa'i blo don dang 'brel bar khas mi len na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni gal te dbang po las skyes pa'i blo don dang 'brel bar khas mi len na /
translated: If you do not accept that the cognition that arises from the sense faculty is related to the object,

original: yul la sogs pas chod pa la yang dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul la sogs pas chod pa la yang dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then a cognition that arises from the sense faculty would occur even with respect to an object that is obstructed.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni shin tu nye bar gyur pa dang bskal ba'i don bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni shin tu nye bar gyur pa dang bskal ba'i don bzung ngo //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the meaning of being very close or distant.

original: 'on te dbang po rnams nye ba'i dngos po la shes pa bskyed par nus kyi chod pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dbang po rnams nye ba'i dngos po la shes pa bskyed par nus kyi chod pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the sense faculties are able to produce a cognition of a nearby object, they are not able to produce a cognition of an obstructed object.

original: des na de la dbang po las skyes pa'i blo 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na de la dbang po las skyes pa'i blo 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the mind that arises from the sense faculty does not engage it.

original: de lta na ni sa bon yang myu gu la nus pa med par gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na ni sa bon yang myu gu la nus pa med par gyur la /
translated: If that is so, then the seed would not have the ability to produce the sprout.

original: sa la sogs pa kho na rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa kho na rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: And would not the earth and so on alone be the cause?

original: 'o na gal te sa nyid myu gu skyed ba nyid yin yang sa bon la ltos bar 'gyur ba'i phyir myu gu bskyed pa de la sa bon yang nus pa can du rtogs par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sa nyid myu gu skyed ba nyid yin yang sa bon la ltos bar 'gyur ba'i phyir myu gu bskyed pa de la sa bon yang nus pa can du rtogs par bya'o zhe na /
translated: If the earth itself is the producer of the sprout, then because it would rely on the seed, the seed would be understood to have the ability to produce the sprout.

original: de lta na ni mig las skyes pa'i rigs pa la yul gyi nus pa grub par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na ni mig las skyes pa'i rigs pa la yul gyi nus pa grub par 'gyur ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, would not the ability of the object be established in the reasoning that arises from the eye?

original: 'di ltar yul nye bar gyur na dbang po'i shes pa skye ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul nye bar gyur na dbang po'i shes pa skye ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: When the object is present, the sense consciousness arises.

original: de med na yang mngon sum med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na yang mngon sum med par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not present, direct perception would not exist.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of positive and negative concomitance is the definition of cause and effect.

original: de lta ma yin na thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te mngon sum log pa las //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nyid med par 'gyur ro // gal te mngon sum log pa las //
translated: If it were not so, then everywhere the nature of cause and effect would not exist.

original: med par nges nyid yin na yang //
analyzed: med par nges nyid yin na yang //
translated: If the ascertainment of nonexistence is from the cessation of perception,

original: 'gal ba'am de nyid rjes 'gro dang // ldog pa can nyid rtags yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'am de nyid rjes 'gro dang // ldog pa can nyid rtags yin no //
translated: then the reason is the contradictory, the pervasion of that, and the reversal.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩ'on te med par nges par byed pa ni mngon sum kho na ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / 'on te med par nges par byed pa ni mngon sum kho na ste /
translated: This is what is said.üîΩIf the ascertainment of nonexistence is from the cessation of perception,

original: de log pa las te mngon sum log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de log pa las te mngon sum log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the ascertainment of nonexistence is from the cessation of perception, that is, from the reversal of perception.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: They explain this as follows:

original: mngon sum zhugs pas ni dngos po yod par sgrub cing /
analyzed: mngon sum zhugs pas ni dngos po yod par sgrub cing /
translated: Perception engaged with an existent thing establishes its existence.

original: mngon sum @38b log pa las med par nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum @38b log pa las med par nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: The ascertainment of nonexistence is from the reversal of perception.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum nyid yod pa'i tha snyad dang med pa'i tha snyad byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum nyid yod pa'i tha snyad dang med pa'i tha snyad byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag par ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since perception itself makes the conventions of existence and nonexistence, how could there be engagement with inference?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: mngon sum log pas dngos po dang bral par ston pa 'di ni 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum log pas dngos po dang bral par ston pa 'di ni 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The demonstration that the non-existence of direct perception is devoid of entity is contradictory.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i dngos po shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i dngos po shes pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the consciousness produced from the sense faculty is the cognition of the entity that is the object of direct perception.

original: ji ltar med pa 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa 'dzin par byed /
translated: How can it apprehend the non-existent?

original: gang zhig gang la mi 'jug pa de ni de'i sgrub byed ma yin te shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la mi 'jug pa de ni de'i sgrub byed ma yin te shin tu thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not engage in something is not the proof of that, because it is too much of an overextension.

original: de bas na mngon sum ni mdun na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing ;
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum ni mdun na gnas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa la 'jug par 'gyur zhing ;
translated: Therefore, direct perception engages in the blue, etc. that is present in front.

original: de nyid yod par shes pa yin gyi nyams su myong bar ma gyur pa de la yod pa dang med par 'dzin par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yod par shes pa yin gyi nyams su myong bar ma gyur pa de la yod pa dang med par 'dzin par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And that itself is the cognition of existence. But it is not possible to apprehend the existence or non-existence of that which has not become experience.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang la yod pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi rtags yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang la yod pa de ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi rtags yin no //
translated: That which has concomitance and reversal is the reason that has concomitance and reversal.

original: de dag gis 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: They demonstrate this as follows:

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa ni rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension which establishes the convention of non-existence, following the rule of concomitance and reversal, is itself inference.

original: 'dis ni mi dmigs pa'i yul bstan cing /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi dmigs pa'i yul bstan cing /
translated: This shows the object of non-apprehension.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul yang shugs kyis bstan te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul yang shugs kyis bstan te /
translated: The object of the natural reason is also shown by implication.

original: 'di ltar gal te de las gzhan pa med pa'i tha snyad 'dogs par nus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te de las gzhan pa med pa'i tha snyad 'dogs par nus pa ste /
translated: Thus, if it is possible to impute the convention of non-existence of anything other than that,

original: yan gar ba dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan du yang tha dad pa'i tha snyad de ltar byed pa de nyid la de ltar sgrub par byed na'o //
analyzed: yan gar ba dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan du yang tha dad pa'i tha snyad de ltar byed pa de nyid la de ltar sgrub par byed na'o //
translated: because of the apprehension of the isolated thing, then the convention of difference is made in that way, and that itself is established in that way.

original: da ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi yul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show the object of the effect reason, he says:

original: gzhan gyi sems nyid rtogs pa las //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems nyid rtogs pa las //
translated: From the realization of the mind of another,

original: tshad ma gnyis nyid grub pa yin //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis nyid grub pa yin //
translated: the two valid cognitions are established.

original: smra tshogs la ni 'jug phyir yang //
analyzed: smra tshogs la ni 'jug phyir yang //
translated: And also because of the engagement in the collection of speech,

original: de yod par ni nges par grub //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de yod par ni nges par grub // ces bya ba la /
translated: its existence is definitely established.

original: gzhan gyi sems de nyid rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems de nyid rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis grub pa yin no //
translated: From the realization of the mind of another, the two valid cognitions are established.

original: 'on te mngon sum nyid kyis gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum nyid kyis gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: But if you think that inference is not a valid means of knowledge because it is not a valid means of knowledge in regard to the object that is to be comprehended, then why is direct perception not a valid means of knowledge in regard to the mind that exists in the mental continuum of another?

original: 'di la tshad ma gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What need is there for another valid means of knowledge?

original: 'di la smras pa ;
analyzed: 'di la smras pa ;
translated: We reply:

original: tshig smra ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig smra ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'jug pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the cause of the engagement of conventions such as speech.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lus kyi 'gyur ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lus kyi 'gyur ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes bodily changes and so on.

original: de yod pa ste sems yod par 'grub pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de yod pa ste sems yod par 'grub pa yod kyi /
translated: The existence of that, that is, the existence of the mind, is established,

original: mngon sum gyis gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa ni ma yin te /üîΩgzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems kyi khyad @39a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa ni ma yin te / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i sems kyi khyad @39a * //
translated: but the mind that exists in the mental continuum of another is not realized by direct perception.

original: par 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par 'dod chags la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the specific attributes of the mind that exists in the mental continuum of another, such as attachment, are not apprehended.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi sems ma rtogs na yang tha snyad thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi sems ma rtogs na yang tha snyad thams cad rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the mind that exists in the mental continuum of another is not realized, all conventions would not be disrupted.

original: 'di ltar rgyud gzhan gyi sems ma rtogs na gzhan gyi khong du chud pa'i don du bstan bcos rtsom pa dang rtsod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tha snyad gzhan gyi rgyud la bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyud gzhan gyi sems ma rtogs na gzhan gyi khong du chud pa'i don du bstan bcos rtsom pa dang rtsod pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad dang 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i tha snyad gzhan gyi rgyud la bya bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if the mind of another person is not known, it is not reasonable to engage in the conventions of composition and debate, etc., for the purpose of making others understand.

original: gal te mngon sum gcig pu rig par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe rang rig pa gnyis su med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gcig pu rig par byed pa yin pa de'i tshe rang rig pa gnyis su med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If direct perception alone is the means of knowing, then self-awareness would be non-dual.

original: de bas na su yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na su yang 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, no one would engage in anything.

original: 'on te 'ga' zhig ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'di yin yang de tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'ga' zhig ltar gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'di yin yang de tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if this is the knowledge of another's mind, it would not be valid cognition,

original: gzhan gyi sems dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad tsam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad tsam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it merely sees the convention that accords with another's mind.

original: de bas na gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa yod kyang /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa yod kyang /
translated: Therefore, even if the mind of another is cognized,

original: gang zhig khong du chud pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig khong du chud pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: that which is understood is not valid cognition.

original: de lta ni tshad ma'i rtog dpyod la 'jug pa spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ni tshad ma'i rtog dpyod la 'jug pa spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the engagement in the investigation of valid cognition would be abandoned.

original: 'on te thabs gzhan med pas ma rtogs pa'i phyir tha snyad spong bar byed do zhe na thabs gzhan med pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ni tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te thabs gzhan med pas ma rtogs pa'i phyir tha snyad spong bar byed do zhe na thabs gzhan med pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di ni tshad ma nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But if you say that you do not understand it because there is no other means, then is not this certainty called ‚Äúno other means‚Äù itself a means of valid knowledge?

original: med par nges pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: med par nges pa yang rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: And it has been shown that the ascertainment of nonexistence is also inference.

original: 'on te gzhan khas len du 'jug pa ston pa byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan khas len du 'jug pa ston pa byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that you teach in order to make others accept it,

original: gzhan khas len du 'jug pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid la zhugs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan khas len du 'jug pa yang gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa nyid la zhugs pa ma yin nam /
translated: then is not the teaching in order to make others accept it also included in inference for the sake of others?

original: 'di ltar su yang rjes su dpog pas bdag nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar su yang rjes su dpog pas bdag nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the teacher himself who infers.

original: 'on te rnam pa gzhan med pas gzhan gyi sems yod par tha snyad 'dogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gzhan med pas gzhan gyi sems yod par tha snyad 'dogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that you designate the existence of another‚Äôs mind because there is no other way,

original: 'o na ni 'jig rten pha rol yang nges par yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig rten pha rol yang nges par yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that the world beyond must definitely exist.

original: 'on te 'jig rten gzhan med kyang 'tsho bar nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten gzhan med kyang 'tsho bar nus pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that even though the other world does not exist, it is possible to live,

original: 'jig rten gzhan rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and so the other world is not understood,

original: 'o na 'tsho bar nus pa zhes bya bar ji ltar shes te /üîΩ'di ltar 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba nyid ci 'das pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na 'tsho bar nus pa zhes bya bar ji ltar shes te / 'di ltar 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba nyid ci 'das pa yin nam /
translated: But how do you know that the one who is able to live is the self?üîΩIn this way, is the one who seeks to live the past self,

original: 'on te da ltar byung ba'i 'tsho ba po yin /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar byung ba'i 'tsho ba po yin /
translated: or is the one who lives the present self?

original: de la 'das pa ni 'tsho ba po ma yin te de 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'das pa ni 'tsho ba po ma yin te de 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The past self is not the one who lives, because it has passed away.

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin te de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin te de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is the present self, because it has already been obtained.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the future self is the one who seeks to live,

original: 'o na ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba po thabs 'dis 'byung gi / gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'tsho ba po thabs 'dis 'byung gi / gzhan gyis ma yin pa'o zhes rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rtogs pa rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: then the future self is the one who lives, and it is by this method that it will come into existence, not by any other.

original: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa the tshom za ba'i 'bras bu @39b can no zhes zer ba de yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su dpag pa the tshom za ba'i 'bras bu @39b can no zhes zer ba de yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: This also clarifies the statement that inference is the result of doubt.

original: gzhan yang ma dpyad pa nyid 'di ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa ni ci ste khyed kho na'i yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma dpyad pa nyid 'di ltar tha snyad 'dogs pa ni ci ste khyed kho na'i yin nam /
translated: Moreover, if you do not analyze, then why do you alone make this conventional designation?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi yin /
translated: Or do others do so?

original: gal te khyed kyi yin na /
analyzed: gal te khyed kyi yin na /
translated: If it is yours,

original: gnyi ga la ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan la ston pa yin /
analyzed: gnyi ga la ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan la ston pa yin /
translated: how can you teach it to others, since it is not established for both of you?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi yin na khas blangs pa med pa nyid de ;
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi yin na khas blangs pa med pa nyid de ;
translated: But if it is the other‚Äôs, then you have no thesis.

original: de lta na gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, you would certainly have knowledge of the other‚Äôs mind.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no //
translated: And that is inference.

original: gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa med na brtsad pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa med na brtsad pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If you have no knowledge of the other‚Äôs mind, then your argument is invalid.

original: slu med phyir te tshad ma nyid //üîΩla la dag tu 'khrul pa'i phyir //üîΩyid brtan mi rung zhe na ni //
analyzed: slu med phyir te tshad ma nyid // la la dag tu 'khrul pa'i phyir // yid brtan mi rung zhe na ni //
translated: Because it is valid,üîΩbecause it is not deceptive, like a valid cognition.

original: rtags log mthong phyir de de 'dra ;
analyzed: rtags log mthong phyir de de 'dra ;
translated: But it is invalid, because it is sometimes mistaken.

original: / zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If you say that,üîΩthen that is just like the mistaken perception of a reason.

original: rjes su dpag pa de tshad mar khas blang bar bya ste slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de tshad mar khas blang bar bya ste slu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You should accept that inference is a valid means of knowledge, because it is nondeceptive.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa la la la 'khrul par mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa la la la 'khrul par mthong ba yin te /
translated: But you see that sometimes inference is mistaken,

original: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir de yang sngo bsangs yin zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir de yang sngo bsangs yin zhes bya ba 'di lta bu'o //
translated: like the inference that ‚ÄúHe is dark because he is his son.‚Äù

original: de 'khrul pa'i phyir thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo zhe na ;
analyzed: de 'khrul pa'i phyir thams cad la yid brtan du mi rung ngo zhe na ;
translated: If you say that because it is mistaken, it is not reliable in any case,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: gang 'khrul pa can de la ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gang 'khrul pa can de la ni rjes su dpag pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: because it is not tenable that what is mistaken is an inference,

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang ba la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from a fallacious reason.

original: sngo bsangs dang de'i bu la 'brel par ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngo bsangs dang de'i bu la 'brel par ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related to the son of a barren woman.

original: des na rtags kyi rang bzhin ma shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na rtags kyi rang bzhin ma shes pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because you do not understand the nature of a reason,

original: gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang rtags su sgro btags pas slu ba de rjes su dpag pa de dang 'dra bar khyed la snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma yin pa yang rtags su sgro btags pas slu ba de rjes su dpag pa de dang 'dra bar khyed la snang ba yin no //
translated: you superimpose a nonreason as a reason, and so you are deceived. That inference appears to you in that way.

original: 'on te de lta bur rjes su dpag pa thams cad yin te /üîΩ'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba yod la /
analyzed: 'on te de lta bur rjes su dpag pa thams cad yin te / 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba yod la /
translated: But if you say that all inferences are like that,üîΩthen in the case of the son of a barren woman, there is a reason that is a property of the subject, because there is both seeing and not seeing the reason in similar and dissimilar cases,

original: de'i bu nyid la phyogs kyi chos kyang yod na de dag las tha dad pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gzhan med do //
analyzed: de'i bu nyid la phyogs kyi chos kyang yod na de dag las tha dad pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gzhan med do //
translated: and there is no other characteristic of a distinction apart from those.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pa gang zhig la 'khrul pa med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pa gang zhig la 'khrul pa med pa yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, with respect to which inference is there no error?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / dngos po gang las la lar ni //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po gang las la lar ni //
translated: From a thing, in some places,

original: res 'ga' 'di yi rtogs par 'grub //üîΩde las de ni nges skye ba'am //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'di yi rtogs par 'grub // de las de ni nges skye ba'am //
translated: sometimes its comprehension is established.üîΩFrom that, it is definitely produced,

original: de yi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩbyas pa dang du ba la sogs pa'i rtags gang zhig las dus res 'ga' zhig dngos po sgra dang phyogs la lar /üîΩmi rtag pa nyid dang me la sogs pa rtogs par gyur pa'i du ba la sogs pa de ni gdon mi za bar me de las skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / byas pa dang du ba la sogs pa'i rtags gang zhig las dus res 'ga' zhig dngos po sgra dang phyogs la lar / mi rtag pa nyid dang me la sogs pa rtogs par gyur pa'i du ba la sogs pa de ni gdon mi za bar me de las skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or it becomes its nature.üîΩWith respect to that, from a reason such as ‚Äúproduced‚Äù or ‚Äúsmoke,‚Äù sometimes in some places, such as sound or a direction, the comprehension of a thing such as impermanence or fire is established.

original: byas pa nyid la sogs pa de mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa @40a * //
analyzed: byas pa nyid la sogs pa de mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa @40a * //
translated: That smoke, etc., definitely arises from that fire, or that being produced, etc.,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: is the nature of impermanence, etc.

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it possesses the relation characterized by having the nature of that or arising from that.

original: rtags ni go bar byed ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags ni go bar byed ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The reason is not the comprehender.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: 'on te gal te de la skyes pa'am de'i bdag nyid rtags yin pa de lta na yang ma 'khrul bar ji ltar shes she na /üîΩsmras pa / rang gi rgyu'am rang bzhin dag //
analyzed: 'on te gal te de la skyes pa'am de'i bdag nyid rtags yin pa de lta na yang ma 'khrul bar ji ltar shes she na / smras pa / rang gi rgyu'am rang bzhin dag //
translated: But if it is a reason that is produced in that or has that nature, then how is it known to be non-erroneous?üîΩWe say:

original: med par don ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: med par don ni yod ma yin //
translated: An object does not exist without its own cause or nature.

original: de dag dngos po mthong ba gang //
analyzed: de dag dngos po mthong ba gang //
translated: Whatever is seen as a thing

original: de nyid gzhan gyi mtshan nyid yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi mtshan nyid yin // zhes bya ba la /
