translated: has that nature and another nature.

original: rang bzhin te mi rtag pa dang / rang gi rgyu ste me la sogs pa med par byas pa dang yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: rang bzhin te mi rtag pa dang / rang gi rgyu ste me la sogs pa med par byas pa dang yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: An impermanent nature and its own cause, such as fire, do not exist without being produced and existing, respectively.

original: go rims bzhin du bdag nyid med pa dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du bdag nyid med pa dang rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In order, it would follow that they would be without self and without cause.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gang zhig bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid nges par mthong ba de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan du yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs gang zhig bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid nges par mthong ba de nyid kyi ngo bo nyid gzhan du yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Whatever effect and nature reasons are seen to have a nature that is invariably concomitant with the probandum, that very nature should be seen in another.

original: de yang de'i bu la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir des ma nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang de'i bu la sogs pa la med pa'i phyir des ma nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not uncertain because it does not exist for the son of a barren woman.

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa'i 'brel pa ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa'i 'brel pa ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the relation of non-apprehension?

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is the relation of identity and origination,

original: de lta na ni mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then non-apprehension is not a different reason.

original: 'on te 'brel pa med na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa med na ni de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if there is no relation, then it is not a reason.üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa // rang bzhin nam ni rang gi rgyu //
analyzed: smras pa // rang bzhin nam ni rang gi rgyu //
translated: If the nature or its own cause

original: snang rung dag ni mthong rgyu pa'i //
analyzed: snang rung dag ni mthong rgyu pa'i //
translated: is visible, it is seen.

original: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod gyur kyang //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dag ni yod gyur kyang //
translated: Even if other causes exist,

original: mi snang de ldan ni ji ltar yod //
analyzed: mi snang de ldan ni ji ltar yod //
translated: how can it be existent when it is not visible?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rang bzhin te shing ngam rang nyid kyi rgyu ste rgyu mtshan mi snang du rung ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin te shing ngam rang nyid kyi rgyu ste rgyu mtshan mi snang du rung ba ste /
translated: if the nature or its own cause, the reason, is visible,

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na ;
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na ;
translated: if the other causes of the eye, etc. exist,

original: mi snang ba ste mi dmigs par gyur pa /
analyzed: mi snang ba ste mi dmigs par gyur pa /
translated: it is not visible, it is not apprehended.

original: de ldan te /
analyzed: de ldan te /
translated: That is,

original: rgyu dang khyab byed dang ldan pas /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab byed dang ldan pas /
translated: if something is related to the cause and the pervader,

original: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba yod pa ji ltar gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba yod pa ji ltar gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: how could the effect and the pervaded exist? They could not!

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gang zhig 'brel pa 'di gnyis dang ldan pa de nyid ni 'di'i 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gang zhig 'brel pa 'di gnyis dang ldan pa de nyid ni 'di'i 'brel pa ste /
translated: The intended meaning is this: That which is related to these two is related to this.

original: gang du bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa de la 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang du bsgrub par bya bas khyab pa de la 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: Where the probandum is pervaded, the reason is understood to be either an effect or an essential property.

original: gang la bzlog pa'i 'brel pas khyab pa de la mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: gang la bzlog pa'i 'brel pas khyab pa de la mi dmigs pa gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Where the opposite is related to the pervasion, the reason is nonobservation.

original: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gsum ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gsum ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the three characteristics of effect, essential property, and nonobservation are established as inference.

original: gzhan @40b yang spyi'i blo ni tshad min na 'ang //
analyzed: gzhan @40b yang spyi'i blo ni tshad min na 'ang //
translated: Moreover, even if the cognition of a universal is not valid cognition,

original: de med thob 'gyur pha rol gyi //
analyzed: de med thob 'gyur pha rol gyi //
translated: it is obtained without it,

original: dngos bzhin gal te dbang rnams kyis //
analyzed: dngos bzhin gal te dbang rnams kyis //
translated: just as with the object of another sense faculty.

original: dus gzhan du ni rtogs 'gyur na //
analyzed: dus gzhan du ni rtogs 'gyur na //
translated: If it is understood at another time,

original: dbang po'i nus sogs la de min //
analyzed: dbang po'i nus sogs la de min //
translated: But not for the capacity of the sense faculty, etc.

original: dbang po blo ni med phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po blo ni med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cognition of the sense faculty.

original: med pa rtogs pa yin na ni //
analyzed: med pa rtogs pa yin na ni //
translated: If it is the cognition of a non-existent,

original: blo skye rgyu mtshan can min 'gyur //
analyzed: blo skye rgyu mtshan can min 'gyur //
translated: The arising of cognition would be causeless.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: gal te spyi'i blo tshad ma nyid ma yin na de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i blo tshad ma nyid ma yin na de lta na ni /
translated: if the cognition of the universal is not valid cognition, then in that case,

original: lkog tu gyur ba de med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur ba de med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the hidden would be non-existent,

original: 'jig rten pha rol nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol nyid bzhin no //
translated: just like the other world.

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa thams cad don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa thams cad don med pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that all hidden things are non-existent.

original: 'di ltar rnam grangs par rim gyis dbang po rnams kyi rtogs pa gang yin pa de yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam grangs par rim gyis dbang po rnams kyi rtogs pa gang yin pa de yod kyi /
translated: In this way, the cognition of the sense faculties is gradual and sequential, and that exists.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi dngos po ni dbang pos rnam grangs par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi dngos po ni dbang pos rnam grangs par 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But the entity of the other world is not engaged in the sense faculties in a sequential manner,

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do zhe na /
translated: therefore the other world does not exist.

original: de lta na ni gang gi tshe rtogs ba de'i tshe na yod par 'gyur cig /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang gi tshe rtogs ba de'i tshe na yod par 'gyur cig /
translated: If that is so, then when there is cognition, at that time it would exist.

original: gang gi tshe mngon sum la mi snang ba de'i tshe yod par gang gis shes pa yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mngon sum la mi snang ba de'i tshe yod par gang gis shes pa yin /
translated: But when it does not appear to direct perception, how can it be known to exist?

original: de bas na 'bras bu mthong ba dang 'bras bu de la gzhan du mi 'thad pas ;
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu mthong ba dang 'bras bu de la gzhan du mi 'thad pas ;
translated: Therefore, since it is untenable that the effect is different from the cause,

original: mig la sogs dang de'i nus pa yod par dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs dang de'i nus pa yod par dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: the eye and so on are inferred to be the potential of the effect.

original: gzhan yang rnam grangs kyis dbang po snang ba de yang dbang po dang rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i nus pa shes pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam grangs kyis dbang po snang ba de yang dbang po dang rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba'i nus pa shes pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the appearance of the sense faculty is also a sense faculty because it is the cause of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mig la sogs pa de la dbang po'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te dbang po la sogs pa med mod /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de la dbang po'i blo med pa'i phyir ro // 'on te dbang po la sogs pa med mod /
translated: Because the cognition of the sense faculty, such as the eye, does not exist.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúEven though the sense faculty does not exist,

original: de lta na yang dbang po rnams med par shes pa yod na /
analyzed: de lta na yang dbang po rnams med par shes pa yod na /
translated: the cognition exists without the sense faculty,‚Äù

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i blo skye ba rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i blo skye ba rgyu mtshan can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the cognition of the eye consciousness would not be a cognition that arises with a cause.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med na /
translated: Therefore, if there is no inference,

original: lkog tu gyur pa kun yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa kun yod pa ma yin no //
translated: all hidden phenomena do not exist.

original: 'on te spyi snga phyi'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum nyid kyi rtogs pa'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi snga phyi'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum nyid kyi rtogs pa'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThis fault does not exist because the existence of the universal is realized by direct perception that is endowed with the essence of the prior and subsequent,‚Äù

original: smras pa / rnam par rtog pa med nyid kyis //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par rtog pa med nyid kyis //
translated: Objection: Because of the absence of conceptuality,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon sum //üîΩde la spyi 'dzin rtog med pa //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon sum // de la spyi 'dzin rtog med pa //
translated: it is direct perception with regard to its own character.üîΩBut the apprehension of a universal is not non-conceptual,

original: ma yin de phyir rjes dpag yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ma yin de phyir rjes dpag yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: therefore it is inference.

original: spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni tha snyad 'dogs pa yin gyi /
translated: With regard to that, the consciousness that apprehends a universal is a nominal convention.

original: spyi la mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi la mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Direct perception does not engage a universal,

original: 'on kyang mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug ste de la rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug ste de la rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but rather direct perception engages its own character because it is non-conceptual.

original: rtog pa med par spyi 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa med par spyi 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not the apprehension of a universal without conceptuality,

original: spyi de rig par byed pa ni rdzas su dpag pa kho na yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //üîΩ'dis ni / gcig gsum grangs ni gsal ba yin //
analyzed: spyi de rig par byed pa ni rdzas su dpag pa kho na yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no // 'dis ni / gcig gsum grangs ni gsal ba yin //
translated: the awareness of that universal is only inferred substantially, it is not direct perception.üîΩThis establishes the statement,

original: zhes @41a * //üîΩbya ba de gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes @41a * //üîΩbya ba de gnas pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe number one is the manifest of three.‚Äù

original: 'o na ni gang 'di mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas kha dog la sogs pa 'dzin pa de ji ltar med pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gzhung bshad par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩgzhal bya des na kha dog gi //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang 'di mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas kha dog la sogs pa 'dzin pa de ji ltar med pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du gzhung bshad par bya ba'i phyir / gzhal bya des na kha dog gi //
translated: The treatise states:üîΩThe impermanence of color is not understood

original: mi rtag pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: through that object of comprehension.

original: de blo tshad ma gzhan yin te//
analyzed: de blo tshad ma gzhan yin te//
translated: That is another valid cognition,

original: rtags med par ni yod phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te //
analyzed: rtags med par ni yod phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te //
translated: because it exists without a reason.

original: gzhal bya rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid nges par gyur na /
analyzed: gzhal bya rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid nges par gyur na /
translated: When the object of comprehension, the specific and general characteristics, are ascertained,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: the impermanence of color, such as blue, etc. is not understood.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum gyis rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin la /
translated: In this way, direct perception apprehends the specific characteristic,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no ;
translated: while the object of inference is the general characteristic.

original: / spyi khyad par can ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: / spyi khyad par can ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: How can a specific universal be understood?

original: de yang yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang yod pa yin no //
translated: It also exists.

original: des na kha dog mi rtag pa de 'dzin pa ni tshad ma gzhan yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na kha dog mi rtag pa de 'dzin pa ni tshad ma gzhan yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of the impermanence of color would be another valid cognition.

original: rtags med par skyes  pas de ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags med par skyes  pas de ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not an inference because it is produced without a reason.

original: khyad par mthong ba yang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba yang rjes su dpag pas 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Also, the perception of a particular is apprehended by inference,

original: rtags ni spyi dang 'brel par mi rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni spyi dang 'brel par mi rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: because a reason is a different valid cognition from that, since it is not understood to be related to a universal.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: rtags kyi 'brel pa ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: rtags kyi 'brel pa ma rtogs phyir //
translated: Because the relation of the reason is not understood,

original: khyad par mthong ba gang yin pa //
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba gang yin pa //
translated: that which is the perception of a particular

original: de ni tshad ma gzhan yin te //
analyzed: de ni tshad ma gzhan yin te //
translated: is a different valid cognition.

original: gzhal bya mang phyir tshad ma ni //
analyzed: gzhal bya mang phyir tshad ma ni //
translated: Because there are many objects of comprehension,üîΩthere are many valid cognitions,

original: mang ba nyid dam gcig la yang //üîΩdu ma 'jug pa'i phyir na ste //
analyzed: mang ba nyid dam gcig la yang // du ma 'jug pa'i phyir na ste //
translated: or even one, because many are engaged.

original: dper na khyad par mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: dper na khyad par mthong ba bzhin //
translated: For example, it is like the perception of a particular.

original: yul la nges pa med phyir dang // gzhal bya gzhan ni yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yul la nges pa med phyir dang // gzhal bya gzhan ni yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no certainty about the object and because there are other objects of comprehension,

original: gcig gsum grangs kyang sel mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gsum grangs kyang sel mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the number one and three are not eliminated.

original: khyad par mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtags du ba la sogs pa spyi dang 'brel par ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rtags du ba la sogs pa spyi dang 'brel par ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: With regard to that, because the reason, such as smoke, which is the basis of the perception of a particular, is not understood to be related to a universal,

original: 'di ni me de nyid yin te du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes khyad par mthong ba de ni tshad ma gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni me de nyid yin te du ba yod pa'i phyir zhes khyad par mthong ba de ni tshad ma gzhan yin te /
translated: This perception of a distinction is another valid cognition.

original: mngon du rtogs pa dang bral bas mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: mngon du rtogs pa dang bral bas mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: It is not direct perception because it is devoid of manifest realization.

original: spyi'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not inference because it does not have a universal for its object.

original: de bas na gzhal bya mang po yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yang mang po yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzhal bya mang po yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yang mang po yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there are many objects of valid cognition, there are many valid cognitions.

original: gzhal bya gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal bya gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Because many valid cognitions engage one object of valid cognition,

original: yul gcig yin na yang tshad ma mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul gcig yin na yang tshad ma mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: even though the object is one, there are many valid cognitions.

original: gang gis du ma gcig la 'jug par mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis du ma gcig la 'jug par mthong zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúBy what means is it seen that many engage one object?‚Äù

original: dper na khyad par mthong ba dang lhan cig du mar 'jug ste /
analyzed: dper na khyad par mthong ba dang lhan cig du mar 'jug ste /
translated: For example, the perception of a distinction engages many simultaneously.

original: 'di ltar dang po me mngon sum gyis rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po me mngon sum gyis rtogs la /
translated: Thus, first fire is realized by direct perception.

original: yang dus phyis du ba mthong ba las me de nyid 'di yin no zhes @41b khyad par mthong ba can gyi tshad ma 'jug na'o //
analyzed: yang dus phyis du ba mthong ba las me de nyid 'di yin no zhes @41b khyad par mthong ba can gyi tshad ma 'jug na'o //
translated: Later, when one sees smoke, the valid cognition that perceives the distinction engages, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is that very fire.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir grangs gcig sel bar mi 'gyur zhing grangs gsum sel bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grangs gcig sel bar mi 'gyur zhing grangs gsum sel bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the number one is not eliminated, nor is the number three.

original: yul la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar yul gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yul la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar yul gcig la tshad ma du ma 'jug pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because there is no certainty with respect to the object.üîΩJust as many valid cognitions operate with respect to one object,

original: gzhal bya du ma la yang 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma gcig nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya du ma la yang 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma gcig nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, with respect to many objects of comprehension, a single valid cognition arises that apprehends them.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i spyi'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi yul yod pa'i phyir grangs gsum sel bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag las gzhan pa'i spyi'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi yul yod pa'i phyir grangs gsum sel bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is an object that is the nature of a universal of a universal, which is different from a universal and an individual characteristic, the number three is not eliminated.

original: 'dir lan smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa /
translated: Here, the reply is:

original: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: skyon 'dir thal bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: This fault does not arise,

original: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩkha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi sbyor ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro // zhes bya ba la / kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa nyid kyi spyi sbyor ba'i phyir te /
translated: because impermanence is applied to the universal of color.üîΩWith respect to the line, ‚Äúbecause impermanence is applied to the universal of color,‚Äù

original: kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: impermanence is applied to the universal of color because of statements such as ‚ÄúColor and so on are impermanent.‚Äù

original: gang 'di yul nges pa med pa dang gzhal bya gzhan yod pa'o zhes bya ba'i skyon de ni med de /
analyzed: gang 'di yul nges pa med pa dang gzhal bya gzhan yod pa'o zhes bya ba'i skyon de ni med de /
translated: The fault that the object is not ascertained and that another object of comprehension exists does not exist.

original: 'di ltar kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa'i spyi sbyor ba kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: 'di ltar kha dog gi spyi la mi rtag pa'i spyi sbyor ba kha dog la sogs pa mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'o//
translated: Thus, the application of the generality of impermanence to the generality of color is ‚Äúcolor, etc. is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de bas na de ni spyi kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na de ni spyi kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a generality.

original: 'o na gal te kha dog nyid la mi rtag pa nyid sbyor na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te kha dog nyid la mi rtag pa nyid sbyor na /
translated: But if impermanence is applied to color itself,

original: de lta na ni dngos po'i chos ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni dngos po'i chos ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: in that case, it would not be a property of an entity.

original: gang zhig gang dang ldan par rtogs pa de ni de nyid kyi chos yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang ldan par rtogs pa de ni de nyid kyi chos yin te /
translated: That which is understood to possess something is a property of that,

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i kha dog gi spyi rtogs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid spyi yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan pa'i kha dog gi spyi rtogs pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid spyi yin gyi rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because the generality of color is understood to possess impermanence, impermanence is a generality, but not a specifically characterized phenomenon.

original: smras pa / dngos med ngo bo min de nyid //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos med ngo bo min de nyid //
translated: Objection: It is not a nonentity, because it is not the nature of that.

original: de ltar grub par bsgrub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar grub par bsgrub pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to prove that,

original: gzhan la gzhan grub min zhe na //üîΩmin de de nyid grub phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan grub min zhe na // min de de nyid grub phyir ro //
translated: if you say that one thing is established by another,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: that is not so, because it is established by itself.üîΩReply: It is not so, because it is established by that.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence is not the nature of non-entity.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du de ltar grub pa gang yin pa khong du chud par de rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du de ltar grub pa gang yin pa khong du chud par de rab tu bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is established that very intrinsic identity is the nature of impermanence, etc., in order to understand that, it is thoroughly established.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid can du rab tu bsgrubs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid can du rab tu bsgrubs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the thorough establishment of the nature of impermanence is intrinsic identity itself.

original: 'on te gzhan spyi'i blos bzhag pa mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan par grub pas /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan spyi'i blos bzhag pa mi rtag pa nyid dang ldan par grub pas /
translated: But if it is established as possessing impermanence, which is posited by another, a general cognition,

original: gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the other, intrinsic identity, be established?

original: ma yin te ;
analyzed: ma yin te ;
translated: No, it cannot,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid skad cig ma'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid skad cig ma'i ngo bo nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that very intrinsic identity is established as the nature of momentariness.

original: 'o na gal te rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'brel pa med pa ste /
translated: Now, if conceptualization is not related to intrinsic identity,

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid de ltar grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid de ltar grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow can it be established as it appears, since its own characteristic does not appear?‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it cannot,

original: dngos po dang brgyud nas 'brel ba'i @42a * //
analyzed: dngos po dang brgyud nas 'brel ba'i @42a * //
translated: because it is related to the thing either directly or indirectly.

original: phyir ro // mngon du 'brel pa med kyang brgyud nas 'brel pa'i phyir rtog pa yang slu ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyir ro // mngon du 'brel pa med kyang brgyud nas 'brel pa'i phyir rtog pa yang slu ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Even though it is not directly related, it is indirectly related, and therefore conceptual cognition is also nondeceptive.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa bag chags dang 'brel pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa bag chags dang 'brel pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt conceptual cognition related to latent potentialities?

original: bag chags ni dngos por nges pa ma yin na /
analyzed: bag chags ni dngos por nges pa ma yin na /
translated: If latent potentialities are not ascertained as things,

original: de ji ltar brgyud nas kyang dngos po la rjes su dpag pa 'brel par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar brgyud nas kyang dngos po la rjes su dpag pa 'brel par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can they be related to things even indirectly?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa // dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
analyzed: smras pa // dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
translated: That thing just as it is

original: de de 'dra ba'i rtags sems kyi //
analyzed: de de 'dra ba'i rtags sems kyi //
translated: is the cause of the mind that is the sign of that.

original: rgyu yin de las de ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu yin de las de ltar 'gyur //
translated: From that, it arises in that way.

original: rtags can blo byung de phyir dngos //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtags can blo byung de phyir dngos //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: The cognition that has the sign arises from that. Therefore, it is a thing.

original: me dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyi dngos po gang zhig rgyur gyur pa'am khyab byed du gyur pa'i dngos po ji bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: me dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyi dngos po gang zhig rgyur gyur pa'am khyab byed du gyur pa'i dngos po ji bzhin pa ste /
translated: The reason is the smoke and the product that are the same as the thing that has the nature of fire and impermanence, etc.,

original: me'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i gzung ba dang / rtag pa las log pa de dang 'dra ba me dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags gang yin pa'i du ba dang byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: me'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i gzung ba dang / rtag pa las log pa de dang 'dra ba me dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rtags gang yin pa'i du ba dang byas pa nyid de /
translated: and the object of the cognition that has the aspect of fire and is the opposite of permanent.

original: de 'dzin par byed pa'i sems gang yin pa'i bsgrub bya'i de ma thag pa'i shes pa de'i rgyu yin no ;
analyzed: de 'dzin par byed pa'i sems gang yin pa'i bsgrub bya'i de ma thag pa'i shes pa de'i rgyu yin no ;
translated: The cognition that immediately follows the predicate is the cause of that cognition that apprehends the reason.

original: / rtags can gyi sems de las skyes pa ni de las byung ba ni rtags 'dzin gyi blo'o //
analyzed: / rtags can gyi sems de las skyes pa ni de las byung ba ni rtags 'dzin gyi blo'o //
translated: The cognition that has the reason is the cognition that apprehends the reason.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: me ma yin pa las log pa dang rtag pa las log par de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po me dang mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: me ma yin pa las log pa dang rtag pa las log par de ltar gyur pa'i dngos po me dang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: In the thing that is fire and impermanence, which is the opposite of non-fire and the opposite of permanent.

original: dngos po gang zhe na /üîΩgang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhe na / gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: What is the thing?üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúbecause‚Äù is ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas ;
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba dang 'brel pas ;
translated: It is connected with ‚Äútherefore.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sbyar te /
translated: Therefore, it is to be applied in that way.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rtags can gyi blo yin pa de'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rtags can gyi blo yin pa de'i phyir //
translated: Because it is a cognition that has a sign, therefore

original: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo //üîΩbrgyud nas dngos po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: de ltar rtags dang rtags can blo // brgyud nas dngos po nyid dang ni //
translated: In that way, the sign and the sign-possessor areüîΩCognitions that are indirectly related to the thing itself.

original: 'brel phyir de yi snang ba yis //üîΩstong yang slu byed ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel phyir de yi snang ba yis // stong yang slu byed ma yin no //
translated: Because they are related,üîΩEven though they are empty of the appearance of that,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not deceptive.

original: 'di la kha cig rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig rtsod par byed de /
translated: In this regard, someone argues:

original: rtags can gyi blo skabs kyis 'khrul pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rtags can gyi blo skabs kyis 'khrul pa yin gyi /
translated: The cognition that has the sign is mistaken in terms of the occasion,

original: rtags kyi blo ni ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: rtags kyi blo ni ma yin pa des na /
translated: but the cognition of the sign is not. Therefore,

original: ci'i phyir de brgyud nas 'brel pa dang mi slu bar brjod //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de brgyud nas 'brel pa dang mi slu bar brjod //
translated: why is it said that it is indirectly related and nondeceptive?

original: gzhan yang rtags kyi blo ni rtags kyi yul can te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtags kyi blo ni rtags kyi yul can te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the sign is the subject that has the sign.

original: de nyid las mngon du skye ba dang / dngos po snang ba can de yin na /
analyzed: de nyid las mngon du skye ba dang / dngos po snang ba can de yin na /
translated: It is born from that itself, and it is the one that has the appearance of the thing.

original: ji ltar rtags snang bas stang par 'gyur /üîΩ'on te mer snang bas stong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rtags snang bas stang par 'gyur / 'on te mer snang bas stong pa'i phyir /
translated: How can it be empty of the appearance of the sign?üîΩBut if it is said that it is empty because the appearance of fire is empty,

original: de'i snang bas stong par brjod na ni /
analyzed: de'i snang bas stong par brjod na ni /
translated: then it is said that it is empty of the appearance of that.

original: de lta na sngon po'i shes pa ser por snang bas stong pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na sngon po'i shes pa ser por snang bas stong pa ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, is not the consciousness of blue empty of the appearance of yellow?

original: de'i phyir de yang 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang 'khrul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that consciousness would be mistaken.

original: des na rtags kyi blo rtags snang ba can yin no //
analyzed: des na rtags kyi blo rtags snang ba can yin no //
translated: Thus, the inferential cognition has the appearance of the evidence.

original: rtags kyi blo ni me la slu bar mi byed pa nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rtags kyi blo ni me la slu bar mi byed pa nyid du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the inferential cognition does not deceive with regard to fire.

original: 'on te @42b rtags kyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod na ni //
analyzed: 'on te @42b rtags kyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas par 'dod na ni //
translated: But if you assert that the inferential cognition is conceptual,

original: de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: de yang mi bden te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: rtags kyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yin yang me'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags kyi shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa yin yang me'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Although the inferential cognition is conceptual, it is not a cognition of fire,

original: du ba la sogs pa la ni rtog pa med pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir rtags kyi shes pa 'khrul bar rung ba ma yin no zhe na //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa la ni rtog pa med pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'i phyir rtags kyi shes pa 'khrul bar rung ba ma yin no zhe na //
translated: because the nonconceptual cognition of smoke and so on is a valid cognition. Therefore, it is not tenable that the inferential cognition is mistaken.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: 'dir rtags kyi shes pa ni dngos po'i yul can du 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rtags kyi shes pa ni dngos po'i yul can du 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the inferential cognition is not asserted to be a cognition that has a real object.

original: de ma thag pa'i shes pa ni rtags kyi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i shes pa ni rtags kyi shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition that is immediately subsequent to the evidence is the inferential cognition.

original: bsgrub bya'i rdzas thogs pa'i shes pa yang ji ltar rtags yul yin pa de bzhin du bsgrub bya yang yul yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rdzas thogs pa'i shes pa yang ji ltar rtags yul yin pa de bzhin du bsgrub bya yang yul yin te /
translated: Just as the object of the cognition apprehending the object to be established is the evidence, so too the object to be established is the evidence.

original: bsgrub bya 'dzin pa med par de'i rjes thogs par rtogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bya 'dzin pa med par de'i rjes thogs par rtogs pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is not tenable that the cognition of the object to be established occurs subsequently without apprehending the object to be established.

original: rjes thogs pa'i shes pa yang dngos po brgyud nas 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes thogs pa'i shes pa yang dngos po brgyud nas 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The subsequent cognition is indirectly related to the object.

original: gang yang rtags kyi blo skabs su ma bab pa'o zhes zer ba de la smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang rtags kyi blo skabs su ma bab pa'o zhes zer ba de la smras pa /
translated: Now, someone might say, ‚ÄúThe cognition of the evidence is not the occasion for the cognition of the object to be established.‚Äù

original: rtags kyi shes pa ma 'khrul na rtags can gyi shes pa yang ma 'khrul bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags kyi shes pa ma 'khrul na rtags can gyi shes pa yang ma 'khrul bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the cognition of the evidence is nondeceptive, then the cognition of the object to be established is also nondeceptive.

original: 'di ltar spyir me'i rjes thogs par du ba rtogs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyir me'i rjes thogs par du ba rtogs nas /
translated: In general, having realized smoke in dependence on fire,

original: 'di na yang 'di me'i rdzas thogs pa yin no zhes khyad par du me med na mi 'byung bar rtogs shing /üîΩspyir rjes thogs pa'i shes pa ni rtags kyi shes pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di na yang 'di me'i rdzas thogs pa yin no zhes khyad par du me med na mi 'byung bar rtogs shing / spyir rjes thogs pa'i shes pa ni rtags kyi shes pa yin la /
translated: one realizes in particular that this smoke is in dependence on the substance of fire and that it does not occur without fire.üîΩIn general, the subsequent cognition is the cognition of the evidence.

original: khyad par du rjes thogs par shes pa ni rtags can gyi blo'o //
analyzed: khyad par du rjes thogs par shes pa ni rtags can gyi blo'o //
translated: In particular, the subsequent cognition is the cognition of the object to be established.

original: de'i phyir rtags kyi blo'i mi slu ba grub na rtags can gyi blo'i mi slu bar rtogs pa'i don du rtags kyi blo slu ba med par brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags kyi blo'i mi slu ba grub na rtags can gyi blo'i mi slu bar rtogs pa'i don du rtags kyi blo slu ba med par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, when the nondeceptiveness of the cognition of the reason is established, the nondeceptiveness of the cognition of the property possessor is understood. For this reason, it is said that the cognition of the reason is nondeceptive.

original: yang na rtags kyi blo ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: yang na rtags kyi blo ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: Or else, the cognition of the reason is an inference based on a natural reason.

original: de la ni rtags kyi blo gang yin de nyid rtags can gyi blo yin gyi /
analyzed: de la ni rtags kyi blo gang yin de nyid rtags can gyi blo yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the cognition of the reason is the same as the cognition of the property possessor.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni rtags can gyi blo tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs ni rtags can gyi blo tha dad pa yin no //
translated: But in the case of an inference based on an effect, the cognition of the property possessor is different from the cognition of the reason.

original: 'di ltar goms pa phul du byung ba la glo bur du du ba mthong ba las me rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar goms pa phul du byung ba la glo bur du du ba mthong ba las me rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when someone who is very familiar with the relation between smoke and fire sees smoke, he understands fire.

original: der 'brel pa dran pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der 'brel pa dran pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, he does not remember the relation between smoke and fire.

original: de bas na de ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags goms pa phul du byung ba las rtogs pa med pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: de bas na de ni du ba la sogs pa'i rtags goms pa phul du byung ba las rtogs pa med pa kho na yin pas /
translated: Therefore, that cognition of fire is produced from the mere perception of smoke, without the need for the memory of the relation between smoke and fire.

original: rtags 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni dpe'i rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur ba'i don ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni dpe'i rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur ba'i don ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition that apprehends the reason is the indicator of the hidden object by the nature of the relation of identity.

original: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa slu ba med pa yin na ji ltar 'khrul bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa slu ba med pa yin na ji ltar 'khrul bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if inference is nondeceptive, how can it be mistaken?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
analyzed: de dngos slu byed nyid min yang //
translated: Although it is not deceptive with respect to that,

original: 'khrul bar rnam par gzhag par mdzad //
analyzed: 'khrul bar rnam par gzhag par mdzad //
translated: it is posited as mistaken.

original: de dag de'i dngos stong pa yang //üîΩde yi ngo bor zhen phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de'i dngos stong pa yang // de yi ngo bor zhen phyir ro //
translated: Although those are empty of that entity,

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrtags dang rtags can de dag phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid @43a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rtags dang rtags can de dag phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid @43a * //
translated: it is because of the adherence to its entity.

original: kyis stong pa yin yang /
analyzed: kyis stong pa yin yang /
translated: Here, although those reasons and those that possess the reasons are empty of external entity,

original: phyi rol gyi dngos por zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos por zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the adherence to external things,

original: slu ba med pa yin yang 'khrul par rnam par gzhag go //üîΩgang gis gzhan du gnas pa'i don gzhan du ston pa'i shes pa de ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: slu ba med pa yin yang 'khrul par rnam par gzhag go // gang gis gzhan du gnas pa'i don gzhan du ston pa'i shes pa de ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: although they are nondeceptive, they are posited as mistaken.üîΩThat consciousness which reveals an object that exists elsewhere as if it existed right there is mistaken.

original: rjes su dpag pa thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po yang thun mong pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa de bas na 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa thun mong ma yin pa'i dngos po yang thun mong pa'i rang bzhin du 'dzin par byed pa de bas na 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Since inference apprehends a unique entity as a common entity, it is mistaken.

original: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa yin na ni dngos po snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa yin na ni dngos po snang ba dang bral ba'i phyir ji ltar thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if inference is mistaken, then how can one obtain the object, since it is devoid of appearance?

original: snang ba las thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba las thob pa ma yin te /
translated: One does not obtain it from appearance.

original: zhen pa las thob pa yin no //
analyzed: zhen pa las thob pa yin no //
translated: One obtains it from adherence.

original: 'di ltar zhugs par gyur na skye bos thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhugs par gyur na skye bos thob par 'gyur la /
translated: For if one engages in it, one obtains it.

original: 'jug par byed pa ni dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la yod na /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa ni dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa la yod na /
translated: And if inference exists, then one engages in it because of adherence to the thing.

original: ci ste thob par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci ste thob par byed pa ma yin /
translated: Why does it not cause one to obtain it?

original: 'di ltar don yod na thob par 'gyur gyi snang ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar don yod na thob par 'gyur gyi snang ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: For if the object exists, one obtains it, but not from appearance.

original: 'on te yod pa nyid kyang mngon sum la snang bas nges par byed kyi /üîΩrjes su dpag pa ni dngos po snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa nyid kyang mngon sum la snang bas nges par byed kyi / rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if existence is ascertained by the appearance in perception,

original: ji ltar dngos po yod par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po yod par rtogs she na /
translated: then how does inference understand the existence of the thing, since it does not have the appearance of the thing?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung ba las 'di'i yod pa grub pa de bzhin du 'brel par gyur pa'i rtags snang ba las lkog tu gyur pa'i yod pa ci ste mi 'grub /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum gyis gzung ba las 'di'i yod pa grub pa de bzhin du 'brel par gyur pa'i rtags snang ba las lkog tu gyur pa'i yod pa ci ste mi 'grub /
translated: Just as the existence of something is established from what is directly perceived, why wouldn‚Äôt the existence of something hidden be established from the appearance of a related reason?

original: snang bar gyur pa'i ngo bo tsam las 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to /
analyzed: snang bar gyur pa'i ngo bo tsam las 'jug pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to /
translated: It is not the case that engagement is from the mere appearance of an entity.

original: gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa nyid las 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa nyid las 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: It is definitely engagement from the ascertainment of existence.

original: snang bar gyur kyang 'khrul pas gang du yod par ma nges pa de rung 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang bar gyur kyang 'khrul pas gang du yod par ma nges pa de rung 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though something appears, if it is not ascertained as existent due to confusion, it is not suitable for engagement.

original: de bas na phyi rol du zhen pa kho na 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol du zhen pa kho na 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is only the conception of external things that causes engagement,

original: rjes su dpag pa slu ba med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa slu ba med pa nyid yin no //
translated: inference is undeceiving.

original: de phyir rtogs bya dngos po la //
analyzed: de phyir rtogs bya dngos po la //
translated: Therefore, with regard to the thing that is to be understood,

original: khyab bya sems kyi khyab byed ni //
analyzed: khyab bya sems kyi khyab byed ni //
translated: the pervaded mind is

original: de yi rang bzhin nam rgyu nyid //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin nam rgyu nyid //
translated: the nature or cause of that.

original: rgyu mtshan de yang de'i blo yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de yang de'i blo yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: That reason is also the mind of that.

original: rtogs par bya bar 'dod pa'i dngos po lkog tu gyur pa las khyab par byed pa'i bsgrub bya dang rgyu mtshan de rtags kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rtogs par bya bar 'dod pa'i dngos po lkog tu gyur pa las khyab par byed pa'i bsgrub bya dang rgyu mtshan de rtags kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The reason for the evidence is the probandum pervaded by the reason, which is the cause of the evidence.

original: gtan tshigs de'i rang bzhin dang rgyu'o//
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i rang bzhin dang rgyu'o//
translated: The nature of the reason and its cause are the evidence.

original: khyab par bya ba'i sems ni rjes thogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba'i sems ni rjes thogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The mind that is pervaded is the subsequent cognition.

original: rtags kyi sems mngon sum de yang khyab par byed pa'i blo'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyi sems mngon sum de yang khyab par byed pa'i blo'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That direct perception of the mind of the evidence is also the cause of the cognition of the pervasion.

original: 'o na mi dmigs pa ni 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na mi dmigs pa ni 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: Now, non-apprehension is not a relation,

original: 'brel pa med par go bar byed par mi rung ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par go bar byed par mi rung ba'i phyir la /
translated: because it is not suitable to be a comprehender without a relation.

original: 'brel pa yod na ni gtan tshigs gzhan du mi dmigs @43b par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na ni gtan tshigs gzhan du mi dmigs @43b par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there is a relation, then the evidence would not be non-apprehended elsewhere.üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / thams cad du ni mi dmigs pas //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad du ni mi dmigs pas //
translated: By non-apprehension everywhere,

original: dgag pa dag ni sgrub par byed //
analyzed: dgag pa dag ni sgrub par byed //
translated: negations are established.

original: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
translated: For those who speak of establishment by valid cognition,

original: bzlog pa'ang don gyis bstan pa yin //
analyzed: bzlog pa'ang don gyis bstan pa yin //
translated: the opposite is also taught by implication.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: sa'i steng la sogs pa'i yul thams cad la dgag pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad mi dmigs pa kho nas grub par byed pa dang / med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba yang mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa'i steng la sogs pa'i yul thams cad la dgag pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad mi dmigs pa kho nas grub par byed pa dang / med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba yang mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the negation of all objects such as the earth, etc. is established only by non-apprehension, and the suitability of the expression ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is also of the nature of non-apprehension.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can kho na'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can kho na'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the relation is only of the nature of identity.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma nyid kyis don grub par nges pa'o zhes smra ba rnams kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma nyid kyis don grub par nges pa'o zhes smra ba rnams kyis /
translated: Thus, those who say that the object is ascertained as established by the valid cognition itself,

original: don de shugs kyis 'di skad du bzlog pa tshad ma log pas don med pa grub pa'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: don de shugs kyis 'di skad du bzlog pa tshad ma log pas don med pa grub pa'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: by implication, they are saying that the object is established as non-existent by the cessation of the valid cognition.

original: yang na 'gal ba zhes bya bas kyang dngos sam brgyud nas 'brel pa gzhan yod pas de las med par rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang na 'gal ba zhes bya bas kyang dngos sam brgyud nas 'brel pa gzhan yod pas de las med par rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Or, by the word ‚Äúcontradictory,‚Äù is it not the case that another relation, either direct or indirect, exists, and from that non-existence is understood?

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de me yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúHere there is no cold touch because there is fire.‚Äù

original: 'di la spu langs pa la sogs pa med de me'i khyad par nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya de ji ltar mi dmigs pa kho nas med pa'i tha snyad grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di la spu langs pa la sogs pa med de me'i khyad par nye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya de ji ltar mi dmigs pa kho nas med pa'i tha snyad grub ce na /
translated: How is it that the convention of non-existence is established by non-apprehension alone?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa // de'am de yi rgyu 'gog la //
analyzed: smras pa // de'am de yi rgyu 'gog la //
translated: The negation of that or its cause,

original: de dang 'gal ba'i chos brjod pa //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i chos brjod pa //
translated: The expression of a property contradictory to it,

original: mthong ba gang yin de nyid la //
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin de nyid la //
translated: That which is seen, in that very thing,

original: de ni tshad med nyid du bstan //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni tshad med nyid du bstan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Is taught to be non-apprehension.

original: gang zhig 'gal ba'i chos su bstan pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'gal ba'i chos su bstan pa mthong ba ste /
translated: That which is taught as a contradictory property is seen.

original: 'di gang dang 'gal ba zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gang dang 'gal ba zhe na /
translated: What is it contradictory to?

original: dgag par bya ba'i grang ba de'am de'i rgyu dgag par bya ba spu langs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa'i'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba'i grang ba de'am de'i rgyu dgag par bya ba spu langs pa la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa'i'o //
translated: The negation of that or its cause. The negation of the negatee, cold, or its cause, the cause of horripilation, etc., the cold touch.

original: de yang 'gal ba'i dngos po dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'gal ba'i dngos po dmigs pa ste /
translated: That also is the apprehension of a contradictory entity.

original: dgag par bya ba de nyid tshad ma med pa nyid du bstan pa ni mi dmigs pa ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba de nyid tshad ma med pa nyid du bstan pa ni mi dmigs pa ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The teaching of that very negatee as being without a valid cognition is the teaching of non-apprehension.

original: 'gal ba la 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba la 'brel pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no relation in contradiction.

original: 'gal ba ni me dang grang ba yin pas grang ba'i reg pa dang 'brel par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni me dang grang ba yin pas grang ba'i reg pa dang 'brel par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: The contradiction is between heat and cold, so it is not maintained that heat is related to cold.

original: 'on te grang ba'i reg pa nyid med pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis yongs su 'jal bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te grang ba'i reg pa nyid med pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis yongs su 'jal bar byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that heat is related to the mere absence of cold,

original: 'o na ni med pa kho nas 'brel par shes par bya'i med pa dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni med pa kho nas 'brel par shes par bya'i med pa dang 'gal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: then it is known to be related to mere absence, not to the absence of cold.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa kho na med pa'i sgrub byed yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa kho na med pa'i sgrub byed yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension alone is the proof of absence.

original: gzhan du chos gcig yod brjod pas //
analyzed: gzhan du chos gcig yod brjod pas //
translated: Otherwise, if the existence of one thing

original: gzhan med na de gang gis rtogs //
analyzed: gzhan med na de gang gis rtogs //
translated: is expressed as the non-existence of another, how is that known?

original: 'gal nas yin na de yang ni //
analyzed: 'gal nas yin na de yang ni //
translated: If it is by contradiction, how is that established?

original: cis grub lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
analyzed: cis grub lhan cig mi gnas phyir //
translated: Because they do not coexist, you say.

original: zhe na de yang gang las 'dod //
analyzed: zhe na de yang gang las 'dod //
translated: But how is that known?

original: gal te snang rung mthong med phyir //
analyzed: gal te snang rung mthong med phyir //
translated: If it is because the visible is not seen,

original: @44a * // zhe na de ni tshad med min //
analyzed: @44a * // zhe na de ni tshad med min //
translated: that is not a valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here is the verse:

original: gzhan du na gal te 'gal ba dmigs pas dgag par bya ba'i mi dmigs pa mi 'phel na de'i me la sogs pa'i chos cig yod par brjod pa las /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te 'gal ba dmigs pas dgag par bya ba'i mi dmigs pa mi 'phel na de'i me la sogs pa'i chos cig yod par brjod pa las /
translated: Otherwise, if the non-observation of the object of negation is not enhanced by the observation of a contradictory object, then the existence of fire and so on would be established by the mere statement of its existence.

original: gzhan grang ba med par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan grang ba med par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if the non-apprehension of the object to be refuted is not increased by the apprehension of the contradictory, then how could the absence of cold be understood from the statement that fire exists?

original: dngos po gzhan brjod pas dngos po dgag par mi rigs pa'i phyir te ha cang thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan brjod pas dngos po dgag par mi rigs pa'i phyir te ha cang thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not logical to refute an entity by stating another entity, since that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: 'on te gang na 'gal ba yod pa de dmigs pas gzhan med par rtogs pa'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /üîΩ'di lhan cig mi gnas pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te gang na 'gal ba yod pa de dmigs pas gzhan med par rtogs pa'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na / 'di lhan cig mi gnas pa'am /
translated: But if you say that this fault does not exist because the absence of another is understood from the apprehension of that which has a contradictory,üîΩis that contradiction not characterized by the non-coexistence

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: or mutual exclusion of two things?

original: gang gis de'i dbang gis med pa 'grub par 'gyur ba de tshad ma gang gis grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis de'i dbang gis med pa 'grub par 'gyur ba de tshad ma gang gis grub par 'gyur /
translated: By what valid cognition is that established?

original: 'on te lhan cig mi gnas pas 'gal bar shes te /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig mi gnas pas 'gal bar shes te /
translated: Or is it known as contradictory because of non-coexistence?

original: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa gang na lhan cig gnas pa de na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gzugs dang ro la sogs pa gang na lhan cig gnas pa de na 'gal ba med do //
translated: In the case of form and taste, etc., where they coexist, there is no contradiction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir der gzugs dmigs pas ro med par shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir der gzugs dmigs pas ro med par shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not that one knows that there is no taste by observing form.

original: 'o na ma dang grang ba lhan cig mi gnas par 'di nyid tshad ma gang gis rtogs par byed /
analyzed: 'o na ma dang grang ba lhan cig mi gnas par 'di nyid tshad ma gang gis rtogs par byed /
translated: But by what valid cognition do you know that heat and cold do not coexist?

original: 'on te snang du rung ba grang ba'i rigs pa ni me mthong ba'i tshad ma mthong ba'i phyir lhan cig mi gnas par grub po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang du rung ba grang ba'i rigs pa ni me mthong ba'i tshad ma mthong ba'i phyir lhan cig mi gnas par grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the reason that cold is not seen is because the valid cognition that sees fire also sees it,

original: 'o na ni sngar 'gal ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid ma dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni sngar 'gal ba 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid ma dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that which previously apprehended the contradiction would itself become non-observation.

original: gal te de lta na ni 'gal ba ni mi dmigs pas shes kyang /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni 'gal ba ni mi dmigs pas shes kyang /
translated: If that is so, then although contradiction is known by non-observation,

original: rtags de las med bar rtogs kyi mi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtags de las med bar rtogs kyi mi dmigs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: one understands that there is no fire from that reason, but not from non-observation.

original: 'on kyang 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa sngon nas yod pas de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'gal ba'i rtags las med par rtogs kyang mi dmigs pa nyid las rnam par 'jog go zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gal ba sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa sngon nas yod pas de'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'gal ba'i rtags las med par rtogs kyang mi dmigs pa nyid las rnam par 'jog go zhe na ;
translated: But since the proof of contradiction is non-observation, one follows that and understands that there is no fire from the reason of contradiction, but it is posited from non-observation itself.

original: gal te de lta na ni mngon sum gyis 'brel pa nges pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i du bas me rtogs par mngon sum kho nas 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni mngon sum gyis 'brel pa nges pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba'i du bas me rtogs par mngon sum kho nas 'gyur bas /
translated: If that is so, then since the cognition of fire by the smoke that accompanies the perception that ascertains the relation would be perception,

original: de ji ltar rjes su dpag pas tshad mas gzhan yod par 'grub //
analyzed: de ji ltar rjes su dpag pas tshad mas gzhan yod par 'grub //
translated: how could the existence of the other be established by inference?

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa'i me la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir de la rjes su dpog pa'o zhes me dang med pa lkog tu gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa'i me la mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir de la rjes su dpog pa'o zhes me dang med pa lkog tu gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if you say that since perception does not engage with hidden fire, it is inferred, then is not fire and smoke hidden?

original: de la ji ltar rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la ji ltar rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How could inference engage with that?

original: mi snang bar mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: mi snang bar mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Non-apprehension of the non-appearing is not a valid cognition.

original: 'on te dran par gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pas da ltar 'gal ba can dang bral ba rtogs par @44b byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dran par gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pas da ltar 'gal ba can dang bral ba rtogs par @44b byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the non-apprehension of the object of memory that has become an object of apprehension realizes the present that is free from contradiction,

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: dran pa ni 'brel pa dran pa ste mngon sum yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa ni 'brel pa dran pa ste mngon sum yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Memory is the recollection of a relation. Since it is perception, inference is meaningless.

original: de bas na 'dir 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning here is this:

original: grang ba med pa dang lhan cig me sngar dmigs la /
analyzed: grang ba med pa dang lhan cig me sngar dmigs la /
translated: Fire is observed previously, together with the absence of cold.

original: yul gzhan du ni mi dmigs pas grang ba med par grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gzhan du ni mi dmigs pas grang ba med par grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And since it is not observed in another place, the absence of cold is established.

original: med pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: For the non-existent is just non-observation.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed de dper na mngon sum du grub pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pas med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par byed de dper na mngon sum du grub pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, non-existence is established by the convention of non-observation, which is established by inference, just as it is established by direct perception.

original: gang gi tshe spu langs pa la sogs pa med par grub pa de'i tshe mes grang ba mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe spu langs pa la sogs pa med par grub pa de'i tshe mes grang ba mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: When the absence of horripilation, etc. is established, then by fire the absence of cold is observed.

original: grang ba mi dmigs pa des spu langs pa la sogs pa med par grub pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba mi dmigs pa des spu langs pa la sogs pa med par grub pa'o //
translated: And by that non-observation of cold, the absence of horripilation, etc. is established.

original: de la me'i ngo bo nyid kyis dro ba'i rang bzhin gyis reg pa tshogs pa gcig la 'brel pas rjes su dpog cing /
analyzed: de la me'i ngo bo nyid kyis dro ba'i rang bzhin gyis reg pa tshogs pa gcig la 'brel pas rjes su dpog cing /
translated: In that case, the nature of fire is the essence of heat. The contact of the two is related in a single collection, and so is inferred.

original: dro ba'i reg pa ni grang ba'i reg pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid can no //
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa ni grang ba'i reg pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid can no //
translated: And the contact of heat is the essence of the absence of the contact of cold.

original: de rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa nyid grang ba'i reg pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su dpag pas dmigs pa nyid grang ba'i reg pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-apprehension of the object itself, cold touch, is inferred from that.

original: de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kho na grang ba'i reg pa med par rtogs par byed pa yin gyi rtags gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kho na grang ba'i reg pa med par rtogs par byed pa yin gyi rtags gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only the effect-reason makes one understand the non-existence of cold touch, and not another reason.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i mi dmigs pa nyid med pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, non-apprehension, which is established by inference, itself makes one understand non-existence.

original: de phyir rang sgras brjod na yang //
analyzed: de phyir rang sgras brjod na yang //
translated: Therefore, even though it is expressed by its own word,

original: de ni med pa'i sgrub byed yin ;üîΩ/ gang gi tshad ma min ba des //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i sgrub byed yin ; / gang gi tshad ma min ba des //
translated: it is a proof of non-existence.

original: dgag pa kun du brjod par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag pa kun du brjod par bya // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should state a negation by that which is not a valid cognition.

original: rang gi sgra ste mi dmigs pa'i sgras brjod pa'am /
analyzed: rang gi sgra ste mi dmigs pa'i sgras brjod pa'am /
translated: This is its own word, expressed by the word non-apprehension,

original: ma brjod kyang mi dmigs pa de nyid med pa grub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma brjod kyang mi dmigs pa de nyid med pa grub par byed pa yin no //
translated: or even if not expressed, that very non-apprehension establishes non-existence.

original: 'on te mi dmigs pa ji ltar tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mi dmigs pa ji ltar tshad ma yin te /
translated: But how can non-apprehension be a valid cognition?üîΩValid cognition has an existent object.

original: tshad ma dngos po'i yul can yin no zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: tshad ma dngos po'i yul can yin no zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rgol ba dang gang zhig mi dmigs pa de tshad ma ma yin par 'dod pa des rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rgol ba dang gang zhig mi dmigs pa de tshad ma ma yin par 'dod pa des rnam pa thams cad du dgag pa brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: The opponent who maintains that non-apprehension is not a valid cognition should not express a negation in any way,

original: dgag pa la rnam pa gzhan dag med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes ni de dang 'gal don gyi //
analyzed: dgag pa la rnam pa gzhan dag med pa'i phyir ro // des ni de dang 'gal don gyi //
translated: because there is no other form of negation.üîΩBy that, he teaches the expression of the effect

original: 'bras bu brjod par bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu brjod par bstan pa yin //
translated: which is the opposite of the object.üîΩOnly the combination of the two

original: kun du sbyar ba 'ba' zhig dag / tha dad don la tha dad med //
analyzed: kun du sbyar ba 'ba' zhig dag / tha dad don la tha dad med //
translated: is different from the different objects.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: thams cad du mi dmigs par smra ba'i rigs pa 'di ni grang ba dang 'gal ba'i don mi ste /
analyzed: thams cad du mi dmigs par smra ba'i rigs pa 'di ni grang ba dang 'gal ba'i don mi ste /
translated: this reasoning of the proponent of non-apprehension is not the opposite of cold,

original: de'i 'bras bu du bar brjod pa de bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu du bar brjod pa de bstan te /
translated: but teaches the expression of its effect, smoke.

original: de la yang rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpog pas bsgrubs pa'i med pa go bar byed de /
analyzed: de la yang rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpog pas bsgrubs pa'i med pa go bar byed de /
translated: And there, the non-existence established by inference is understood by inference.

original: 'di ltar du @45a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar du @45a * //
translated: Thus,

original: ba las me grub la des grang ba med par sgrub ste /
analyzed: ba las me grub la des grang ba med par sgrub ste /
translated: from smoke, fire is established, and by that, cold is established as non-existent,

original: me grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: me grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: because fire has the nature of being without cold.

original: de bas na du ba las me ste /
analyzed: de bas na du ba las me ste /
translated: Therefore, from smoke, fire is established,üîΩand from that, cold is established as non-existent.

original: me grang ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas grang ba med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: me grang ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas grang ba med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa'o //
translated: Since fire is by nature not cold, the expression ‚Äúnot cold‚Äù is established.

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa thams cad la sbyor ba'i tshig dgod pa tsam gyis khyad par las don la ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs pa thams cad la sbyor ba'i tshig dgod pa tsam gyis khyad par las don la ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: Therefore, in all cases of nonapprehension, there is no difference in the meaning of the expressions, which are merely set forth for the sake of particular applications.

original: 'o na med pa'i sbyor ba gzhan yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'o na med pa'i sbyor ba gzhan yang mthong ste /
translated: Well, then, we see other applications of the term ‚Äúnonexistence,‚Äù

original: dper na sbyin pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: dper na sbyin pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu med de /
translated: for example, ‚ÄúThose who have the thought of generosity have no cause for high status,

original: de ma thag tu 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the effect is not seen immediately.‚ÄùüîΩWe reply:üîΩSince there is no expression of contradiction,üîΩand since it is not obscured,

original: smras pa // 'gal ba brjod pa med pas dang // de yang thabs bcas bsgribs med par //
analyzed: smras pa // 'gal ba brjod pa med pas dang // de yang thabs bcas bsgribs med par //
translated: it is a negation.

original: dgag la tshad smra gang yin te //
analyzed: dgag la tshad smra gang yin te //
translated: Those who speak of valid cognitions

original: rigs pa'i rjes 'brangs can min te //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes 'brangs can min te //
translated: are not followers of reasoning.üîΩJust as in the case of ‚Äúknowing all,‚Äù

original: smra ba la sogs la kun shes dang // 'jig rten gzhan sogs 'gog pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba la sogs la kun shes dang // 'jig rten gzhan sogs 'gog pa bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and in the case of the negation of another world, and so on.

original: 'gal ba'i me la sogs pa dang bsgribs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i me la sogs pa dang bsgribs pa ste /
translated: Here, ‚Äúcontradiction‚Äù is like the contradiction between fire and water. ‚ÄúObscuration‚Äù is like the obscuration of the moon by clouds.

original: gags mi byed pa dang / du ba la sogs pa yang brjod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gags mi byed pa dang / du ba la sogs pa yang brjod pa med pa ste /
translated: and the non-obstruction of smoke, etc.

original: ma brjod na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brjod na 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are not mentioned, because if they are not mentioned, they are not apprehended.

original: 'dis ni dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur ba mi dmigs par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dmigs pa'i reg byar gyur ba mi dmigs par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the non-apprehension of the object of apprehension is not apprehended.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dgag par bya ba ni dmigs par ma bstan pa dang rgyu dang khyab byed la sogs pa mi dmigs par ma bstan pa'i thabs dang bcas pa de yang dgag par bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma smra bar byed
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i dgag par bya ba ni dmigs par ma bstan pa dang rgyu dang khyab byed la sogs pa mi dmigs par ma bstan pa'i thabs dang bcas pa de yang dgag par bsgrub par bya ba la tshad ma smra bar byed
translated: The one who, having the characteristic as taught, is endowed with the object of negation, and is not taught as the object of apprehension, and is not taught as the non-apprehension of the cause, the pervasion, etc., and also has the method, that negation is to be established.

original: pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The one who speaks of the valid cognition, that is devoid of reasoning.

original: dper na smra ba la sogs pa las thams cad shes pa med pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na smra ba la sogs pa las thams cad shes pa med pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, like the one who speaks, etc., who does not know everything.

original: smra ba ni thams cad shes pa dang 'gal ba ma mthong ba de bzhin du bgrod par bya ba'i 'jig rten pa rol la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa'i mi dmigs pas med par 'gog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba ni thams cad shes pa dang 'gal ba ma mthong ba de bzhin du bgrod par bya ba'i 'jig rten pa rol la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur pa'i mi dmigs pas med par 'gog pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as it is not seen that speech is incompatible with knowing everything, in the same way, the world that is to be traversed, such as the pleasure grove, is not refuted as nonexistent by nonapprehension, which is not an object of perception.

original: 'on te gang smra ba de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig spyod par mthong ba de bas na brjod par 'dod pa'i smra ba ni gdon mi za bar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang smra ba de ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig spyod par mthong ba de bas na brjod par 'dod pa'i smra ba ni gdon mi za bar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if it is seen that speech is concomitant with attachment and so on, then the speech that is the object of assertion is undoubtedly concomitant with attachment and so on.

original: smras pa // don rnams dbang po las 'das pa //
analyzed: smras pa // don rnams dbang po las 'das pa //
translated: In response to that, Aryadeva says:

original: 'gal ba grub pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba grub pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradictionüîΩin the nonperception of imperceptible objects.

original: gal te smra rigs yod gyur na //üîΩgnod bya gnod byed ngo bo gang //
analyzed: gal te smra rigs yod gyur na // gnod bya gnod byed ngo bo gang //
translated: If speech were reasonable,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: what would be the nature of the object of refutation and the means of refutation?

original: gal te smra ba la thams cad rig pa yod par gyur kyang gang dang yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo med de /
