analyzed: gal te smra ba la thams cad rig pa yod par gyur kyang gang dang yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i ngo bo med de /
translated: Here, if speech were to exist, then even if everything were known, there would be no nature of the object of refutation and the means of refutation.

original: dbang @45b po las 'das pa'i don thams cad rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang @45b po las 'das pa'i don thams cad rig pa la sogs pa rnams dang 'gal ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that all supersensible objects are contradictory to awareness, etc.

original: smra ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Speech is not contradictory to omniscience.

original: de 'dra mi dmigs pas she na //
analyzed: de 'dra mi dmigs pas she na //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIt is not observed to be like that,‚Äù

original: de nyid sgrub par byed par brjod //
analyzed: de nyid sgrub par byed par brjod //
translated: we reply, that itself is said to be the proof.

original: ces bya ba ni de ltar yin du chug kyang /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de ltar yin du chug kyang /
translated: This is the reply: Even if that is so,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de 'dra ba ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir med par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de 'dra ba ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir med par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: you may think that omniscience does not exist because it is not observed to be like that.

original: 'o na ni mi dmigs pa de nyid dgag pa'i tan tshig su brjod par bya ba'i smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'o na ni mi dmigs pa de nyid dgag pa'i tan tshig su brjod par bya ba'i smra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Well then, what is the point of the statement, ‚ÄúBecause it is not observed, that itself is said to be the proof‚Äù?

original: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa med pas sgrub pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad mkhyen pa med pas sgrub pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the proof of the nonexistence of omniscience is just nonobservation,

original: mi dmigs pa ni 'di 'dra ba'ang//
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni 'di 'dra ba'ang//
translated: we reply, nonobservation is also like this:

original: 'bras bu nges med can rab brjod //
analyzed: 'bras bu nges med can rab brjod //
translated: it is said to be the result of an indefinite reason.

original: de phyir shin tu lkog gyur la //üîΩyod med nyid du nges pa med //
analyzed: de phyir shin tu lkog gyur la // yod med nyid du nges pa med //
translated: Therefore, with regard to something extremely obscure,

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: it is not ascertained as existent or nonexistent.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi dmigs pa 'di 'dra ba ni med par nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //üîΩgal te chos ni tha dad pa'am //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi dmigs pa 'di 'dra ba ni med par nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan to // gal te chos ni tha dad pa'am //
translated: This kind of non-apprehension, which is merely not seeing, does not ascertain non-existence.üîΩIf the property is stated as different,

original: tha dad med kyang rab sbyor te //üîΩdper na kha ba med sgrub me'am //
analyzed: tha dad med kyang rab sbyor te // dper na kha ba med sgrub me'am //
translated: or even if it is not different,üîΩit is like proving the absence of snow by fire,

original: skye la yod pa gnod byed bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i chos te 'dzin pa tha dad par brjod dam /
analyzed: skye la yod pa gnod byed bzhin // zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i chos te 'dzin pa tha dad par brjod dam /
translated: or like the refutation of existence in production.üîΩThis is a contradictory property. Is it stated as a different property-possessor,

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa'i chos nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa'i chos nyid du brjod de /
translated: or is it stated as a property-possessor that is not different?

original: dper na kha ba med par bsgrub par bya ba la me ni chos can dang grang ba las tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: dper na kha ba med par bsgrub par bya ba la me ni chos can dang grang ba las tha dad pa'am /
translated: For example, in proving the absence of snow, fire is either different from the property-possessor,

original: skye ba la gnod par byed pa'i yong pa ni de chos can las tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: skye ba la gnod par byed pa'i yong pa ni de chos can las tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: or the refutation of existence in production is not different from that property-possessor,

original: skye ba las kyang tha mi dad de yod pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba nyid de /
analyzed: skye ba las kyang tha mi dad de yod pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba nyid de /
translated: and it is also not different from production. Existence and non-existence are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive.

original: yod pa nyid skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Existence itself is not production.

original: yod pa ni thams cad la rag ma las pa'i phyir skye ba'i don ci zhig yod /
analyzed: yod pa ni thams cad la rag ma las pa'i phyir skye ba'i don ci zhig yod /
translated: Because that which exists does not depend on anything else, what purpose would there be in its arising?

original: 'o na yod pa dang skye ba dag tha mi dad na 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yod pa dang skye ba dag tha mi dad na 'gal bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if existence and arising are not different, how could there be a contradiction?

original: gzhan gyis tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de ltar brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir de ltar brjod do //
translated: We say this because others accept that they are not different.

original: 'o na gal te mi dmigs pa tsam nges par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mi dmigs pa tsam nges par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: But if non-apprehension alone does not ascertain,

original: de lta na ni rtog pa nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rtog pa nges par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: then how could conceptual cognition ascertain?

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang bral ba dang / sgrub pa dang bral ba'i don thams cad cig car mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa de yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang bral ba dang / sgrub pa dang bral ba'i don thams cad cig car mthong bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because that non-apprehension of what is perceptible does not exist, it is impossible to see all objects simultaneously that are devoid of the probandum and devoid of the proof.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / ji ltar dngos rnams bsgrub pa la //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar dngos rnams bsgrub pa la //
translated: In establishing entities,

original: dngos po kho na sgrub byed yin //
analyzed: dngos po kho na sgrub byed yin //
translated: only entities are the means of establishment.

original: de ltar dngos rnams rang ldog par //
analyzed: de ltar dngos rnams rang ldog par //
translated: In the same way, in the negation of entities,

original: dngos po nyid ni ldog byed yin //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni ldog byed yin //
translated: only entities are the means of negation.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the following is said:

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa @46a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa @46a * //
translated: It is not the case that they are negated merely by not being seen.üîΩ

original: nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mere non-perception of the pervasion is the cause of the reversal of the pervasion.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar 'brel pa nges pa las dngos po nyid du ba la sogs pas me la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar 'brel pa nges pa las dngos po nyid du ba la sogs pas me la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams sgrub par byed pa ni bsgrub pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: But, just as the existence of fire, etc. is established by the existence of smoke, etc. on the basis of the ascertainment of the relation, so the existence of the effect, etc. is refuted on the basis of the ascertainment of the relation.

original: de ltar 'brel pa nges pa las rgyur 'dod pa dang / khyab byed du 'dod pa'i dngos po nyid kyis 'bras bur 'dod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams zlog par byed pa ni rang ldog pa yod na ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'brel pa nges pa las rgyur 'dod pa dang / khyab byed du 'dod pa'i dngos po nyid kyis 'bras bur 'dod pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams zlog par byed pa ni rang ldog pa yod na ste /
translated: Thus, the existence of the effect, etc. which is accepted as the cause, or accepted as the pervaded, is refuted by the existence of the pervader, etc. which is accepted as the cause, or accepted as the pervader.

original: gal te rang nyid la log par nges pa de'i tshe'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te rang nyid la log par nges pa de'i tshe'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reversal of the pervasion is established when the reversal of the pervasion is ascertained with regard to itself.

original: des ni 'ga' zhig na yod phyir //üîΩrtog pas sbyar zhing bzhag pa yi //
analyzed: des ni 'ga' zhig na yod phyir // rtog pas sbyar zhing bzhag pa yi //
translated: The meaning is that it is at that time.üîΩBy that, he says:üîΩThe property of the similar instance and the dissimilar instance,

original: phyogs dang mthun phyogs cig shos la //üîΩsogs pa'i chos ni bsal ba yin //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun phyogs cig shos la // sogs pa'i chos ni bsal ba yin //
translated: which is posited and connected by thought,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is eliminatedüîΩbecause it exists somewhere.

original: dngos po go bar byed par bstan pa des ni rtog pas sgro btags pa'i chos phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang gzhan pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po go bar byed par bstan pa des ni rtog pas sgro btags pa'i chos phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang gzhan pa nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: The demonstration of the establishment of the entity refutes the thesis that the property of the position and the other are superimposed by conceptualization.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni yod par khas blangs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni yod par khas blangs pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the acceptance of existence, and so on.

original: yang phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang gzhan pa dag ji ltar dngos por mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang gzhan pa dag ji ltar dngos por mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how could the property of the position and the other not be entities?

original: gang yang rung ba zhig na yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig na yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they exist in one or the other.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang gzhan pa nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig la yang 'brel par nges pa ma ma yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs dang gzhan pa nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag gcig la yang 'brel par nges pa ma ma yin pa'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The property of the position and the other are not establishing factors because they are not ascertained as related to either the permanent or the impermanent.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so.

original: gal te 'brel pa nges pas gcig log na gzhan ldog pa de lta na ni 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba log na yang rgyu dang khyab byed ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa nges pas gcig log na gzhan ldog pa de lta na ni 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba log na yang rgyu dang khyab byed ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the reversal of one is ascertained as related to the reversal of the other, then the reversal of the effect and the pervaded would be the reversal of the cause and the pervader.

original: smras pa / de la'ang khyab par byed pa'i chos //
analyzed: smras pa / de la'ang khyab par byed pa'i chos //
translated: Objection: In that case, the property of the pervader

original: ldog pa khyab bya go byed yin //
analyzed: ldog pa khyab bya go byed yin //
translated: is the indicator of the reversal of the pervaded.

original: gal te rang nyid zlog pa ni //
analyzed: gal te rang nyid zlog pa ni //
translated: If the pervader itself is reversed,

original: rnam 'gas yongs su gcod na'o //
analyzed: rnam 'gas yongs su gcod na'o //
translated: then in some way it is eliminated.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gcig log pas gzhan ldog pa de la yang khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid dang me la sogs pa'i chos log na /üîΩkhyab par bya ba du ba dang byas pa la sogs pa ldog pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig log pas gzhan ldog pa de la yang khyab par byed pa mi rtag pa nyid dang me la sogs pa'i chos log na / khyab par bya ba du ba dang byas pa la sogs pa ldog pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: If the pervader, such as impermanence or fire, is reversed, then the reversal of the pervaded, such as being a product or smoke, is indicated.

original: gal te khyab par byed pa rang nyid zlog pa rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te khyab par byed pa rang nyid zlog pa rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yongs su gcod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the pervader itself is reversed in some way, then it is eliminated.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang med pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin nam /üîΩdes na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa kho na ci ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yang med pa'i go bar byed pa ma yin nam / des na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa kho na ci ste /
translated: In that case, isn‚Äôt the nonobservation of a nature also an indicator of nonexistence?

original: go bar byed par brjod ce na /üîΩsmras pa / tshad ma nyid med gang de nyid //
analyzed: go bar byed par brjod ce na / smras pa / tshad ma nyid med gang de nyid //
translated: In that case, why is it said that only the nonobservation of the pervader is an indicator of the reversal of the pervaded?üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: med pa la ni rtags su brjod //
analyzed: med pa la ni rtags su brjod //
translated: That which is not a valid cognition is said to be a reason for nonexistence.

original: de ni shin tu rmongs don te //
analyzed: de ni shin tu rmongs don te //
translated: That is for the sake of those who are very confused.

original: ba rdzi'i bar la grags phyir ro //
analyzed: ba rdzi'i bar la grags phyir ro //
translated: because it is known even to cowherds.

original: zhes @46b bya ba la ;
analyzed: zhes @46b bya ba la ;
translated: This is what he says.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pas med pa sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But non-perception of intrinsic nature does not prove non-existence,

original: de med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of non-existence.

original: rtags su bkod pa gang yin pa ni tshad ma med pa ste /
analyzed: rtags su bkod pa gang yin pa ni tshad ma med pa ste /
translated: The reason adduced is not a valid one,

original: mi dmigs pas dgag par bya ba de nyid med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pas dgag par bya ba de nyid med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: because non-perception is said to be the absence of that which is to be refuted.

original: rtags de ni shin tu sleb pa gang yin pa grangs can te /
analyzed: rtags de ni shin tu sleb pa gang yin pa grangs can te /
translated: The reason is too broad, because it is common to the case of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya,

original: mi bden pa'i lta ba la goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bden pa'i lta ba la goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: who are accustomed to false views.

original: de'i don du yin gyi mkhas pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i don du yin gyi mkhas pa'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: It is for that reason, not because of their expertise,

original: ba lang rdzi mo'i bar du med pa'i tha snyad du grags pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ba lang rdzi mo'i bar du med pa'i tha snyad du grags pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the convention of non-existence is known even to cowherds.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /üîΩbam po drug pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa / bam po drug pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: 'o na mi snang ba mi dmigs pa bzhi pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na mi snang ba mi dmigs pa bzhi pa yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Now, is there not also a fourth type of non-perception, non-appearance?

original: de ji ste 'dir mi brjod snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de ji ste 'dir mi brjod snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúWhy is that not mentioned here?‚Äù

original: smras pa // mi dmigs pa ni de tsam zhig / med par nges ba'i 'bras can yin //üîΩde la'ang rgyu 'am rang bzhin dag / snang rung nyid mi dmigs par 'dod //
analyzed: smras pa // mi dmigs pa ni de tsam zhig / med par nges ba'i 'bras can yin // de la'ang rgyu 'am rang bzhin dag / snang rung nyid mi dmigs par 'dod //
translated: Objection: Non-apprehension is just that. It has the effect of ascertaining non-existence.üîΩMoreover, it is held that the non-apprehension of what is suitable to appear

original: ces bya ba la //
analyzed: ces bya ba la //
translated: is due to the cause or the nature.

original: mi dmigs pa gsum pa de tsam zhig med par nges par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gsum pa de tsam zhig med par nges par byed pa yin te /
translated: Reply: The third non-apprehension ascertains just that non-existence.

original: de ni snang du rung ba mi dmigs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni snang du rung ba mi dmigs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: That is the proof of the non-apprehension of what is suitable to appear.

original: mi dmigs pa de yang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang rang bzhin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa de yang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dang rang bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, that non-apprehension is due to the cause, the pervader, and the nature.

original: snang du rung bar khas blang bar bya ba snang ba las 'das par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snang du rung bar khas blang bar bya ba snang ba las 'das par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be seen that what is suitable to appear is beyond appearance.

original: 'o na kha dog 'di ni mi rtag pa'o zhes rang gi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na kha dog 'di ni mi rtag pa'o zhes rang gi mtshan nyid la sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Well then, since the application is to the particular characteristic, ‚ÄúThis color is impermanent,‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa de ji ltar kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro zhes brjod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: mi rtag pa de ji ltar kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir ro zhes brjod ce na smras pa /
translated: how is that impermanence applied to the universal of color?

original: rjes su dpag pas mi rtag sogs //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas mi rtag sogs //
translated: Reply: The apprehension of impermanence and so on

original: 'dzin la go rims 'di bzhed cing //
analyzed: 'dzin la go rims 'di bzhed cing //
translated: is asserted to be in this order by inference.

original: gzhan du gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it grasps something other than that.

original: tshad ma nyad du mi bzhed do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩrjes su dpag pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: tshad ma nyad du mi bzhed do // zhes bya ba la / rjes su dpag pas mi rtag pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa la /
translated: It is not accepted as valid knowledge.üîΩWith regard to the line, ‚Äúbecause it applies to the generality of color,‚Äù

original: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'di bzhed kyi /
analyzed: kha dog spyi la sbyor phyir zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'di bzhed kyi /
translated: it is asserted that the apprehension of impermanence and so on by inference

original: gzhan du mthong ba'i dus phyi mar gyur pa'i zhen pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi bzhed de /
analyzed: gzhan du mthong ba'i dus phyi mar gyur pa'i zhen pa ni tshad ma nyid du mi bzhed de /
translated: is not accepted as valid knowledge because it is a subsequent fixation on what was seen.

original: mthong ba yis gzung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid la zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba yis gzung ba'i mi rtag pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid la zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is a fixation on the impermanence that was apprehended by seeing, which is the specific characteristic of impermanence.

original: de la ni mthong ba kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni mthong ba kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is only seeing that is valid knowledge.

original: 'o na ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub ste /
translated: Well then, how is impermanence established by direct perception?

original: dngos po tsam zhig mngon sum la snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po tsam zhig mngon sum la snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because mere things appear to direct perception.

original: smras pa // dngos las mi rtag gzhan med do //
analyzed: smras pa // dngos las mi rtag gzhan med do //
translated: It is said: Impermanence is not different from things.

original: de yang dbang po las sngar grub //
analyzed: de yang dbang po las sngar grub //
translated: It is also established prior to the sense faculties.

original: dngos du ma can de brjod min //
analyzed: dngos du ma can de brjod min //
translated: It is not expressed as having many things.

original: stobs las skyes chos brjod bya yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stobs las skyes chos brjod bya yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: It is expressed as a phenomenon arisen from the power.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dang kha dog la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dang kha dog la sogs pa dngos po'i ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: Impermanence and color, etc. are not different from the entityness of things.

original: @47a * // dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa'o zhes /
analyzed: @47a * // dngos po'i ngo bo nyid mi rtag pa'o zhes /
translated: The entityness of things is impermanent.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid kyi rang bzhin 'dzin par mi nus pa'i rtog pa ni spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid kyi rang bzhin 'dzin par mi nus pa'i rtog pa ni spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The conceptual thought that is unable to apprehend the intrinsic identity of that entityness is the entityness of the universal.

original: spyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams phan tshun de dang ldan pa las tha dad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: spyi mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams phan tshun de dang ldan pa las tha dad par mthong ba ste /
translated: Universals such as impermanence are seen to be different from each other because they are mutually concomitant.

original: sgra mi rtag pa dang byas pa'o zhes bya ba ma yin nam ;
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa dang byas pa'o zhes bya ba ma yin nam ;
translated: Isn‚Äôt sound impermanent and produced?

original: de ji ltar gzhan du mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzhan du mi rtag pa yod pa ma yin no zhes rjod par byed ce na /
translated: How could you say that impermanence does not exist elsewhere?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdu ma'i rang bzhin can rang gi mtshan nyid 'di brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / du ma'i rang bzhin can rang gi mtshan nyid 'di brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe intrinsic identity of the manifold is not to be expressed.

original: rnam par rtog pas nye bar bstan pa'i chos su du ma'i ngo bo nyid can ni brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas nye bar bstan pa'i chos su du ma'i ngo bo nyid can ni brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: The entityness of the manifold is to be expressed as a phenomenon that is indicated by conceptual thought.

original: 'di ltar bag chags kyi stobs las skyes par gyur pa'i shes pas byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag / de dngos po gcig yin yang tha dad par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar bag chags kyi stobs las skyes par gyur pa'i shes pas byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag / de dngos po gcig yin yang tha dad par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the product and the impermanent, which are produced by a consciousness arisen from the power of predispositions, are the same thing, but they are taught to be different.

original: rnam par rtog pas nye bar bstan pa'i don la sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas nye bar bstan pa'i don la sgra 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because a word is applied to an object that is indicated by a conceptual consciousness,

original: rtog pa las skyes pa'i chos kho na brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa las skyes pa'i chos kho na brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: only a phenomenon that is produced by conception is the referent of a word.

original: 'o na gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngo bo nyid spyi yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngo bo nyid spyi yin la /
translated: If the essence that appears to a conceptual consciousness is a universal,

original: de nyid sgra'i brjod bya yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid sgra'i brjod bya yin gyi /
translated: and that is the referent of a word,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni mngon sum gyis gzung ba yin pa /
translated: and a particular is apprehended by direct perception,

original: de'i tshe rtog pa'i shes pa gzung ba 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtog pa'i shes pa gzung ba 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could a conceptual consciousness apprehend a particular?

original: smras pa / spyi yi rten ni grub pa na /
analyzed: smras pa / spyi yi rten ni grub pa na /
translated: We say: When the basis of a universal is established,

original: spyi de nyid ni grub pa can //
analyzed: spyi de nyid ni grub pa can //
translated: that universal itself is established.

original: de ma grub na de ltar 'di //
analyzed: de ma grub na de ltar 'di //
translated: If that is not established, then in that way

original: rab grub phyir ni rjes dpog byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: rab grub phyir ni rjes dpog byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
translated: this is well established, and therefore it is inferred.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i rten gang yin pa skad cig ma'i rang gi mtshan nyid de grub pa mngon sum du byed pa na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i spyi'i rten gang yin pa skad cig ma'i rang gi mtshan nyid de grub pa mngon sum du byed pa na /
translated: When one realizes the direct perception of the specific characteristic of momentariness, which is the basis of the general characteristics such as impermanence,

original: spyi de nyid grub par nges pa kho na ste /
analyzed: spyi de nyid grub par nges pa kho na ste /
translated: one is certain that the general characteristic itself is established.

original: spyi zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba gzhan ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: There is no other so-called general characteristic.

original: gcig tu rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la de ltar tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: gcig tu rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la de ltar tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: One should use the term in that way only with regard to the specific characteristic.

original: 'o na gal te rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma grub na ;
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig ma grub na ;
translated: If the specific characteristic is established as momentary,

original: spyi mi rtag pa nyid grub par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: spyi mi rtag pa nyid grub par 'gyur na ni /
translated: then the general characteristic of impermanence is established.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is there an engagement of inference?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: We say:

original: spyi mi rtag pa nyid de nges pa med na rang gi mtshan nyid 'di nyid mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du de ltar grub par bya ba'i don du rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi mi rtag pa nyid de nges pa med na rang gi mtshan nyid 'di nyid mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du de ltar grub par bya ba'i don du rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the general characteristic of impermanence is not ascertained, then inference engages in order to establish that very specific characteristic as having the nature of impermanence.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig mar snang bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid skad cig mar snang bar gyur kyang /
translated: Even though the specific characteristic appears as momentary,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags su rung ba nyid du grub par byed de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad gdags su rung ba nyid du grub par byed de /
translated: Because it is not ascertained to be impermanent, it is established as suitable to be designated.

original: 'di ltar yod pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, if it exists, it is observed.

original: de yang snga ma phyi mas bden par snang zhing /
analyzed: de yang snga ma phyi mas bden par snang zhing /
translated: Moreover, the former appears to be true to the latter.

original: snga ma phyi ma dang bral ba la skad cig mar brjod de /
analyzed: snga ma phyi ma dang bral ba la skad cig mar brjod de /
translated: That which is free from the former and the latter is called momentary.

original: gang zhig ji ltar @47b snang ba de ni de ltar tha snyad gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ji ltar @47b snang ba de ni de ltar tha snyad gdags par bya'o //
translated: Whatever appears in that way should be designated in that way.

original: ji ltar sngon po sngon po nyid du snang bar gyur pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar sngon po sngon po nyid du snang bar gyur pa la /
translated: When blue appears as blue,

original: de bzhin du tha snyad kyi lam 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tha snyad kyi lam 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: the path of convention engages in that way.

original: thams cad mngon sum gyi don cung zad kyang snga ma phyi ma'i dngos po la 'jug pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad mngon sum gyi don cung zad kyang snga ma phyi ma'i dngos po la 'jug pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because not even the slightest object of direct perception engages in the entity of the former and the latter,

original: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du snang ngo //üîΩ'o na gal te skad cig ma nyid du sngon po snang ba yin na /
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du snang ngo // 'o na gal te skad cig ma nyid du sngon po snang ba yin na /
translated: everything appears as impermanent.üîΩIf blue appears as momentary,üîΩthen if it is not ascertained immediately after being seen,

original: ce  ste mthong ba'i de ma thag par nges par mi 'gyur zhi na /
analyzed: ce  ste mthong ba'i de ma thag par nges par mi 'gyur zhi na /
translated: then how could it be ascertained later?

original: smras pa / 'dra ba gzhan ni yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dra ba gzhan ni yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Objection: Because another similar one exists,

original: la lar de yongs mi shes pa //
analyzed: la lar de yongs mi shes pa //
translated: sometimes it is not known.

original: 'khrul phyir sgong gi tha dad bzhin //
analyzed: 'khrul phyir sgong gi tha dad bzhin //
translated: Because of error, like the difference between eggs,

original: tha dad ma mthong ba yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha dad ma mthong ba yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the difference is not seen.

original: dngos po skad cig mar mngon du byas kyang /
analyzed: dngos po skad cig mar mngon du byas kyang /
translated: Reply: Although a thing is directly perceived as momentary,

original: mi rtag pa nyid de yongs su mi shes pa ni nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid de yongs su mi shes pa ni nges pa med pa ste /
translated: because of the uncertainty of the impermanence that is not known,

original: skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because another similar moment arises.

original: rtag par sgro btags pa'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa de las tha dad par skyes bus mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rtag par sgro btags pa'i 'khrul pa gang yin pa de las tha dad par skyes bus mi mthong ste /
translated: The person does not see the difference from the error of superimposing permanence.

original: dper na sgyu ma'i sgong dag tha dad pa yod kyang 'dra ba'i phyir mi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma'i sgong dag tha dad pa yod kyang 'dra ba'i phyir mi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, although the difference between illusory eggs exists, because they are similar, it is not known.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ma gnyis pa dang tha dad par mi shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ma gnyis pa dang tha dad par mi shes pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, because the second moment is not known to be different,

original: de nyid 'di yin no snyam nas tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no snyam nas tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: it is designated as ‚Äúthis is just that.‚Äù

original: 'on te sgyu'i sgong dag tha dad par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te sgyu'i sgong dag tha dad par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: But do you apprehend the difference between illusory eggs?

original: dpyod pa dang ldan pas legs par dpyad nas shes kyi /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang ldan pas legs par dpyad nas shes kyi /
translated: One who is endowed with analysis knows this after proper analysis.

original: skad cig ma ni de ltar nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ni de ltar nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the momentariness is not ascertained in this way.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here, we say:

original: 'di ltar mar me sogs 'jig pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar mar me sogs 'jig pa //
translated: Thus, the destruction of a lamp, etc.

original: can ni nus pa'i bar skye bos //
analyzed: can ni nus pa'i bar skye bos //
translated: Is perceived by people as arising without a cause.

original: 'dra ba med par gzhan 'byung pa //üîΩrtags med mthong ba yongs gcod byed //
analyzed: 'dra ba med par gzhan 'byung pa // rtags med mthong ba yongs gcod byed //
translated: The arising of another without similarity

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Is ascertained by the non-perception of a sign.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, this is the intended meaning:

original: 'di gnas skabs ma yin pa can ni 'jig pa dang mi rtag zhes tha snyad 'dogs la /
analyzed: 'di gnas skabs ma yin pa can ni 'jig pa dang mi rtag zhes tha snyad 'dogs la /
translated: The state of non-existence of this is designated as destruction and impermanence.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa la yang de'i gnas skabs med de /
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa la yang de'i gnas skabs med de /
translated: And in the case of a lamp, etc., there is no such state.

original: 'di ltar skye bo 'di dag mar me la sogs pa la blta bas mar me 'jig pa'o zhes de ltar yongs su gcod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bo 'di dag mar me la sogs pa la blta bas mar me 'jig pa'o zhes de ltar yongs su gcod do //
translated: Thus, these people, by observing a lamp, etc., ascertain that the lamp is destroyed.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: 'di la rtags yod pa ma yin pas rtags med pa can no //
analyzed: 'di la rtags yod pa ma yin pas rtags med pa can no //
translated: Since there is no sign here, it is without a sign.

original: 'dre ba med pa ste snga ma'i skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba ma yin pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa'i sgron ma 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid can shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dre ba med pa ste snga ma'i skad cig ma 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba ma yin pa de ni de lta bur gyur pa'i sgron ma 'jig pa'i ngo bo nyid can shes pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the lamp that has such a nature is not mixed with another similar instant of the previous lamp.

original: 'o na mthong ba yod kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang du mthong zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / nus pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: 'o na mthong ba yod kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gang du mthong zhe na / smras pa / nus pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
translated: But if one sees it, how is it that one is not certain?üîΩIt is said:

original: gyur kyang de ma thag pa med //
analyzed: gyur kyang de ma thag pa med //
translated: Even if the potency is the nature of the thing,üîΩthere is no immediate [result],

original: mthong ba med phyir 'bras la rmongs //üîΩnges byed gsal ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba med phyir 'bras la rmongs // nges byed gsal ba med phyir ro //
translated: because the result is not seen,

original: @48a * // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: @48a * // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and because there is no clear ascertainment.

original: dug gi dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa 'chi ba'i nus pa ro myang ba'i dus su 'dzin pa yod kyang rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dug gi dngos po'i rang bzhin du gyur pa 'chi ba'i nus pa ro myang ba'i dus su 'dzin pa yod kyang rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if the potency to die, which is the nature of the poison, is present at the time of tasting, one becomes confused.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is not seen.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir dang / nges par byed pa'i skyes bu la mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma thag pa med pa'i phyir dang / nges par byed pa'i skyes bu la mthong ba gsal ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no immediate [cause], and because there is no clear seeing of the person who makes the determination.

original: skad cig ma nyid du nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid du nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not certain that [the object] is momentary.

original: 'o na gal te 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas rtag pa nyid 'khrul pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas rtag pa nyid 'khrul pa yin na /
translated: Now, if the error of permanence is due to the arising of another similar [object],

original: de ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how is that [error] to be eliminated?

original: smras pa / de nyid bzlog pa'i ched du ni //
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid bzlog pa'i ched du ni //
translated: [In response to this question,] it is said:üîΩFor the sake of reversing that [error],

original: rjes su dpag pa brjod pa yin //üîΩblo gros chen po mthong nyid las//
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa brjod pa yin // blo gros chen po mthong nyid las//
translated: I will express an inference.üîΩO MahƒÅmati, all the sublime ones

original: dam pa thams cad nges par byed //
analyzed: dam pa thams cad nges par byed //
translated: make a determination based on seeing itself.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this [verse],

original: rtag pa nyid du rmongs pa de nyid ji ltar ldog par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du rmongs pa de nyid ji ltar ldog par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to reverse the error of permanence,

original: rjes su dpag pa nye bar rjod par byed do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nye bar rjod par byed do //
translated: an inference is stated.

original: gang dag la goms pa dang gsal ba la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yod pa'i blo gros chen po can de dag gis /
analyzed: gang dag la goms pa dang gsal ba la sogs pa nges pa'i rgyu yod pa'i blo gros chen po can de dag gis /
translated: O MahƒÅmati, those who have the great intelligence that possesses the causes of certainty, such as familiarity and clarity,

original: dngos po'i nus pa rnam pa thams cad mthong ba nyid nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i nus pa rnam pa thams cad mthong ba nyid nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: they will definitely see all the aspects of the potency of entities.

original: de dag la rjes su dpag pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la rjes su dpag pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But we do not make inferences about them.

original: de bas na spyi'i rten grub na spyi grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na spyi'i rten grub na spyi grub pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, when the basis of the universal is established, the universal itself is established.

original: gang na 'khrul pa yod pa der rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: gang na 'khrul pa yod pa der rjes su dpag go //
translated: We make inferences about those things where there is error.

original: skad cig ma dngos po las tha mi dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig ma dngos po las tha mi dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not moments and things non-different?

original: de ji ltar dngos po'i skad cig ma nyid do zhes tha dad pa dang ldan par rtogs /
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos po'i skad cig ma nyid do zhes tha dad pa dang ldan par rtogs /
translated: How can they be conceived as different, as in ‚Äúthe moment of a thing‚Äù?

original: ji ltar gyur pa'i dngos po kho na mngon sum du byas na de bzhin du nges par rigs te /
analyzed: ji ltar gyur pa'i dngos po kho na mngon sum du byas na de bzhin du nges par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to ascertain things just as they are perceived.

original: sngon po nyams su myong na ser por mngon par zhen pa nges par mthong ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po nyams su myong na ser por mngon par zhen pa nges par mthong ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: When one experiences blue, it is unreasonable to ascertain the conception of yellow.

original: smras pa / thams cad las ni ldog pa yi //üîΩtha dad med don de la ni //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad las ni ldog pa yi // tha dad med don de la ni //
translated: We reply:üîΩThe cognition that has the reason of exclusion

original: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi blo //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi blo //
translated: in regard to that object that is not different from allüîΩengages all as if it were a basis,

original: thams cad rten can bzhin 'jug dang // ji skad du brjod sgra 'jug 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad rten can bzhin 'jug dang // ji skad du brjod sgra 'jug 'gyur //
translated: and the term is applied as stated.

original: 'khrul rgyu med na de yis ni //
analyzed: 'khrul rgyu med na de yis ni //
translated: When there is no cause of error,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rang dang ni //üîΩrjes su mthun pa'i blo skyed 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rang dang ni // rjes su mthun pa'i blo skyed 'gyur //
translated: And by its very nature,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it generates a cognition that is in conformity with it.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las log pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni rigs mthun pa dang rigs mi mthun pa thams cad las log pa ste /
translated: Here, the specific property is the opposite of all that is of a similar type and dissimilar type.

original: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can rnam par rtog pa'i blo tha dad med pa ste /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can rnam par rtog pa'i blo tha dad med pa ste /
translated: The reason for being the opposite of a dissimilar type is the non-difference of the conceptual cognition.

original: cha shas med pa'i don de la tha dad pa 'dzin pa bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cha shas med pa'i don de la tha dad pa 'dzin pa bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: It engages in the object that is partless as if it were grasping a difference.

original: ji skad du brjod pa ste brda las ma 'das par sgra 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji skad du brjod pa ste brda las ma 'das par sgra 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: As it is said, the word engages without going beyond the conventional symbol.

original: sgra mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i blo 'jug go //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i blo 'jug go //
translated: The cognition ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù engages.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad las ldog pa @48b dang ldan na ni ji ltar rtogs pa gcig nyid kyis thams cad log par nges par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad las ldog pa @48b dang ldan na ni ji ltar rtogs pa gcig nyid kyis thams cad log par nges par mi byed ce na /
translated: If it has the opposite of all things, how is it that it does not make all things ascertained as the opposite by means of a single cognition?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here they say:

original: dngos po de yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na rang gi mtshan nyid la zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid snang ba ba skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po de yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na rang gi mtshan nyid la zhen pa'i ngo bo nyid snang ba ba skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: And that entity, if there is no cause of error, would generate the appearance of the nature of adherence to intrinsic identity.

original: ngo bo nyid kho nas skyed kyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kho nas skyed kyi /
translated: It would generate it by its very nature.

original: spyi'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It would not be by the power of a universal.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod na nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod na nges par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: If there is a cause of error, it would not definitely generate it.

original: bye brag tu smra bas smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas smras pa /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says:

original: yang na 'dir ni mi dmigs pa'i //
analyzed: yang na 'dir ni mi dmigs pa'i //
translated: Or else, here, if destruction is established

original: rtags las 'jig pa grub na ni //
analyzed: rtags las 'jig pa grub na ni //
translated: From the evidence of non-apprehension,

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: That is,

original: yang na 'jig par grub par nges te /
analyzed: yang na 'jig par grub par nges te /
translated: Destruction is definitely established,

original: rtags mi dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags mi dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the evidence of non-apprehension exists.

original: dngos po thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa ste ;
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan pa ste ;
translated: All entities have arising and destruction.

original: de la skye ma ni mngon sum dngos po sgrub par byed pas nyams su myong bas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de la skye ma ni mngon sum dngos po sgrub par byed pas nyams su myong bas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Among them, arising is a thing that is established by direct perception, so it is to be understood by experience.

original: 'jig pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni med pa ste /
translated: Destruction is non-existence.

original: de ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: That is to be established by non-apprehension.

original: ji srid dgag par bya ba de thams cad mi dmigs pa'i bsgrub par bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: ji srid dgag par bya ba de thams cad mi dmigs pa'i bsgrub par bya bar 'dod do //
translated: As long as the object of negation is not perceived, the object to be established is not perceived.

original: mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid dngos po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt impermanence the intrinsic reality of things?

original: dngos po sgrub pa nyid kyi tshad mas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po sgrub pa nyid kyi tshad mas rtogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The very valid cognition that establishes things will realize impermanence.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dngos po tsam ni mi rtag pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po tsam ni mi rtag pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Mere things are not impermanent.üîΩHowever,

original: 'on kyang / dngos po sngar byung med gyur pa //üîΩmi rtag pa zhes bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'on kyang / dngos po sngar byung med gyur pa // mi rtag pa zhes bstan pa yin //
translated: It is taught that the nonexistence of a thing that previously existed

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Is called ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: sngar de sngon du yod par gyur pa med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: sngar de sngon du yod par gyur pa med par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: That which previously existed and then did not exist is impermanent.

original: dngos po tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not mere things.

original: med pa de yang gzhan du ni mi dmigs pa'i sgrub byed can yin no //
analyzed: med pa de yang gzhan du ni mi dmigs pa'i sgrub byed can yin no //
translated: That nonexistence is established by the nonperception of something else.

original: rigs pa can gyi snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa'i yod pa'am /
analyzed: rigs pa can gyi snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa'i yod pa'am /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika say that existence that is qualified by the difference of prior nonexistence and subsequent nonexistence

original: de dang 'brel pa ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Or that which is related to that is impermanent.

original: med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: med pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ma yin no ;
translated: But it is not that it is characterized by nonexistence.

original: / yod pa yang mi dmigs pa'i bsgrub bya ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: / yod pa yang mi dmigs pa'i bsgrub bya ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it that existence is not the object of nonapprehension?

original: des na mi dmigs pas mi rtag pa grub ces bya ba 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pas mi rtag pa grub ces bya ba 'di ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: So how can it be said that impermanence is established by nonapprehension?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgang zhig mtha' gnyis khyad par can //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gang zhig mtha' gnyis khyad par can //
translated: Here we say:üîΩThat which is related to the twoüîΩextremes that are distinguished

original: yod pa 'brel brjod dang tshul can //
analyzed: yod pa 'brel brjod dang tshul can //
translated: and has the nature of expressing that,

original: mi rtag nyid kyi sgra yin na //üîΩdes de'i mtha' zhes 'dod pa gang //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid kyi sgra yin na // des de'i mtha' zhes 'dod pa gang //
translated: is the word ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is that?

original: rgol ba gang zhig snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin pa ni khyad par can te de ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgol ba gang zhig snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi khyad par dang ldan pa gang yin pa ni khyad par can te de ni yod pa'o //
translated: That which is related to the two extremes that are distinguished, that is, the extreme of prior nonexistence and the extreme of subsequent nonexistence, is that which is distinguished, that is, existent.

original: de dang 'brel pa ste de brjod pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgra'o //üîΩrgol ba de yis de yi mthar //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa ste de brjod pa ni mi rtag pa nyid kyi sgra'o // rgol ba de yis de yi mthar //
translated: That which is related to that, that is, that which expresses that, is the word ‚Äúimpermanence.‚ÄùüîΩWhat is that?

original: zhes 'dod pa gang @49a * //
analyzed: zhes 'dod pa gang @49a * //
translated: What is it that the opponent asserts to be the extreme of that?

original: yin pa smros shig / gal te snga phyir med ce na'ang //
analyzed: yin pa smros shig / gal te snga phyir med ce na'ang //
translated: If you say that it is prior nonexistence and subsequent nonexistence,

original: de nyid mi rtag cis ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid mi rtag cis ma yin //
translated: why is that not impermanence?

original: zhes bya ba ni gal te snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa mtha' gnyis yin na ni med pa de nyid mi rtag pa nyid du ci ste mi 'dod //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gal te snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa mtha' gnyis yin na ni med pa de nyid mi rtag pa nyid du ci ste mi 'dod //
translated: If nonexistence prior to and subsequent to disintegration are the two extremes, then why not accept that very nonexistence as impermanence?

original: drug pa la sogs mi rung phyir //üîΩzhe na de mthar ji ltar 'gyur ;
analyzed: drug pa la sogs mi rung phyir // zhe na de mthar ji ltar 'gyur ;
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause the sixth case, etc.,

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: would be illogical,‚Äù how could that be an extreme?

original: 'o na gal te med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin pa de lta na ni dngos po mi rtag pa dang dngos po'i mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i drug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te med pa nyid mi rtag pa yin pa de lta na ni dngos po mi rtag pa dang dngos po'i mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i drug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If nonexistence is impermanence, then the analysis of impermanence of a thing and the impermanence of a thing would not be associated with the sixth case, etc.

original: yod pa dang med pa las 'brel pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las 'brel pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no connection between existence and nonexistence.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúBecause the application of the sixth case, etc.,

original: ci ste drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba 'di snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i dngos po'i mtha' 'di dag tu ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste drug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba 'di snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i dngos po'i mtha' 'di dag tu ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: would be illogical,‚Äù how could that be an extreme?

original: dngos po med pa dang ldan pa dang 'du ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang ldan pa dang 'du ba'i 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection between a nonexistent thing and the possessor of a nonexistent thing.

original: yod nyid dang 'brel dag rtag phyir //üîΩmtha' ma dag tu khyad par med //
analyzed: yod nyid dang 'brel dag rtag phyir // mtha' ma dag tu khyad par med //
translated: Because existence and connection are permanent,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: There is no difference in the two extremes.

original: re zhig yod pa'am 'brel pa ste 'du ba'i ngo bo nyid mtha' gnyis po snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dag gis khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig yod pa'am 'brel pa ste 'du ba'i ngo bo nyid mtha' gnyis po snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa dag gis khyad par du byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, first, existence or connection, the nature of the composite, is not distinguished by the two extremes of nonexistence before and nonexistence after.

original: yod pa dang 'brel pa dag rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang 'brel pa dag rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and connection are permanent.

original: gtan du ba dang rgyu med pa can la rtag pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: gtan du ba dang rgyu med pa can la rtag pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Permanence is said to be eternal and causeless.

original: de ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not existence before and after.

original: de bas na mtha' ma dag gis gang la yang tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mtha' ma dag gis gang la yang tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the two extremes do not distinguish anything.

original: gal te rgyu 'bras mtha' yin na //
analyzed: gal te rgyu 'bras mtha' yin na //
translated: If cause and effect are the extremes,

original: khyad par med pa nyid 'gyur te //
analyzed: khyad par med pa nyid 'gyur te //
translated: There would be no difference,

original: 'brel med phyir ro de dngos po //
analyzed: 'brel med phyir ro de dngos po //
translated: Because they are unrelated.

original: snga na med par 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: snga na med par 'dod ma yin //
translated: That thing is not asserted to be nonexistent before.

original: de yis khyad par can zhes pa //
analyzed: de yis khyad par can zhes pa //
translated: And that which is distinguished by that

original: de dag kyang 'di la grub min //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di la grub min //
translated: Is not established here.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu mtha' yin par khas len par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dngos po dang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir khyad par du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu dang 'bras bu mtha' yin par khas len par byed pa rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dngos po dang 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir khyad par du byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Or, if you accept that cause and effect are the end, then the distinction would be made because cause and effect are related to things.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are not related.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag la 'brel pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag la 'brel pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation at all between existent and nonexistent things.

original: gang gis snga na med pa de ni rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par byed kyi /
analyzed: gang gis snga na med pa de ni rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par byed kyi /
translated: That which did not exist previously is related to its cause.

original: dngos po ni snga na med pa 'brel can du rgol ba de 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni snga na med pa 'brel can du rgol ba de 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the opponent does not accept that an existent thing is related to that which did not exist previously.

original: 'on te snga na med pa dngos po'i 'brel pa can no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga na med pa dngos po'i 'brel pa can no zhe na /
translated: But if that which did not exist previously is related to an existent thing,

original: 'o na ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa nyid mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that that which did not exist previously and that which no longer exists are impermanent.

original: de lta na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag kyang rgol ba 'di la grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu dang 'bras bu de dag kyang rgol ba 'di la grub pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, cause and effect are not established for this opponent.

original: snga na med pa ste /
analyzed: snga na med pa ste /
translated: That which did not exist previously

original: @49b khyad par gang dang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya ba gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: @49b khyad par gang dang ldan pa de la de skad ces bya ba gang yin pa de'o //
translated: It is so called because it possesses a particular attribute.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ci la brjod de /
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ci la brjod de /
translated: What is it that is called ‚Äúeffect‚Äù?

original: gang snga na med pa rgyu nye bar gyur pa'i dngos po'i chos can no //
analyzed: gang snga na med pa rgyu nye bar gyur pa'i dngos po'i chos can no //
translated: It is that which did not exist before, and which has the nature of being related to a cause.

original: rgyu ni byed pa po la rgyur brjod do //
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa po la rgyur brjod do //
translated: The cause is called the cause of the agent.

original: de bas na snga na med pa'i rgyu can nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad 'di yin la /
analyzed: de bas na snga na med pa'i rgyu can nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad 'di yin la /
translated: Therefore, the convention of cause and effect is based on the fact that it is related to a cause that did not exist before.

original: de med na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that did not exist, the entity of cause and effect would not occur.

original: gzhan yang gzhan gyi lta ba la 'bras bu yang dpyad na 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan gyi lta ba la 'bras bu yang dpyad na 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, if the effect is analyzed in the view of others, it is not tenable.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar // yod nyid rang rgyu dang 'brel pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar // yod nyid rang rgyu dang 'brel pa //
translated: Existence is related to its own cause.

original: byed pa'i phyir na rgyu yin lo //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir na rgyu yin lo //
translated: Because it is produced, it is called the cause.

original: yod nyid de dang 'brel pa ste //
analyzed: yod nyid de dang 'brel pa ste //
translated: Existence is related to that.

original: rtag na 'o na 'dir 'bras ci //
analyzed: rtag na 'o na 'dir 'bras ci //
translated: If it is permanent, then what is the effect here?

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩyod pa yang rang gi rgyu de dag dang 'brel pa ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / yod pa yang rang gi rgyu de dag dang 'brel pa ste ;
translated: Here,üîΩexistence is related to its own cause.

original: 'du ba de byed pa'i phyir rgyur brjod do //
analyzed: 'du ba de byed pa'i phyir rgyur brjod do //
translated: Because it is produced by the assembly, it is called the cause.

original: de ni dngos po gsum ldan par byed pas yod pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dngos po gsum ldan par byed pas yod pa ste /
translated: It is said to exist because it is endowed with three things.

original: de yang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel pa'o zhe na /
translated: Moreover, it is related through the characteristic of conjunction.

original: de gnyi ga yang rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang rtag pa yin na /
translated: If both of those are permanent,

original: da ni ci ste 'bras bu zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: da ni ci ste 'bras bu zhes brjod par bya /
translated: why is it called an effect?

original: 'on te yang yod pa dang 'brel par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang yod pa dang 'brel par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But if it is not related to existence,

original: 'on kyang dngos po nyid 'bras bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po nyid 'bras bu'o zhe na /
translated: then the thing itself is the effect.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa // gang med pa de byas pa na //
analyzed: smras pa // gang med pa de byas pa na //
translated: That which does not exist is produced.

original: dngos po snga ma med ldan min //
analyzed: dngos po snga ma med ldan min //
translated: A thing does not possess nonexistence.

original: 'brel pa khas mi len phyir ra //
analyzed: 'brel pa khas mi len phyir ra //
translated: Because a relation is not accepted,

original: de phyir 'di ril rtag pa yin //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: de phyir 'di ril rtag pa yin // zhes pa la /
translated: therefore all of this is permanent.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: A thing‚Äôs own characteristic is also not an effect.

original: dngos po gang zhig snga na med pa de nyid rgyu rnams kyis byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig snga na med pa de nyid rgyu rnams kyis byed pa yin gyi /
translated: That which is a thing that does not exist previously is produced by causes.

original: dngos po rnams snga na med pa dang ldan pa can ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams snga na med pa dang ldan pa can ni ma yin pas /
translated: Things do not possess nonexistence,

original: ldan pa dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa dang 'du ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a relation that possesses the characteristic of conjunction is untenable.

original: de bas na 'gro ba thams cad rtag pa thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas na 'gro ba thams cad rtag pa thob par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, all transmigrators would obtain permanence.

original: des na res 'ga' ba nyid 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na res 'ga' ba nyid 'bras bu sna tshogs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the arising of various effects would not occur sometimes.

original: 'on ji ltar yod pa dang med pa'i 'brel par rtogs te /
analyzed: 'on ji ltar yod pa dang med pa'i 'brel par rtogs te /
translated: But how is the relation of existence and non-existence understood?

original: bum pa med pa dang ka ba'i med pa zhes byar mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa med pa dang ka ba'i med pa zhes byar mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: It is not suitable to say ‚Äúthe non-existence of a pot‚Äù and ‚Äúthe non-existence of a pillar.‚ÄùüîΩIn response, it is said:

original: smras pa // de phyir don med zhen pa can //
analyzed: smras pa // de phyir don med zhen pa can //
translated: Therefore, those who are attached to non-existent objects,

original: brjod bya tha dad tshul can blo //
analyzed: brjod bya tha dad tshul can blo //
translated: The mind that has the mode of expressing different objects,

original: tha dad med don mngon 'dod can //
analyzed: tha dad med don mngon 'dod can //
translated: Desiring the object that is not different,

original: sgra la ldog pa'i rten yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra la ldog pa'i rten yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Is the basis for the exclusion in words.

original: tha dad pa med pa'i don gang yin pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra de rnams la /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i don gang yin pa la mngon par 'dod pa'i sgra de rnams la /
translated: Here, the mind that desires the object that is not different,

original: brjod bya tha dad par ston pa'i blo nyid ldog pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: brjod bya tha dad par ston pa'i blo nyid ldog pa'i rten yin no //
translated: The mind that shows the different objects is itself the basis for the exclusion in words.

original: don med par sgra rnams la dmigs pa'i blo ldog pa'i rten du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don med par sgra rnams la dmigs pa'i blo ldog pa'i rten du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be the basis for the exclusion of the mind that observes words without an object?

original: smras pa // rtog pa'i blo rnams don dang 'brel ba ma yin gyi //
analyzed: smras pa // rtog pa'i blo rnams don dang 'brel ba ma yin gyi //
translated: It is said: The conceptual mind is not related to the object.

original: 'on kyang don med pa la zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang don med pa la zhen pa nyid do //
translated: But it is just the attachment to what is unreal.

original: @50a * // de ni bag chags kyi stobs kyis don med pa la zhen pa'i blo nyid yod pa dang med par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: @50a * // de ni bag chags kyi stobs kyis don med pa la zhen pa'i blo nyid yod pa dang med par rtog par byed do //
translated: And that is the very understanding that is attached to what is unreal by the power of habitual tendencies, which imagines existence and nonexistence.

original: de bas na kha dog spyi la sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na kha dog spyi la sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is applied to the universal of color,

original: kha dag gi mi rtag pa rtogs pa tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dag gi mi rtag pa rtogs pa tshad ma gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: the understanding of the impermanence of color is not a different valid cognition.

original: gzhal bya gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no different object of comprehension.

original: yang dang yang du dran pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du dran pa'i shes pa yang tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: Also, the cognition of memory is not a valid cognition,

original: dran pa ni tshad mar 'gyur bar mi 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa ni tshad mar 'gyur bar mi 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because memory is not suitable to be a valid cognition.

original: 'on te dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir dang / slu ba med pa'i phyir ngo shes pa tshad ma nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i phyir dang / slu ba med pa'i phyir ngo shes pa tshad ma nyid do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if recognition is a valid cognition because it follows the activity of the sense faculty and is nondeceptive, that is not so,

original: dbang po'i byed pa ni yul nye ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa ni yul nye ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of the sense faculty is related to a present object.

original: gal te dbang po yul nye ba can yin na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po yul nye ba can yin na /
translated: If the sense faculty is related to a present object,

original: ji ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes zer zhing 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes zer zhing 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one say, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing,‚Äù and engage in such activity?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa tsam gyis 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pa tsam gyis 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: One does not engage in activity by merely recognizing, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing.‚Äù

original: gal te 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'jug par rigs so //
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'jug par rigs so //
translated: If one apprehends, ‚ÄúThis is the cause of obtaining the effect,‚Äù then it is reasonable to engage in activity.

original: dngos po de nyid kyi don byed pa de sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i nus pa can gyi dngos po rnams de 'am gzhan yang don byed par rung ba nye bar skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid kyi don byed pa de sgrub par byed pa ma yin gyi rang gi rgyu la rag las pa'i nus pa can gyi dngos po rnams de 'am gzhan yang don byed par rung ba nye bar skyed par byed do //
translated: The thing itself does not perform the function, but things that possess the capacity dependent on their own causes generate either that or another thing that is suitable to perform the function.

original: dngos po rnams gcig pa nyid kyi don byed pa dang ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po rnams gcig pa nyid kyi don byed pa dang ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin pas /
translated: The performance of a function by a thing that is the same is not the object of perception,

original: sngar nyams su myong ba nyid don byed pa dang ldan par dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar nyams su myong ba nyid don byed pa dang ldan par dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one remembers that which was previously experienced as possessing the function.

original: de'i don byed pa des kyang de nyid 'di yin no zhes shes pa'i yul yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i don byed pa des kyang de nyid 'di yin no zhes shes pa'i yul yin gyi /
translated: The performance of the function of that thing is the object of the cognition, ‚ÄúThis is that very thing.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by its own characteristic.

original: gal te sngar shes pa nyid ngo shes pas 'dzin na de lta na yang dran pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te sngar shes pa nyid ngo shes pas 'dzin na de lta na yang dran pa nyid de /
translated: If it is the prior cognition itself that is apprehended by the subsequent cognition, then it is memory.

original: mi rtag par rang bzhin la yang don byed pa dang ldan par sbyor ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o//
analyzed: mi rtag par rang bzhin la yang don byed pa dang ldan par sbyor ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o//
translated: Inference is the application of a property to a subject, based on the presence of a property-possessor.

original: don de byed pa tsam nyid las tha mi dad par btags nas gcig pa nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: don de byed pa tsam nyid las tha mi dad par btags nas gcig pa nyid du tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: It is designated as the same as the mere activity of the object, and is conventionally designated as one.

original: mi bslu bas kyang gcig pa nyid du grub pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mi bslu bas kyang gcig pa nyid du grub pa ma yin na /
translated: Nor is it established as the same by non-deceptiveness.

original: du ma nyid yin yang don byed par nus pa'i da ltar //
analyzed: du ma nyid yin yang don byed par nus pa'i da ltar //
translated: Even if it is many, it is able to perform a function in the present.

original: des na mngon sum ni spyi'i yul can ma yin la /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ni spyi'i yul can ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, perception does not have a universal as its object,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang khyad par gyi yul can ma yin no //
translated: and inference does not have a particular as its object.

original: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas khyad par nyid rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pas khyad par nyid rtogs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: An inference that sees a particular does not realize the particular itself.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: skad cig re re tha dad phyir //
analyzed: skad cig re re tha dad phyir //
translated: Because of being different in each moment,

original: khyad par ngo shes ma yin yang //
analyzed: khyad par ngo shes ma yin yang //
translated: although the particular is not recognized,

original: mthong ba mtshungs pas de 'dzin phyir //üîΩkhyad par yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba mtshungs pas de 'dzin phyir // khyad par yul can ma yin no //
translated: Because of the similarity of the seeing, it is a memory of that.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a cognition of a specific object.

original: gang gi tshe @50b me mthong ba de ni 'gags pa yin la phyis gzhan de ma yin pa la de nyid 'di yin no zhes du ba las shes pa de'i tshe khyad par ngo shes pa yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe @50b me mthong ba de ni 'gags pa yin la phyis gzhan de ma yin pa la de nyid 'di yin no zhes du ba las shes pa de'i tshe khyad par ngo shes pa yin gyi tshad ma ni ma yin te /
translated: When one sees fire, it ceases, and later, from smoke, one knows that it is that very fire, which is not something else. At that time, it is a memory of a specific object, but not a valid cognition.

original: skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan du tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan du tha dad par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises as different from moment to moment.

original: tha dad par yod kyang gcig par rtogs pa ni spyi nyid yul du byed do //
analyzed: tha dad par yod kyang gcig par rtogs pa ni spyi nyid yul du byed do //
translated: Even though it exists as different, it is cognized as one, and the universal itself is the object.

original: de pas na bstan pa'i dngos po gang la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de pas na bstan pa'i dngos po gang la 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there is no change in the object that is indicated,

original: tha dad pa med pa de la khyad par gyi spyi nyid ngo shes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa de la khyad par gyi spyi nyid ngo shes pa'o zhe na /
translated: it is a memory of the specific universal itself, which is not different.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we say:

original: de lta na yang khyad par gyi yul can ngo shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par gyi yul can ngo shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it is not a memory of a specific object.

original: gal te 'gyur ba ma mthong ba de lta na yang tha dad pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te 'gyur ba ma mthong ba de lta na yang tha dad pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Even though one does not see a change, there is still difference.

original: 'o na ji ltar tha dad pa ngo shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar tha dad pa ngo shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, how can one recognize a difference?

original: sngar mthong ba dang mtshungs par da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa ni spyi yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba dang mtshungs par da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa ni spyi yin gyi /
translated: The apprehension of the present entity as similar to what was seen before is a universal,

original: khyad par gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it has a particular as its object.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not inference.

original: gal te de nyid dpe yin pa //
analyzed: gal te de nyid dpe yin pa //
translated: If that itself is the example,

original: de ltar spyi 'dzin ma yin na //
analyzed: de ltar spyi 'dzin ma yin na //
translated: then it is not the apprehension of a universal.

original: dpe nyid yin phyir grub 'di la //
analyzed: dpe nyid yin phyir grub 'di la //
translated: Since it is the example,

original: tshad ma yis ni ci zhig bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshad ma yis ni ci zhig bya // zhes bya ba la /
