translated: what is the use of a valid cognition?

original: gal te gang rtogs pa de nyid dpe yin pa'i phyir spyi 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: gal te gang rtogs pa de nyid dpe yin pa'i phyir spyi 'dzin pa med de /
translated: If the apprehension of that itself is the example, then there is no apprehension of a universal,

original: dpe dang dpes tha dad pa la gnas pa ni spyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dpe dang dpes tha dad pa la gnas pa ni spyi yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the example and that exemplified are different.

original: de lta na 'o na ni dpe ni sngar mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni dpe ni sngar mngon sum gyis grub pa'i phyir /
translated: But if that is so, then since the example is already established by direct perception,

original: me 'di la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: me 'di la rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mas ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of the valid knowledge of inference in regard to this fire?

original: gal te brjed phyir skyon med na ;
analyzed: gal te brjed phyir skyon med na ;
translated: If you say there is no error because of forgetting,

original: / de nyid phyir na dpe ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de nyid phyir na dpe ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: then that itself is not the example.

original: 'on te de ni 'dzin pa nyid de 'on kyang brjed pa'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni 'dzin pa nyid de 'on kyang brjed pa'i phyir skyon 'di med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is the very same one, then this fault does not arise because it is forgotten.

original: 'o na ji ltar brjed pa'i phyir dper mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar brjed pa'i phyir dper mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, how could it be a simile, since it is forgotten?

original: dpe'i sgo nas sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe'i sgo nas sgrub byed 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the probandum is established by means of the example.

original: de'i khyad par ma grub pa ni ji ltar dper 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i khyad par ma grub pa ni ji ltar dper 'gyur /
translated: If the distinction is not established, how could it be a simile?

original: gal te mthong ba'i dngos po ste ;
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i dngos po ste ;
translated: If the thing seen

original: / tshad mas grub na don gzhan la //üîΩde nyid du 'dogs phyin ci log //
analyzed: / tshad mas grub na don gzhan la // de nyid du 'dogs phyin ci log //
translated: is established by valid cognition,üîΩthen the imputation of that very thing to another object

original: de grub phyir na tshad nyid min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de grub phyir na tshad nyid min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is a mistake, and it is not valid cognition.

original: 'on te dus gzhan du mthong ba'i dngos po ni de'i dngos por grub pa de /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du mthong ba'i dngos po ni de'i dngos por grub pa de /
translated: If you say that the thing seen at another time is established as that very thing,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod par nges par khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma las yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na yod par nges par khyad par mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma las yin no zhe na ;
translated: then it is ascertained to exist at the time of the present, because it is seen by the valid knowledge of inference.

original: de lta na 'o na ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo nyid rnams tha dad pa yin nam /üîΩtha mi dad pa yin /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i ngo bo nyid rnams tha dad pa yin nam /üîΩtha mi dad pa yin /
translated: If that is so, then are the former and latter entities different or not different?

original: gal te tha dad pa de'i tshe gzhan la ste /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa de'i tshe gzhan la ste /
translated: If they are different, then the superimposition of identity

original: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po la de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa phyin ci log kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dngos po la de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa phyin ci log kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: in the present thing is just an error.

original: 'di ltar snga ma'i shes pas ni snga ma tsam 'dzin la /üîΩda ltar @51a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar snga ma'i shes pas ni snga ma tsam 'dzin la / da ltar @51a * //
translated: Because the former consciousness apprehends only the former object,

original: byung ba'i shes pas kyang da ltar byung ba tsam kho na 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byung ba'i shes pas kyang da ltar byung ba tsam kho na 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: and the present consciousness also apprehends only the present object.

original: gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa de 'khrul pa'i phyir tshad ma med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa de 'khrul pa'i phyir tshad ma med pa nyid do //
translated: Since the realization of identity is mistaken, there is no valid knowledge.

original: 'on te snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gcig yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po gcig yin pa'i phyir phyin ci log ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not an error because the former and latter things are the same,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / mngon sum cig shos gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / mngon sum cig shos gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the other direct perception is the same,

original: gnyi ga 'ang gcig gis grub par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyi ga 'ang gcig gis grub par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: both would be established by one.

original: gal te mngon sum dang cig shos ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum dang cig shos ngo bo nyid gcig pa yin na ni /
translated: If the other direct perception is the same in nature,

original: mngon sum pa'am lkog tu gyur pa dag tshad ma mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa gcig gis grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon sum pa'am lkog tu gyur pa dag tshad ma mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa gcig gis grub pa'i phyir /
translated: then either the manifest or the hidden would be established by one valid knowledge, direct perception or inference.

original: mngon sum dang lkog tu byung ba gnyis kyis tshad ma gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang lkog tu byung ba gnyis kyis tshad ma gzhan don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Direct perception and inference would be purposeless, because there would be no other valid cognition.

original: 'on te ngo shes pa'i rtogs par sngar gzung ba tsam nyid 'dzin pa yin yang bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te ngo shes pa'i rtogs par sngar gzung ba tsam nyid 'dzin pa yin yang bden pa ste /
translated: But if recognition is the mere apprehension of what was previously apprehended, it is true that it is a form of memory.

original: des na tshad ma'o zhe na /
analyzed: des na tshad ma'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition.

original: smras pa / gzhan dang mtshams ni sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan dang mtshams ni sbyor ba yis //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: zhen pa'ang mkhas pa dag gis dran //
analyzed: zhen pa'ang mkhas pa dag gis dran //
translated: The wise remember the objectüîΩbecause it is connected with something else.üîΩIf you say that memory is not a valid cognition

original: de rtags la ltos phyir dran min //
analyzed: de rtags la ltos phyir dran min //
translated: because it depends on a sign,

original: zhe na ma yin 'khrul phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhe na ma yin 'khrul phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: that is not so, because it is mistaken.

original: gang sngar mthong ba dang mtshams sbyor ba nyid ngo shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang sngar mthong ba dang mtshams sbyor ba nyid ngo shes pa yin gyi /
translated: Recognition is the connection with what was previously seen.

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the apprehension of the object‚Äôs own nature.

original: de'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar gyur pa'i zhen pa mkhas pas dran pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe nyams su myong ba'i shes pa gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar gyur pa'i zhen pa mkhas pas dran pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the wise remember the object that was experienced because it is connected with something else.

original: mngon sum pa dang lkog tu gyur pa ngo bo nyid gcig pas lhag pa ci yang dpag tu med pa'i phyir dran pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum pa dang lkog tu gyur pa ngo bo nyid gcig pas lhag pa ci yang dpag tu med pa'i phyir dran pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is memory because there is nothing superior to it, since the manifest and the hidden are of the same nature.

original: 'on te me de'i rtags du ba la sogs pa'i rtags gang yin pa de la ltos pa'i phyir dran pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te me de'i rtags du ba la sogs pa'i rtags gang yin pa de la ltos pa'i phyir dran pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that memory is not memory because it depends on the sign, such as smoke, of that fire,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: khyed kyi lugs la rtags zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs la rtags zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In your system, there is no such thing as a sign,

original: tshul gsum med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshul gsum med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the trimodal condition does not exist.

original: dpe dang don gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe dang don gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The example and the object are the same.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa kho na ngo shes pa ste spyi'i yul can du bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la ni rjes su dpag pa kho na ngo shes pa ste spyi'i yul can du bstan to //
translated: In the Buddhist system, inference is recognized as a form of memory, because it is taught to have a universal as its object.

original: rtags las skyes pa'i dran pa 'di ni 'khrul pa can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa'i dran pa 'di ni 'khrul pa can du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: This memory that arises from a sign is not mistaken,

original: mngon sum ma rtogs pa'i shes pa thams cad dran par brjod do //
analyzed: mngon sum ma rtogs pa'i shes pa thams cad dran par brjod do //
translated: because all consciousnesses that do not realize a manifest object are called memory.

original: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa dran pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rjes su dpag pa dran pa yin na /
translated: But if inference is memory,

original: da ltar yod pa ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: da ltar yod pa ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: how is a present object realized?

original: phyogs kyi chos kyi stobs las te /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos kyi stobs las te /
translated: from the power of the property of the subject.

original: sa phyogs gang na du ba yod pa'i sa phyogs de na yod pa'i me ni skyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa phyogs gang na du ba yod pa'i sa phyogs de na yod pa'i me ni skyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the fire that exists in the place where the smoke exists is the cause of the smoke.

original: shugs kyis snga na med pa'i yul dang dus khong du chud par @51b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs kyis snga na med pa'i yul dang dus khong du chud par @51b 'gyur ro //
translated: By implication, the nonexistence of the object and the nonexistence of the time are understood.

original: de ltar gyur na rjes su dpag pa thams cad dran pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rjes su dpag pa thams cad dran pa nyid yin no //
translated: If that is so, then all inferences are memory.

original: de dag gis ni yul gnyis yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis te /üîΩmngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don mngon du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis ni yul gnyis yin pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis te / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don mngon du byed pa ste /
translated: They are two valid cognitions because they have two objects.

original: de dang cig shos 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa'i rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang cig shos 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa'i rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the direct perceivers of the nature of the object because there is no other conception except for the apprehension of those two.

original: zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: That is the position.

original: de la mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Among them, direct perception is free from conception and is nonerroneous.

original: rigs la sogs pa sbyar ba rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa sbyar ba rtog pa yin la /
translated: The application of the reason and so on is conception.

original: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin pa de bas na gnyi ga las ldog pa ni mngon sum ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin pa de bas na gnyi ga las ldog pa ni mngon sum ma yin nam /
translated: The apprehension of the opposite is error. Therefore, is it not the case that the opposite of both is direct perception?

original: de la ma 'khrul pa ni phyin ci ma log par mthong bar rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la ma 'khrul pa ni phyin ci ma log par mthong bar rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is understood that non-mistaken perception is seeing without error,

original: rtog pa dang bral bar ji ltar shes te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral bar ji ltar shes te /
translated: how is it known to be free from conceptuality?

original: rjes su dpag pa mngon sum gyi rgyu can de ni med na 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa mngon sum gyi rgyu can de ni med na 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference is not engaged in the absence of a cause for direct perception.

original: 'on te mngon sum nyid kyis rtog pa bral bar grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum nyid kyis rtog pa bral bar grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But direct perception itself is not established as free from conceptuality.

original: gang gi phyir snang ba'i rig pa thams cad ni brjod pa dang ldog pa de'i phyir mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pas ji ltar bdag nyid la rtog pa dang bral bar ston par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang ba'i rig pa thams cad ni brjod pa dang ldog pa de'i phyir mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pas ji ltar bdag nyid la rtog pa dang bral bar ston par byed ce na /
translated: Because all awareness of appearances is associated with expression and exclusion, how can direct perception, which is conceptual, demonstrate itself to be free from conceptuality?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩmngon sum rtog pa dang bral bar //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bar //
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩDirect perception is free from conceptuality,

original: mngon sum nyid kyis grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis grub par 'gyur //
translated: established by direct perception itself.

original: kun gyi rnam rtog ming rten can //
analyzed: kun gyi rnam rtog ming rten can //
translated: All concepts rely on names,

original: so so rang gis rig bya yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig bya yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: to be known by each one's own awareness.

original: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral bar rang rig pas shes pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral bar rang rig pas shes pa ste /
translated: Here, direct perception is known by self-awareness to be free from conceptuality.

original: rnam par rtog par ming skyed cing ming gis kyang rtog pa skyed pa de'i rnam rtog ming rten can ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par ming skyed cing ming gis kyang rtog pa skyed pa de'i rnam rtog ming rten can ni /
translated: The name generates the discrimination, and the name also generates the object.

original: so so rang gis rig pas rig par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pas rig par bya ba yin te /
translated: The discrimination that has the name as its basis is to be known by means of the self-awareness.

original: rang rig pas rnam par rtog pa rig pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pas phyi rol pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pas rnam par rtog pa rig pa'i phyir dang / mig la sogs pas phyi rol pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the discrimination is known by means of the self-awareness, and because the external object is known by means of the eye, etc.

original: de bas na 'gal ba'i chos bsten pas rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos rig pa dag tha dad par mkhas pa rnams kyis shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba'i chos bsten pas rnam par rtog pa dang cig shos rig pa dag tha dad par mkhas pa rnams kyis shes pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the wise know that the discrimination and the other awareness are different, because they are endowed with contradictory properties.

original: 'on te rtag tu rtog pa yod pa'i phyir sngon po'o zhes gtod par byed pa 'di ni gcig po nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te rtag tu rtog pa yod pa'i phyir sngon po'o zhes gtod par byed pa 'di ni gcig po nyid de /
translated: But if you say that the awareness of blue is the same as the awareness that is always present,

original: des na mngon sum dang rtog pa cis tha dad ce na /
analyzed: des na mngon sum dang rtog pa cis tha dad ce na /
translated: then how can you distinguish perception from conception?

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here we say:

original: kun las sems pa bsdus nas ni //
analyzed: kun las sems pa bsdus nas ni //
translated: Having collected all the mental factors,

original: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med pas ;
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid g-yo med pas ;
translated: the mind that is internal and unmoving,

original: / gnas na'ang mig gis gzugs dag ni //
analyzed: / gnas na'ang mig gis gzugs dag ni //
translated: even when it is at rest, sees forms with the eye.

original: mthong ba'i blo de dbang skyes yin //
analyzed: mthong ba'i blo de dbang skyes yin //
translated: That awareness is born from the sense faculty.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa dus rtag tu sngon po la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin no //üîΩde lta na ni yul thams cad las sems kyi rgyun bsdus nas sems mi g-yo ba dang ldan pa'i lha @52a * //
analyzed: gal te mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa dus rtag tu sngon po la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin no // de lta na ni yul thams cad las sems kyi rgyun bsdus nas sems mi g-yo ba dang ldan pa'i lha @52a * //
translated: If direct perception always engages blue, etc.,üîΩthen the mindstream would be withdrawn from all objects, and the gods would possess a mind that is not moving.üîΩ

original: sbyin gyi mig la ji ltar gzugs snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sbyin gyi mig la ji ltar gzugs snang bar 'gyur /
translated: If you maintain that perception is always associated with conceptualization, then how could form appear to the eye of Devadatta, who is in samƒÅdhi, since the stream of consciousness is withdrawn from all objects and the mind is devoid of movement?

original: bsdus nas rtog pa med pa'i tshe yang snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdus nas rtog pa med pa'i tshe yang snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Even when the stream of consciousness is withdrawn, form would appear to the eye.

original: rtog pa dang bral bar snang ba can gyi rig pa'i mtshan nyid mngon sum gyis khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral bar snang ba can gyi rig pa'i mtshan nyid mngon sum gyis khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the definition of perception is a cognition that is free from conceptualization and that appears.

original: de ltar yin du chug kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba can gyi gtod par byed pa'i shes pa dang po skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug kyang rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba can gyi gtod par byed pa'i shes pa dang po skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Even if that is so, the first cognition that is free from conceptualization and that is directed toward an object arises.

original: dran pa la sogs pa nye bar gyur na ni rtog pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa la sogs pa nye bar gyur na ni rtog pa'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When memory and so on are present, a conceptual cognition arises.

original: de yang mngon sum gyi byed pa las skyes pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyi byed pa las skyes pa de'i phyir /
translated: And that arises from the activity of perception. Therefore,

original: mngon sum nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: it is perception.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: mig las skyes pa de nyid rtog pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: mig las skyes pa de nyid rtog pa med pa yin la /
translated: That which arises from the eye is itself nonconceptual.

original: de'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i rtog pa ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i dus phyis 'byung ba'i rtog pa ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: The conceptual thought that arises later is not born from the sense faculty,

original: dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: because the function of the sense faculty is absent.

original: 'o na gal te rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na rtog pa nub pa can du snang ba'o zhes bya bar shes na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rtog pa bsdus pa'i gnas skabs na rtog pa nub pa can du snang ba'o zhes bya bar shes na ni /
translated: Now, if you understand that when conceptual thought is withdrawn, the appearance is one that is free of conceptual thought,

original: ji ltar de'i tshe rtog pa dang bral ba can du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i tshe rtog pa dang bral ba can du 'gyur /
translated: how can it be free of conceptual thought at that time?

original: 'on te de'i tshe shes pa med na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de'i tshe shes pa med na ni /
translated: But if there is no consciousness at that time,

original: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du snang bar shes te /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du snang bar shes te /
translated: how can it be understood that it appears as nonconceptual?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nub kyang rtog pa zil gyis mnan nas rig pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi lam mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nub kyang rtog pa zil gyis mnan nas rig pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad kyi lam mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the path of terminology, ‚Äúthe conceptual consciousness is withdrawn, but the conceptual thought is suppressed and one is aware,‚Äù does not apply.

original: 'di la lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'di la lan btab pa /
translated: The response to that is:

original: slar yang cung zad rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: slar yang cung zad rnam rtog pa //
translated: Again, a little conceptual thought

original: kho bo rtog pa de 'drar 'gyur//
analyzed: kho bo rtog pa de 'drar 'gyur//
translated: will arise for me.

original: ces rig sngar bshad gnas skabs kyi /
analyzed: ces rig sngar bshad gnas skabs kyi /
translated: As for the statement, ‚ÄúIn the case of the prior cognition, there is no conceptual thought,‚Äù

original: dbang po las rtog la med do //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po las rtog la med do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is not the case that there is no conceptual thought in the case of the prior cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa nub par gyur pa can sngar rig par gyur pa las 'das pa'i dngos po cung zad yongs su dpyod pas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nub par gyur pa can sngar rig par gyur pa las 'das pa'i dngos po cung zad yongs su dpyod pas /
translated: In this regard, the one who has the thought, ‚ÄúI have analyzed a little of the past object that has disappeared,‚Äù

original: kho bo la rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes par gyur to zhes dpyod kyi /
analyzed: kho bo la rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes par gyur to zhes dpyod kyi /
translated: is analyzing the thought that has arisen in this way.

original: sngar rig pa'i gnas skabs rtog pa bcom pa'i tshe dbang po'i shes pas rtogs pas nan tan du gzhag pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar rig pa'i gnas skabs rtog pa bcom pa'i tshe dbang po'i shes pas rtogs pas nan tan du gzhag pas rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But when the prior cognition is destroyed by the conceptual thought, it is not realized by the sense consciousness, because it is not the object of the sense consciousness.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: de nyid kyi tshe de'i rtog pa 'di rtog pa med par mthong ba'o snyam du skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe de'i rtog pa 'di rtog pa med par mthong ba'o snyam du skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: At that time, the thought ‚ÄúI see that thought without conceptual thought‚Äù does not arise.

original: des na mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: des na mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be explained that perception is free from conceptual thought.

original: gzhan du na mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas par smra bas kyang /
analyzed: gzhan du na mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas par smra bas kyang /
translated: Otherwise, even the one who advocates that perception has conceptual thought

original: ji srid du 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes nges pa ma skyes pa de srid du mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ji ltar 'dogs /
analyzed: ji srid du 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes nges pa ma skyes pa de srid du mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha snyad ji ltar 'dogs /
translated: As long as the ascertainment ‚Äúthis is conceptual‚Äù has not arisen, how could the convention ‚Äúdirect perception is conceptual‚Äù be posited?

original: de bas na mngon sum rtog pa yin pa'i tha snyad gdags pa'i don du yang zhen @52b pa brtag par bya dgos la /
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum rtog pa yin pa'i tha snyad gdags pa'i don du yang zhen @52b pa brtag par bya dgos la /
translated: Therefore, even for the purpose of positing the convention ‚Äúdirect perception is conceptual,‚Äù it would be necessary to ascertain it,

original: de la yang gzhan dgos pas thug pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan dgos pas thug pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: and since that would require another, there would be an infinite regress.

original: nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would not be ascertained.

original: 'on te yang mngon sum rang nyid rnam par rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te yang mngon sum rang nyid rnam par rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if direct perception itself is conceptual,

original: de la nges pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la nges pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: what would be the point of another ascertainment?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rtog pa med pa yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba shes pa yin yang nges pa gzhan gyis khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa yang rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba shes pa yin yang nges pa gzhan gyis khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though the nonconceptual is the nature of reflexive awareness, it is a cognition free from conceptuality, but it is understood by another ascertainment.

original: 'on te mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pas phyis tha snyad kyi lam 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pas phyis tha snyad kyi lam 'di ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the subsequent conceptual thought ‚ÄúThis is the path of verbal usage‚Äù is engaged because of the conceptual thought associated with the direct perception,

original: de la yang dang por gtod par byed pa de lta bu'i rtog pa brgyud pas rtog pa'o zhes tha snyad la 'jug gi / rtog pa dang bral ba'i tshe ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang dang por gtod par byed pa de lta bu'i rtog pa brgyud pas rtog pa'o zhes tha snyad la 'jug gi / rtog pa dang bral ba'i tshe ni ma yin te /
translated: then the conceptual thought is engaged in the verbal usage ‚Äúconceptual thought‚Äù by way of a continuum of conceptual thoughts that initially direct the mind, but not when it is free from conceptual thought.

original: de'i tshe rtog pa nub pa'i snang ba yod do zhes zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtog pa nub pa'i snang ba yod do zhes zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time there is the appearance of the subsiding of conceptual thought.

original: de'i tshe rig pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe rig pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there no awareness at that time?

original: ji ltar zhen pa'i lam 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhen pa'i lam 'jug ce na /
translated: How can one engage in the path of conceptual adherence?

original: 'o na ni rtog pa'i shes pa yang yun ring du 'das pa ji ltar zhen pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ni rtog pa'i shes pa yang yun ring du 'das pa ji ltar zhen pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how can the conceptual consciousness be the object of adherence that has long passed?

original: 'on te de'i rigs can gyi rtog pa mthong ba'i phyir shes so zhe na ;
analyzed: 'on te de'i rigs can gyi rtog pa mthong ba'i phyir shes so zhe na ;
translated: But if you say that it is known because of the perception of the conceptual thought of that type,

original: de lta na 'dir yang rtog pa zil gyis mnan pa can slar yang mthong ba ma bzlog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta na 'dir yang rtog pa zil gyis mnan pa can slar yang mthong ba ma bzlog pa nyid do //
translated: then in this case also, the one who has suppressed conceptual thought does not stop seeing again.

original: de bas na rang bzhin mi mthun pa dang ldan pas phan tshun spangs pa can skye ba'i phyir rtog pa dang cig shos shes pa dag la gcig pa nyid med do //
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin mi mthun pa dang ldan pas phan tshun spangs pa can skye ba'i phyir rtog pa dang cig shos shes pa dag la gcig pa nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, because they possess incompatible natures, they are mutually exclusive, and thus thought and the other consciousnesses are not identical.

original: 'on te rgyu tha dad pa yod par grub par gyur na shes pa'i tha dad pa 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu tha dad pa yod par grub par gyur na shes pa'i tha dad pa 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: But if it is established that there is a difference in their causes, then the difference in consciousnesses is established.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu tha dad pa grub pa med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu tha dad pa grub pa med pa'o zhe na /
translated: But the difference in the causes of conceptual consciousnesses is not established.

original: gal te khyad par can gyi rgyu tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par can gyi rgyu tshogs par gyur na /
translated: If it is established that the collection of causes of a particular consciousness is complete,

original: nges pa'i tshul can gyi shes pa'i tha dad pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'jog pa de lta na ni /üîΩrgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa'i sngon po dang ser po 'dus pa bzhin du shes pa yang tha dad pa'o zhes ci ste khas len par mi byed /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshul can gyi shes pa'i tha dad pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'jog pa de lta na ni / rgyu tha dad pa las skyes pa'i sngon po dang ser po 'dus pa bzhin du shes pa yang tha dad pa'o zhes ci ste khas len par mi byed /
translated: then the difference in the consciousness that is its effect is established.üîΩIn that case, why do you not accept that consciousness is different, just as blue and yellow are different, since they arise from different causes?

original: de la yang rgyu khyad par can las sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid gzhan yin no zhes smra bar ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de la yang rgyu khyad par can las sngon po dang ser po'i bdag nyid gzhan yin no zhes smra bar ni mi nus so //
translated: And in that case, you cannot say that blue and yellow are different in the sense that they have different natures, which arise from different causes.

original: ngo shes pa skyes pa las ser po de nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ngo shes pa skyes pa las ser po de nyid yin gyi /
translated: and the recognition arises, ‚ÄúThis is the same yellow as before.‚Äù

original: 'dus pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the mind is attached to the idea that the yellow is the same, not different.

original: sngon po dang ser po bzhin du shes pa yang yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po bzhin du shes pa yang yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the cognition also like that, like the blue and the yellow?

original: de lta na ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rig pa tha dad pa yang ji ltar rgyu mtshungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rig pa tha dad pa yang ji ltar rgyu mtshungs par 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then how could the cognition, which is clear and unclear, be the same cause?

original: 'di ltar mig gi stobs kyis sngon po myong bar skyed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi stobs kyis sngon po myong bar skyed la /
translated: Thus, the experience of blue is produced by the power of the eye,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sngar nyams su myong bas bzhag pa'i bag chags la ltos nas skyes pa'i phyir /üîΩrgyu tha dad @53a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sngar nyams su myong bas bzhag pa'i bag chags la ltos nas skyes pa'i phyir / rgyu tha dad @53a * //
translated: but the conceptual cognition is produced in dependence on the latent impressions deposited by the previous experience.

original: pas rtog pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos tha dad par shin tu gsal lo //
analyzed: pas rtog pa dang bcas pa dang cig shos tha dad par shin tu gsal lo //
translated: Thus, the conceptual and the non-conceptual are clearly different because their causes are different.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ni rtog pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ni rtog pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, perception is non-conceptual.

original: de ltar ni yin la rag na rtog par gyur pa'i rig pa med kyang mig phye na rig pa gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni yin la rag na rtog par gyur pa'i rig pa med kyang mig phye na rig pa gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then even without the cognition that is conceptual, when the eyes are open, the cognition is clear.

original: der des mngon par zhen pa'i rigs dang sbyor ba med na 'dzin pa la sogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der des mngon par zhen pa'i rigs dang sbyor ba med na 'dzin pa la sogs pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is no connection with the type that is manifestly attached to it, then it is not apprehended, etc.

original: de skad du yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang rtag tu nye ba'i rigs dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pas mthong bar byed na /
analyzed: de skad du yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang rtag tu nye ba'i rigs dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pas mthong bar byed na /
translated: In that case, if one sees with a cognition produced from a sense faculty that is always connected with its own characteristic,

original: des na ji ltar mngon sum rtog pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar mngon sum rtog pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could it be non-conceptual perception?

original: 'dir lan smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa //
translated: Here, the answer is:

original: khyad par gcig la mthong ba ni //
analyzed: khyad par gcig la mthong ba ni //
translated: Seeing one particular thing,

original: gzhan 'ga' zhig la mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan 'ga' zhig la mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: one does not see any other.

original: de las spyi gzhan tha dad pa //
analyzed: de las spyi gzhan tha dad pa //
translated: The universal is not different from that,

original: yod min blo tha dad med phyir //üîΩde phyir khyad par yul can nyid //
analyzed: yod min blo tha dad med phyir // de phyir khyad par yul can nyid //
translated: because there is no difference in cognition.üîΩTherefore, all cognitions produced from sense faculties

original: thams cad dbang skyes blo yin no //
analyzed: thams cad dbang skyes blo yin no //
translated: are only particular subjects.

original: zhes bya ba la yul dang / dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la yul dang / dus gzhan dang ldan pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: Here, a particular that is connected with another place and time

original: gang gi phyir yang gcig tu mthong ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang gcig tu mthong ba'am /
translated: is not seen as one,

original: dus gzhan du mthong ba'i khyad par slar yang yul gzhan du ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: dus gzhan du mthong ba'i khyad par slar yang yul gzhan du ma mthong ba ste /
translated: or a particular seen at another time is not seen again in another place.

original: mdun na gnas pa dang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum gyis dus gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi khyad par mi shes pa'i phyir bdag gi dus su 'dus pa'i khyad par can du gsal bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa dang phyis 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i mngon sum gyis dus gzhan dang 'brel pa can gyi khyad par mi shes pa'i phyir bdag gi dus su 'dus pa'i khyad par can du gsal bar snang ba'o //
translated: because it is not known by the present or future perception that is related to another time, it appears clearly as if it were qualified by being present at the time of the self.

original: des na dang po mthong bas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyi rang bzhin myong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des na dang po mthong bas 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dus kyi rang bzhin myong bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the present is not experienced at the time when it is first seen.

original: da ltar byung ba'i mngon sum gyis 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid myong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i mngon sum gyis 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid myong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the past is not experienced by the present perception.

original: dran pa'i shes pas snga ma dang phyi ma dag de nyid 'di yin no zhes nges par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pas snga ma dang phyi ma dag de nyid 'di yin no zhes nges par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt the memory consciousness ascertain that the past and future are identical to the present?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it does not.

original: dran pa'i shes pa'i rigs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dran pa'i shes pa'i rigs pa mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the memory consciousness is not a valid cognition.

original: de la dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of the sense faculties does not exist in it.

original: 'di ltar yul nges pa dang 'brel pa can da ltar byung ba'i sngon po la sogs pa la ni 'jug gi /'das pa'i dus dang ma 'ongs pa'i mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul nges pa dang 'brel pa can da ltar byung ba'i sngon po la sogs pa la ni 'jug gi /'das pa'i dus dang ma 'ongs pa'i mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the present eye consciousness engages the present blue that is related to the ascertainment of the object, but it does not see the past and future.

original: mig gi shes pa yang dus gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi shes pa yang dus gzhan du gyur pa'i dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, eye consciousness does not engage objects that have become other in time.

original: de lta ma yin na yul dang dus thams cad pa mngon sum gyis rig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul dang dus thams cad pa mngon sum gyis rig par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If that were not so, then all objects and times would be known by direct perception.

original: dang po mthong bas kyang rnam pa thams cad rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po mthong bas kyang rnam pa thams cad rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, if the first seeing were to know all aspects,

original: gal te dbang po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ni mi 'jug na /
analyzed: gal te dbang po 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ni mi 'jug na /
translated: if the sense faculty did not engage past and future objects,

original: de lta na yang de la brten pa'i shes pas snga phyi 'dzin par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de la brten pa'i shes pas snga phyi 'dzin par byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: then wouldn‚Äôt consciousness supported by it apprehend past and future?

original: @53b gal te de ltar na mig gi shes pas snga phyi dngos po yul du byed na /
analyzed: @53b gal te de ltar na mig gi shes pas snga phyi dngos po yul du byed na /
translated: If it were like that, then eye consciousness would make past and future objects its object.

original: 'o na mig nyid rting ma 'ongs pa la byed pa med pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na mig nyid rting ma 'ongs pa la byed pa med pa yin /
translated: Well then, the eye itself would not make the future its object.

original: nye ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin snang ba skyed par byed pa mig gi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nye ba ma yin pa'i rang bzhin snang ba skyed par byed pa mig gi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The function of the eye does not produce the appearance of a nature that is not near,

original: de ltar snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because such an appearance does not exist.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni dran par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni dran par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The future does not cause memory,

original: 'byung bar srad par rjes su dpag par byed do zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar srad par rjes su dpag par byed do zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: because it is said that it is inferred to exist in the future.

original: de'i phyir mig gis bskyed pa'i snang ba med pa'i phyir shin tu rjes su 'gro ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gis bskyed pa'i snang ba med pa'i phyir shin tu rjes su 'gro ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because the appearance produced by the eye does not exist, there is no complete concomitance.

original: 'on te rigs ni dbang pos phan btags pa'i shes pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te rigs ni dbang pos phan btags pa'i shes pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: If the universal is the cognition produced by the sense faculty,

original: gsal ba la brten par de yod na /
analyzed: gsal ba la brten par de yod na /
translated: and it exists in dependence on the particular,

original: de rjes su 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de rjes su 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
translated: then it would be concomitant with that.

original: de ni mi bden te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te gang gi phyir /
translated: That is not correct, because

original: tha dad pa de las ji ltar bye brag las brjod pa'i spyi tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa de las ji ltar bye brag las brjod pa'i spyi tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: how could a universal that is different from the particular be real?

original: gzhan spyod pa pas khas blangs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan spyod pa pas khas blangs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not accepted by others,

original: dbang po'i blo la tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo la tha dad par mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not appear as different in the cognition of the sense faculty.

original: gsal ba mthong ba'i tshe tha dad pa'am gzhan pa'i spyi snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba mthong ba'i tshe tha dad pa'am gzhan pa'i spyi snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: When clarity is seen, it is not the appearance of a universal that is different or other.

original: rtogs par ma gyur pa ji ltar mngon sum gyi yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: rtogs par ma gyur pa ji ltar mngon sum gyi yul du 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is not realized become the object of direct perception?

original: de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i blo thams cad khyad par gyi yul can du rigs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i blo thams cad khyad par gyi yul can du rigs te /
translated: Therefore, it is logical that all cognitions produced from the sense faculties have particular objects,

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i gzhal bya mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i gzhal bya mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they see uncommon objects of comprehension.

original: gsal ba las tha dad pa'i spyi mi gcod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba las tha dad pa'i spyi mi gcod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a universal that is different from clarity is not excluded,

original: de la sgra 'god pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa nyid yin yang /
analyzed: de la sgra 'god pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rigs pa nyid yin yang /
translated: it is logical to say that sound is not applied to that.

original: smad par gyur pa'i lus can gyi khyad par yang ji ltar sgra'i yul can ma yin /
analyzed: smad par gyur pa'i lus can gyi khyad par yang ji ltar sgra'i yul can ma yin /
translated: But how is the particular of a contemptible body not the object of sound?

original: de'i phyir sgras bcad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgras bcad pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it observes the particular that is the intrinsic identity that is excluded by sound,

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i blo rtogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i blo rtogs pa dang bcas pa'o zhe na /
translated: the cognition produced from the sense faculties is conceptual.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩSound does not engage

original: khyad par rnams la sgra rnams ni //üîΩ'jug pa yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: khyad par rnams la sgra rnams ni //üîΩ'jug pa yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: in particulars.

original: / khyad par rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir //üîΩbrda mi 'jug pa nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: / khyad par rjes 'gro med pa'i phyir // brda mi 'jug pa nyid phyir ro //
translated: because there is no generality that pervades the particulars,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and because the word is not applied to the particulars.

original: gcig las gcig log par gyur pa'i snang ba'i bdag nyid la spyi yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gcig las gcig log par gyur pa'i snang ba'i bdag nyid la spyi yod pa ma yin la /
translated: In the above, the universal does not exist in the appearance of the particulars, which are mutually exclusive.

original: sgra rnams khyad par dag la 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin te /üîΩkhyad par rnams la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra rnams khyad par dag la 'jug pa yod pa yang ma yin te / khyad par rnams la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: And the word is not applied to the particulars,

original: brda mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word does not pervade the particulars.

original: brda ni yul dang dus gzhan la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i don du skye bo dag gis 'dod de /
analyzed: brda ni yul dang dus gzhan la tha snyad 'dogs pa'i don du skye bo dag gis 'dod de /
translated: The word is accepted by people as the means of designating objects in other places and times.

original: dgos pa med par brdar byed pa ni ngal ba'i rtsed mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos pa med par brdar byed pa ni ngal ba'i rtsed mor 'gyur ro //
translated: To make a word without a purpose would be a tiresome game.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i yul ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i yul ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The particular is not the object of the word, because it is not the object of cognition.

original: yul dang dus nges par gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni @54a * //
analyzed: yul dang dus nges par gyur pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni @54a * //
translated: The particular, which is determined in place and time,

original: brdas bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brdas bskyed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: is not produced by the word.

original: de bas na brda mi 'jug pa'i phyir khyad par sgra'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brda mi 'jug pa'i phyir khyad par sgra'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the word is not applied to the particulars, the particulars are not the object of the word.

original: 'o na gal te sgra'i yul spyi yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sgra'i yul spyi yin gyi /
translated: But if the object of a word is a universal,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa de ltar na yang /
translated: not an individual characteristic,

original: yid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid las sgra sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: yid kyis rang gi mtshan nyid las sgra sbyor bar byed de /
translated: then the mind would apply a word to an individual characteristic.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas sbyar ba'i sgras khyad par du byas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par mngon du skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas sbyar ba'i sgras khyad par du byas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par mngon du skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Doesn‚Äôt a consciousness apprehending a particular qualified by a word applied by a mental consciousness arise?

original: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: That is not so because

original: yul gang zhig la sgra rnams ni //üîΩsbyor ba de nyid la de rnams //
analyzed: yul gang zhig la sgra rnams ni // sbyor ba de nyid la de rnams //
translated: words are applied to the object

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in dependence on that.

original: sgra rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de nyid sgra dang lhan cig sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi yul gang yin pa de nyid sgra dang lhan cig sbyor ba ste /
translated: Words are applied to the object that is the referent of a word.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yul dang dus gzhan la khyab pa ma yin pa de'i phyir brjod pa sbyor ba khyad par la yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yul dang dus gzhan la khyab pa ma yin pa de'i phyir brjod pa sbyor ba khyad par la yod pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since an individual characteristic is not an object that pervades other times and places, the application of a word is not in the particular.

original: de snang ba'i shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de snang ba'i shes pa rtog pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore a consciousness to which it appears is not conceptual.

original: rigs 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: rigs 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The one who apprehends the universal is conceptual,

original: sgras khyad par du byas pa'i spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgras khyad par du byas pa'i spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he apprehends the universal qualified by the word.

original: rigs mi snang ba'i phyir de brda byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs mi snang ba'i phyir de brda byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But he does not indicate the universal, because the universal does not appear.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul dang dus gzhan du mi 'gro bas sgra 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul dang dus gzhan du mi 'gro bas sgra 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And the particular does not occur in the word, because the particular does not occur in another place and time.

original: de dag las tha dad pa'i gzhal bya med de /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa'i gzhal bya med de /
translated: And there is no object of knowledge other than those two.

original: des na sgra dang 'brel pa'i tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: des na sgra dang 'brel pa'i tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: So, then, the conventional that is connected with the word will be destroyed?

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here we say:

original: de yi 'di zhes 'brel pa la //
analyzed: de yi 'di zhes 'brel pa la //
translated: The connection of that with this

original: don snang gyur pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: don snang gyur pa gang yin pa //
translated: is the appearance of the object.

original: de dag nyid ni 'brel pa ste //üîΩde tshe dbang po'i spyod yul min //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni 'brel pa ste // de tshe dbang po'i spyod yul min //
translated: Those two are the connection,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: but they are not the domain of the senses.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po la 'di'i 'di rjod par byed pa dang / de'i don brjod par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po la 'di'i 'di rjod par byed pa dang / de'i don brjod par bya ba'o zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa la /
translated: In the case of external things, the connection is the cognition that has the reason of the expression ‚Äúthis is that‚Äù and the expression ‚Äúthat is the meaning of this.‚Äù

original: don gang zhig spyi'i ngo bo nyid snang bar gyur pa de dag nyid kyi don ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi 'brel pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don gang zhig spyi'i ngo bo nyid snang bar gyur pa de dag nyid kyi don ni brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi 'brel pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning that appears as the nature of a universal is the meaning that is the reason for the relation between the expressed and the expresser.

original: dbang po'i yul gsal ba'i don ni brda'i tshe snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul gsal ba'i don ni brda'i tshe snang ba ma yin te /
translated: The meaning that is the object of a sense faculty is not the appearance of a sign.

original: 'di ltar 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di'i 'di zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: In this way, the meaning of ‚Äúthis of this‚Äù

original: gal te rjod par byed pa 'di las 'di shes par bya'o zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te rjod par byed pa 'di las 'di shes par bya'o zhes brjod na /
translated: is if it is said, ‚ÄúThis is to be known from this expresser,‚Äù

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: then in that case,

original: ci mi gsal bar snang ba can gyi shes pa yin nam //üîΩ'on te gsal bar snang ba can gyi mngon sum gyis yin zhes gnyis su brtag grang na /
analyzed: ci mi gsal bar snang ba can gyi shes pa yin nam // 'on te gsal bar snang ba can gyi mngon sum gyis yin zhes gnyis su brtag grang na /
translated: is it the object of a cognition that appears unclearly?üîΩOr is it the object of a direct perception that appears clearly?üîΩIt should be analyzed in terms of these two.

original: de la gal te gsal ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis shes par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te gsal ba 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis shes par bya ba yin te /
translated: If it is the object of a direct perception that apprehends clearly,

original: de lta na ni sgra'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes pa la gsal bar snang ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes pa la gsal bar snang ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then in that case, because the cognition that arises from the power of a word appears clearly,

original: dbang po'i @54b tshogs don med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dbang po'i @54b tshogs don med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: it follows that the sense faculties would be meaningless.

original: 'on te mi gsal bas sgra'i yul gyi don 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'on te mi gsal bas sgra'i yul gyi don 'dzin la /
translated: But if it is unclear, then it apprehends the object of the domain of sound.

original: de'i tshe yang dbang po'i yul gyi don ni brda ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang dbang po'i yul gyi don ni brda ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the object of the domain of the sense faculty is not a sign.

original: de'i tshe mig gi yul gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mig gi yul gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time there is no object of the domain of the eye.

original: yang na 'das pa'i don dang ma 'ongs pa la ni de'i 'di rjod par byed pa'o zhes brda sbyor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'das pa'i don dang ma 'ongs pa la ni de'i 'di rjod par byed pa'o zhes brda sbyor ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, in the case of a past object or a future object, the sign is applied by saying ‚Äúthis expresses that.‚Äù

original: brda ni dbang po'i gzung ba'i yul can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brda ni dbang po'i gzung ba'i yul can ma yin gyi /
translated: The sign is not the object apprehended by the sense faculty.

original: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad ni rtog pas bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad ni rtog pas bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the convention that arises from sound is posited by thought.

original: tha snyad rgyun chad par thal bar gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad rgyun chad par thal bar gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it does not follow that the convention is interrupted.

original: 'o na gal te dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa la de ltar snang ba'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa don gsal bar snang ba ma yin ba /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyis 'dzin pa la de ltar snang ba'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa don gsal bar snang ba ma yin ba /
translated: Now, if it is the case that because it arises from the sense faculty it apprehends it, and because it appears in that way, the consciousness that arises from sound does not appear as a clear object,

original: de lta na yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gcig pa nyid du dngos po de 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can gcig pa nyid du dngos po de 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: in that case, because it would be the same entity as that which has the aspect of clear and unclear,

original: sgra las byung ba 'khrul pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba 'khrul pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not an error because it arises from sound,üîΩwe reply:

original: smras pa // gsal bar snang ba can gyi don //
analyzed: smras pa // gsal bar snang ba can gyi don //
translated: The object that appears clearly

original: de ni snang ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni snang ba med phyir ro //
translated: is not perceived.

original: dngos rnams tha dad byed pa ni //üîΩshes pa'i snang ba tha dad yin//
analyzed: dngos rnams tha dad byed pa ni // shes pa'i snang ba tha dad yin//
translated: The differentiation of things

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is due to the differentiation of the appearance of consciousness.

original: gal te yang sgra'i don mthong ba'i dus na don gsal bar snang ba ma yin la de ltar gsal bar snang ba'i don can mig gi yul du mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te yang sgra'i don mthong ba'i dus na don gsal bar snang ba ma yin la de ltar gsal bar snang ba'i don can mig gi yul du mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: If, when the meaning of a word is seen, the object does not appear clearly, and the object that appears clearly in that way does not appear as the object of the eye,

original: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can ma yin te /
translated: then the word is not the object of its own characteristic,

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i yul du gyur pa'i don gsal bar snang ba can gyi don mi mthong bar gyur na snang ba mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i yul du gyur pa'i don gsal bar snang ba can gyi don mi mthong bar gyur na snang ba mi gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because in that case, when the object that is the object of the sense faculty does not appear clearly, the appearance would not be clear.

original: rnam par shes pa'i snang ba tha dad pas phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams tha dad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i snang ba tha dad pas phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams tha dad par byed pa yin no //
translated: The differentiation of external things is due to the differentiation of the appearance of consciousness.

original: ring po dang nye ba la sogs pas gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba tha dad kyang /
analyzed: ring po dang nye ba la sogs pas gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba tha dad kyang /
translated: Although things such as long and short appear clearly and unclearly,

original: spyod yul gcig nyid du yongs su gcod pa yod na /
analyzed: spyod yul gcig nyid du yongs su gcod pa yod na /
translated: If there were a determination of a single object field,

original: de ji ltar snang ba tha dad pas tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar snang ba tha dad pas tha dad pa yin /
translated: then how could it be different due to the difference of appearance?

original: de'i phyir don byed pa tha dad pas tha dad pa'i rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed pa tha dad pas tha dad pa'i rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, is it not the case that difference is due to the difference of function?

original: don byed pa tha dad pas kyang snang ba tha dad par brjod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: don byed pa tha dad pas kyang snang ba tha dad par brjod pa ma yin na /
translated: We do not say that the difference of appearance is due to the difference of function.

original: tha dad pa'i don byed pa gzhan yod kyang rgyu tha dad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don byed pa gzhan yod kyang rgyu tha dad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Even though there is another difference of function, it does not cause a difference of cause,

original: snang ba tha dad pa med par 'bras bu tha dad pas rgyu tha dad par rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa med par 'bras bu tha dad pas rgyu tha dad par rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not logical that a difference of cause is due to a difference of effect in the absence of a difference of appearance.

original: 'on te snang ba tha dad pa yod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba tha dad pa yod na ni /
translated: But if there is a difference of appearance,

original: 'o na de nyid kyi phyir snang ba tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa yin pas 'bras bu tha dad pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba 'di dag nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid kyi phyir snang ba tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa yin pas 'bras bu tha dad pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba 'di dag nges par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: then it must definitely be accepted that this is the case: ‚ÄúDue to the difference of appearance, there is a difference of entity, so what is the use of a difference of effect?‚Äù

original: gzhan du na gal te 'bras bu tha dad pas rgyu tha dad pa yin na ni 'bras bu ni 'bras @55a * //
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te 'bras bu tha dad pas rgyu tha dad pa yin na ni 'bras bu ni 'bras @55a * //
translated: Otherwise, if the cause is different because the effect is different, then the effect would not be the effect of that cause.üîΩ

original: bu gzhan tha dad pa nyid kyis tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bu gzhan tha dad pa nyid kyis tha dad par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If, on the other hand, the difference of the cause is due to the difference of the effect, then the effect would be different by the difference of another effect.

original: don byed par brgyud nas thog ma med par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te snang ba tha dad pas bskyed pa don byed pa tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don byed par brgyud nas thog ma med par 'gyur ro // 'on te snang ba tha dad pas bskyed pa don byed pa tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the performance of a function would be indirectly without beginning.üîΩIf the difference in the performance of a function is due to the difference in the appearance, then the difference in the performance of a function is due to the difference in the appearance.

original: de lta na ni tha dad par byed pa snang ba tha dad pa nyid yin pas don byed pa tha dad pas ci zhig bya ;
analyzed: de lta na ni tha dad par byed pa snang ba tha dad pa nyid yin pas don byed pa tha dad pas ci zhig bya ;
translated: What is the use of the difference in the performance of a function?

original: 'bras bu tha dad pas kyang dngos po tha dad par 'gyur ba la yang snang ba tha dad pa nyid tha dad par byed par khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pas kyang dngos po tha dad par 'gyur ba la yang snang ba tha dad pa nyid tha dad par byed par khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: If the difference in the entity is due to the difference in the effect, then the difference in the appearance should be accepted as the cause of the difference.

original: gsal bar snang ba nyid 'bras bu la phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba nyid 'bras bu la phan 'dogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the appearance as clear is the benefit to the effect.

original: de bas na ring por gnas pa'i sdong po gcig tu snang ba ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na ring por gnas pa'i sdong po gcig tu snang ba ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the appearance of a single tree that remains for a long time is not the object of an entity.

original: /'on te mi gsal bar snang ba ni mi bslu bar byed pa ji ltar dngos po'i yul can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: /'on te mi gsal bar snang ba ni mi bslu bar byed pa ji ltar dngos po'i yul can ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it appears unclearly, how can it be nondeceptive, and how can it be a cognition that has a real object?

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa ni mi bslu ba'i phyir dngos po'i yul can nyid du rtogs shig dang / de bas na snang ba tha dad pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa ni mi bslu ba'i phyir dngos po'i yul can nyid du rtogs shig dang / de bas na snang ba tha dad pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'o //
translated: Well then, you should understand that inference is nondeceptive and has real objects, and therefore it is different from the different appearances.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po nye bar gyur pa la brda sbyor ba de'i tshe gsal bar snang ba can gyi don nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po nye bar gyur pa la brda sbyor ba de'i tshe gsal bar snang ba can gyi don nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: When a real object is present, a convention is applied to it. At that time, because the object that appears clearly is experienced,

original: de la dngos po'i yul can nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa rigs so //
analyzed: de la dngos po'i yul can nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable to say that it is not a cognition that has a real object.

original: gang gi tshe mig phye ba na phyi rol snang bar gyur pa la 'di ba lang yin no zhes brda byed pa de'i tshe brjod pa dngos po'i yul can du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig phye ba na phyi rol snang bar gyur pa la 'di ba lang yin no zhes brda byed pa de'i tshe brjod pa dngos po'i yul can du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When the eyes are open and the external object appears, if someone says, ‚ÄúThis is a cow,‚Äù at that time, how can it not be said that the expression has a real object?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: mig gi don du snang ba la'ang //
analyzed: mig gi don du snang ba la'ang //
translated: Even though the object of the eye appears,

original: gzhan 'di zhes brjod gang yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan 'di zhes brjod gang yin pa //
translated: when someone says, ‚ÄúThis is another,‚Äù

original: de nyid sgra yis sbyor byed kyis //
analyzed: de nyid sgra yis sbyor byed kyis //
translated: The connection of that with words

original: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is not the domain of the senses.

original: gal te mig phye ba la sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te mig phye ba la sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba yin la /
translated: If, when the eyes are open, blue and so on are clearly seen,

original: sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa la sgra snang ba de lta na yang rang gi ngo bo snang ba tsam gyis sgra dang don dag 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa la sgra snang ba de lta na yang rang gi ngo bo snang ba tsam gyis sgra dang don dag 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: and if, when the cognition born from sound hears sound, the sound is heard, even so, the connection between sound and meaning is not by the mere appearance of the nature of the sound.

original: 'di 'di'i rjod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par dbye ba drug pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di 'di'i rjod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par dbye ba drug pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is the expression of that‚Äù is to be explained as the sixth type of expression.

original: ston pa'i don de nyid sgra rnams dang sbyor bar byed kyi /
analyzed: ston pa'i don de nyid sgra rnams dang sbyor bar byed kyi /
translated: The meaning of the expression is connected with the words.

original: drug pas bstan pa'i don mngon sum gyis spyod yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: drug pas bstan pa'i don mngon sum gyis spyod yul ni ma yin te /
translated: The meaning taught by the sixth case is not the domain of direct perception,

original: 'brel ba dang bral ba'i don 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba dang bral ba'i don 'ba' zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the meaning that is disconnected from the expression appears.

original: dbang po'i yul du gyur pa'i don sgra dang 'brel bar snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul du gyur pa'i don sgra dang 'brel bar snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The meaning that is the domain of the senses does not appear connected with the expression.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba'i don 'di'i zhes shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis rnam par dbye ba'i don 'di'i zhes shes pa ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the distinction is understood by way of the conceptualization itself.

original: 'brel pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang gdags par bya ba med na me 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni phan 'dogs pa dang gdags par bya ba med na me 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The connection is that the designation is made because the benefit is produced.

original: 'on te @55b sgra'i stobs kyis don 'di shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te @55b sgra'i stobs kyis don 'di shes pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the meaning is understood by the power of the word,

original: de'i rjod par byed pa ste sgra yin par brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjod par byed pa ste sgra yin par brjod do zhe na /
translated: then the word is the expression of that meaning.

original: mig nyid kyis gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid can gyi don shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mig nyid kyis gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid can gyi don shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the meaning that has the nature of clarity understood by the eye?

original: de'i tshe sgra'i stobs kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgra'i stobs kyis ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not by the power of the word.

original: 'on te dus gzhan du gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid shes pa'i rtogs pa sgra las byung po zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid shes pa'i rtogs pa sgra las byung po zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the understanding of the meaning that has the nature of clarity at another time arises from the word,

original: de la snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: de la snying po med pa ste /
translated: then that is pointless.

original: gang gi phyir dus gzhan na yod pa'i don de'i tshe mig gis mi shes la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dus gzhan na yod pa'i don de'i tshe mig gis mi shes la /
translated: Because at the time when the meaning exists at another time, the eye does not understand it.

original: gang gi tshe sgra dang 'brel pa las skyes pa can gyi shes pa mi gsal bar skye ba de'i tshe gsal bar snang ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sgra dang 'brel pa las skyes pa can gyi shes pa mi gsal bar skye ba de'i tshe gsal bar snang ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When a cognition that is produced in connection with a sound arises unclearly, then a clear appearance does not occur.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'di rjod par byed pa'o zhes res 'ga' blo la gnas pa'i don dang / rjod par byed pa las nyan pa po'i blo la gnas pa'i don snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'di rjod par byed pa'o zhes res 'ga' blo la gnas pa'i don dang / rjod par byed pa las nyan pa po'i blo la gnas pa'i don snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the meaning that is sometimes present in the mind of the speaker and the meaning that is present in the mind of the listener, which arises from the expression, are not the same.

original: rjod par 'dod pa dang tshig dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par dbye ba drug pas ston par byed kyi rnam par dbye bas bstan pa'i don ni mngon sum gyis spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rjod par 'dod pa dang tshig dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par dbye ba drug pas ston par byed kyi rnam par dbye bas bstan pa'i don ni mngon sum gyis spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: The speaker reveals the desired meaning and the words by means of the sixfold division that has the nature of cause and effect, but the meaning that is revealed by the division is not the domain of direct perception.

original: de nye bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na sgra'i yul ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de nye bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid tsam la 'jug pa'i phyir ro // de bas na sgra'i yul ni dbang po'i spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: This is because it is engaged by the mere nature of that which is present.

original: 'on kyang spyi yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of a word is not the domain of the sense faculties, but rather a universal.

original: mig la don snang bar gyur na mi gsal ba gzhan 'dzin par mi snang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: mig la don snang bar gyur na mi gsal ba gzhan 'dzin par mi snang ba ma yin na /
translated: If the object appears to the eye, it is not the case that the unclear is not perceived.

original: de ji ltar sgra sbyor ba don gzhan pa'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sgra sbyor ba don gzhan pa'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: How then is the application of the word to the object other than the object of the word?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdbang po'i bya ba med pa can //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dbang po'i bya ba med pa can //
translated: Here it is said:üîΩBecause the object does not appear

original: gzhan dag tsam gyis mi snang phyir //
analyzed: gzhan dag tsam gyis mi snang phyir //
translated: merely through the other,

original: 'brel ma brjod pa yis kyang min //üîΩbdag nyid shes par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ma brjod pa yis kyang min // bdag nyid shes par thal phyir ro //
translated: nor through the expression of the relation,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it would follow that it would be known by itself.

original: gal te gsal bar snang ba can gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la brda sbyar na de'i tshe byed pa med pa'i mig can gyi skye bos sgra thos pa na shes pa gsal bar 'gyur ba las skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gsal bar snang ba can gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la brda sbyar na de'i tshe byed pa med pa'i mig can gyi skye bos sgra thos pa na shes pa gsal bar 'gyur ba las skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If the convention is applied to the particular that has the appearance of the clear, then when a person with the eye that is not functioning hears the word, the cognition does not arise from the clear appearance.

original: de bas na byed pa'i dbang po can gyi skyes bus gzhan gyi tshig tsam las gsal bar mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na byed pa'i dbang po can gyi skyes bus gzhan gyi tshig tsam las gsal bar mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the object does not appear clearly merely from the words of another, for a person who has the functioning sense faculty,

original: dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don sgras sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i spyod yul gyi don sgras sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the object of the domain of the sense faculty is not applied by the word.

original: 'o na gal te rang gi mtshan nyid brdar byed pa ma yin pa de lta na yang de nyid sgras ston pa ste ;
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang gi mtshan nyid brdar byed pa ma yin pa de lta na yang de nyid sgras ston pa ste ;
translated: But even if the intrinsic identity is not the signifier, the word still indicates it.

original: brda'i stobs kyis dbang pos don ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brda'i stobs kyis dbang pos don ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The sense faculty does not indicate the object by the power of the signifier.

original: 'on kyang rung bas yin pa de bzhin du sgra yang brda las 'das na ngo bo nyid kho na las don ston pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang rung bas yin pa de bzhin du sgra yang brda las 'das na ngo bo nyid kho na las don ston pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But just as the word is the same, when it goes beyond the signifier, it indicates the object by its own nature.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ma brjod pa ste 'brel pa ma grub pa'i don te sgras sbyor ba ma yin te /üîΩrang nyid brda dang bral bar @56a * //
analyzed: ma brjod pa ste 'brel pa ma grub pa'i don te sgras sbyor ba ma yin te / rang nyid brda dang bral bar @56a * //
translated: The object that is not expressed, that is, not established as the signifier, is not connected with the word.

original: yang sgra thos pa na rang gi mtshan nyid la gsal ba'i shes pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang sgra thos pa na rang gi mtshan nyid la gsal ba'i shes pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the word is heard, a cognition of the intrinsic identity would arise, even if the word is divorced from the signifier.

original: mig phye bar gyur kyang gsal bar snang ba'i rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mig phye bar gyur kyang gsal bar snang ba'i rig pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if the eye is open, the cognition of the clear appearance does not arise.

original: de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i blo brjod du med pa nyid dag pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i blo brjod du med pa nyid dag pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir /
