translated: Therefore, the cognition that arises from the sense faculty is the inexpressible cognition that apprehends the pure object.

original: rtog pa zil gyis mnan pa can mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa zil gyis mnan pa can mngon sum yin no //
translated: The cognition that is the thought ‚Äúsnake‚Äù is a direct perception that overpowers the thought of rope.

original: 'o na ji ltar sbrul mthong ba'i de ma thag tu 'di ni sbrul yin no snyam pa'i rtog pa gsal bar snang ba can du rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sbrul mthong ba'i de ma thag tu 'di ni sbrul yin no snyam pa'i rtog pa gsal bar snang ba can du rig par 'gyur /
translated: How is it that immediately after seeing a snake, the thought ‚ÄúThis is a snake‚Äù is clearly perceived?

original: 'on te gsal ba'i sbrul las tha dad pa la dmigs ba can de yin par khas len na ni de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba'i sbrul las tha dad pa la dmigs ba can de yin par khas len na ni de ni ma yin te /
translated: If you accept that it is a cognition that observes something different from the clear snake, that is not so.

original: tha dad pa'i mi gsal bam myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mi gsal bam myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not experience a different unclear snake.

original: dper na rjes su dpag pa la gsal ba'i du ba dang sa phyogs las tha dad pa'i me'i rnam pa yongs su gcod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rjes su dpag pa la gsal ba'i du ba dang sa phyogs las tha dad pa'i me'i rnam pa yongs su gcod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the ascertainment of the aspect of fire that is different from the clear smoke and the place.

original: 'on te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gsal bar rig pa la sngon po snang ba dang / rtog pa skyes pa la sngon por snang ba la khyad par med cing /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gsal bar rig pa la sngon po snang ba dang / rtog pa skyes pa la sngon por snang ba la khyad par med cing /
translated: If you say that there is no difference between the appearance of blue in the clear cognition that is without thought and the appearance of blue in the arising of thought,

original: dmigs pa la khyad par mi ston na yang ji ltar rtog pa don tha dad par mi 'gyur zer na /
analyzed: dmigs pa la khyad par mi ston na yang ji ltar rtog pa don tha dad par mi 'gyur zer na /
translated: and that although they do not show a difference in the observed object, how can thought not be a different object?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir nges pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa la g-yer bag can gyi rtog pas don de nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges pa nyid kyis tha snyad 'dogs pa la g-yer bag can gyi rtog pas don de nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is only through ascertainment that conceptual thought apprehends an object.

original: rtog pa med pa'i shes pas ni nges pa nyid du dngos po rtogs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i shes pas ni nges pa nyid du dngos po rtogs pa ma yin na /
translated: If a nonconceptual consciousness does not ascertain an object,

original: de ji ltar rtog pa'i shes pa shes pa snga ma dang grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa can du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rtog pa'i shes pa shes pa snga ma dang grub pa dang bde ba tha dad pa can du 'gyur /
translated: how could a conceptual consciousness be different from a previous consciousness that is established and happy?

original: 'on te nges pa ni bden pa'i don 'dzin par mi 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: 'on te nges pa ni bden pa'i don 'dzin par mi 'gyur na ni /
translated: If ascertainment does not apprehend a real object,

original: 'o na ji ltar rtog pa med pa'i don can du ji ltar grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rtog pa med pa'i don can du ji ltar grub par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be established as having a nonconceptual object?

original: ji srid du 'jug pa'i yul nges par ston pa ni slu ba med par grub pa'o /
analyzed: ji srid du 'jug pa'i yul nges par ston pa ni slu ba med par grub pa'o /
translated: As long as the object of engagement is ascertained, it is established as undeceiving.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa /
translated: Book 7

original: gzhan yang mngon sum du byed pa nyid zhen pa'i shes pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum du byed pa nyid zhen pa'i shes pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the consciousness that ascertains is conceptual,

original: de ji ltar 'di med pa'i don can yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'di med pa'i don can yin /
translated: how could it have the meaning of nonexistence?

original: rnam par rtog pa nub pa can gyi shes pa ni nges pa med pas bden pa nyid du ma myong yang nges pa'i ngo bo nyid can gsal ba'i shes pa ji ltar mi bden pa yin ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nub pa can gyi shes pa ni nges pa med pas bden pa nyid du ma myong yang nges pa'i ngo bo nyid can gsal ba'i shes pa ji ltar mi bden pa yin ;
translated: Since consciousness that has the aspect of the subsiding of conceptuality is indeterminate, it does not experience true reality. But how can a clear consciousness that has the nature of ascertainment be false?

original: 'on te sngon por snang ba'i shes pa tha dad par khas len cing /
analyzed: 'on te sngon por snang ba'i shes pa tha dad par khas len cing /
translated: If you accept that the consciousness to which blue appears is different,

original: rtog pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags la rag las pa'i skye ba can yang tha dad pa nyid du 'dod na ni /
analyzed: rtog pa ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags la rag las pa'i skye ba can yang tha dad pa nyid du 'dod na ni /
translated: and if you assert that conceptual consciousness, which arises in dependence on beginningless latent propensities, is also different,

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: then that is not true.

original: tha dad par 'dzin pa nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par 'dzin pa nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you do not experience the apprehension of difference.

original: phyi rol pa mngon sum du byed pa'i dus na gsal @56b bar rig pa tha dad pa'i 'dzin pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol pa mngon sum du byed pa'i dus na gsal @56b bar rig pa tha dad pa'i 'dzin pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When you perceive external objects, you do not realize the apprehension of clear awareness as different.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa rtog pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa rtog pa yin na ni /
translated: If you say that conceptual consciousness is inferential cognition,

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩlkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir //
translated: that is not so.üîΩBecause it has an object that is not hidden.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because inference itself is impossible.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference is a cognition of a hidden object.

original: 'dir lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan btab pa /
translated: Here is the reply:

original: rtog bcas rtog pa med pa'i yid //
analyzed: rtog bcas rtog pa med pa'i yid //
translated: Because the conceptual and non-conceptual cognitions

original: cig car du ni 'jug phyir ram //
analyzed: cig car du ni 'jug phyir ram //
translated: occur simultaneously,

original: 'jug par myur phyir rmongs pa rnams //
analyzed: 'jug par myur phyir rmongs pa rnams //
translated: the ignorant

original: de dag la ni gcig tu zhen //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: de dag la ni gcig tu zhen // zhes bya ba la //
translated: think that they are one.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'i rig pa dag lhan cig tu 'jug pas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med pa'i rig pa dag lhan cig tu 'jug pas /
translated: Here, the conceptual and non-conceptual cognitions occur simultaneously.

original: skye bo rmongs pa rnams rtog pa dang don mthong ba de dag la gcig pa nyid du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo rmongs pa rnams rtog pa dang don mthong ba de dag la gcig pa nyid du sems pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ignorant think that the conceptual and the object seen are one.

original: yang na mthong ba'i rjes la rtog pa 'jug pa ni 'dir 'jug pa myur ba'i phyir rmongs pas tha dad pa mi rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na mthong ba'i rjes la rtog pa 'jug pa ni 'dir 'jug pa myur ba'i phyir rmongs pas tha dad pa mi rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Or, because the conceptual cognition that occurs after seeing occurs quickly, the ignorant do not understand that they are different.

original: 'dir 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the summary of the meaning of this:

original: gal te ka pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa yi ge ka la sogs par snang ba can /
analyzed: gal te ka pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa yi ge ka la sogs par snang ba can /
translated: If the conceptual cognition that thinks ‚Äúthis is ka‚Äù appears as the letter ka, etc.,

original: phyi rol nyams su myong bar gsal ba yin pa de lta na ni mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol nyams su myong bar gsal ba yin pa de lta na ni mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it were clear that the external object is experienced, then perception would be conceptual.

original: gang gi tshe yi ger snang ba 'das pa'i shes pas bzhag pa'i bag chags sad pa mi gsal ba'i yi ge la zhen pa can ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yi ger snang ba 'das pa'i shes pas bzhag pa'i bag chags sad pa mi gsal ba'i yi ge la zhen pa can ni /
translated: But when the clear appearance of a letter is a memory of a past consciousness, and the unclear letter is conceived,

original: don nges pa las gzhan pa nyid gsal ba'i gzung ba can phyi rol pa snang ba yin te /
analyzed: don nges pa las gzhan pa nyid gsal ba'i gzung ba can phyi rol pa snang ba yin te /
translated: then the external appearance is the clear apprehension of something other than the ascertainment of the object.

original: de snang ba can gyi shes pa ni rtog pa med pa mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de snang ba can gyi shes pa ni rtog pa med pa mngon sum yin no //
translated: The consciousness that has that appearance is nonconceptual perception.

original: 'o na de lta na ni mthong ba dang rtog pa dag ji ltar gcig tu zhen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na ni mthong ba dang rtog pa dag ji ltar gcig tu zhen pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, how can seeing and conception be conceived as one?

original: de nyid du zhen pa med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de nyid du zhen pa med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not conceived as different?

original: 'di ltar ba lang zhes bya bar nges pa na tha dad yi ge ba dang / la dang nga yis brten pa dang ldan par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang zhes bya bar nges pa na tha dad yi ge ba dang / la dang nga yis brten pa dang ldan par rtogs pa ste /
translated: When it is ascertained as a cow, it is conceived as having the letters ba, la, and nga in different places.

original: ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rig pa yang rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rig pa yang rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the letters ba and so on arises in sequence.

original: de bas na ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rig pa la yang gcig pa nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: de bas na ba la sogs pa'i yi ge rig pa la yang gcig pa nyid ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the letters such as ‚Äúba‚Äù are not the same in the case of awareness,

original: yang phyi rol rig pa dang lhan cig par rtog pa gcig ji ltar rtogs par bya /
analyzed: yang phyi rol rig pa dang lhan cig par rtog pa gcig ji ltar rtogs par bya /
translated: how could one understand that the external object is the same as awareness?

original: 'on te yi ge snang ba can gyi shes pas khra bo la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yi ge snang ba can gyi shes pas khra bo la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the consciousness that appears as the letters determines the variegated object,

original: de lta na ni rtog pa ma tshang na ba lang mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rtog pa ma tshang na ba lang mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: then when the conceptual thought is incomplete, the cow would not appear.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med na ni rig pa gsal bar 'gyur la gsal bar rig pa med na yang ba lang la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phreng ba mig btsums ba la yang snang bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med na ni rig pa gsal bar 'gyur la gsal bar rig pa med na yang ba lang la sogs pa'i yi ge'i phreng ba mig btsums ba la yang snang bar 'gyur ro//
translated: Because if there is no conceptual thought, awareness would be clear, and if there is no clear awareness, the series of letters such as ‚Äúcow‚Äù would appear even when the eyes are closed.

original: @57a * // 'on te zhen pa'i rtog pas nges par rtogs kyi dngos po mthong bas nges par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @57a * // 'on te zhen pa'i rtog pas nges par rtogs kyi dngos po mthong bas nges par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that conceptual thought definitely determines the object through attachment, but it is not determined through seeing the object,

original: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni ci yin /
analyzed: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni ci yin /
translated: what is this so-called attachment?

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid snang ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid snang ba'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the appearance of the nature of clarity,

original: rtog pa med par gyur kyang /
analyzed: rtog pa med par gyur kyang /
translated: then even when there is no conceptual thought,

original: mthong ba gsal bar snang ba yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba gsal bar snang ba yod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the appearance of the object of perception clear?

original: de'i phyir snang ba tha dad pas mthong ba dang nges pa dag la gcig par zhen pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba tha dad pas mthong ba dang nges pa dag la gcig par zhen pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in appearance, there is no adherence to the identity of perception and ascertainment.

original: 'o na ji ltar gcig pa nyid kyi tha snyad 'dogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gcig pa nyid kyi tha snyad 'dogs she na /
translated: But how is the convention of identity applied?

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig yin pas de nyid du zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyi 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir 'bras bu gcig yin pas de nyid du zhen pa yin te /
translated: Because the effect arises with the nature of engagement and disengagement, it is the same effect, and so there is adherence to that.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol pa gang zhig la mthong ba 'jug pa de nyid la rtog pa yang 'jig rten pa tha snyad du byed pa yin no //üîΩgal te rnam rtog chod pa yis //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol pa gang zhig la mthong ba 'jug pa de nyid la rtog pa yang 'jig rten pa tha snyad du byed pa yin no // gal te rnam rtog chod pa yis //
translated: Thus, when perception engages in something, the conceptual thought of an outsider also engages in it, and the world applies the convention of identity.üîΩIf you say that perception is interrupted

original: mthong ba rgyun chad 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: mthong ba rgyun chad 'gyur zhe na //
translated: because of the interruption of conceptual thought,

original: rigs tha dad pa'i rnam rtog ni //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i rnam rtog ni //
translated: if there were conceptual thought of a different type,

original: yod na gzhan gyi'ang ji ltar min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod na gzhan gyi'ang ji ltar min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: why would it not be the same for another?

original: 'o na gal te nges pa gzhan pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te nges pa gzhan pa nyid yin na /
translated: If ascertainment is different,

original: ji ltar de'i gzung ba mi gsal bar rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i gzung ba mi gsal bar rtog par 'gyur /
translated: how could it be conceived that its object is unclear?

original: 'on te de'i yul gzhan med na ni /
analyzed: 'on te de'i yul gzhan med na ni /
translated: But if there is no other object of that,

original: 'o na rnam par rtog pa yul med pa can dngos po mthong ba chod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rtog pa yul med pa can dngos po mthong ba chod pa'i phyir /
translated: then, since the conceptual cognition is without an object and the seeing of the thing is obstructed,

original: mthong ba rgyun 'chad par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba rgyun 'chad par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: it follows that the seeing is interrupted.

original: bar du rtog pa can du 'gyur ro //üîΩrgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du gsal bar mthong ba rgyun chad par snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bar du rtog pa can du 'gyur ro // rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du gsal bar mthong ba rgyun chad par snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In the interval, there would be a conceptual cognition.üîΩThe uninterrupted, clear seeing is not interrupted.

original: gang zhig mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa de'i gsal bar mthong ba rgyun mi 'chad de /
analyzed: gang zhig mngon sum rtog pa dang bcas pa de'i gsal bar mthong ba rgyun mi 'chad de /
translated: For one whose perception is conceptual, the clear seeing is uninterrupted,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid gsal bar snang ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa nyid gsal bar snang ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conceptual cognition itself is the clear appearance.

original: des na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum gyis shes pa rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na rtog pa dang bcas pa'i mngon sum gyis shes pa rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the uninterrupted cognition of conceptual perception is not interrupted.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: tha dad pa'i rigs kyi dngos po la rtogs pa skyes na /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rigs kyi dngos po la rtogs pa skyes na /
translated: When a conceptual cognition arises with regard to a thing of a different type,

original: rtog pa'i don las gzhan pa mthong ba ji ltar chod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtog pa'i don las gzhan pa mthong ba ji ltar chod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: how could the seeing of something other than the object of the conceptual cognition be obstructed?

original: tha dad pa'i dngos po la zhen pa mngon sum gyis shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i dngos po la zhen pa mngon sum gyis shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the direct perception of a different thing is not known.

original: de las gzhan pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cognition of the nature of the manifestation that is different from that.

original: de la gsal ba'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa ni mngon sum yin la de la rgyun chad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gsal ba'i ngo bo yongs su gcod pa ni mngon sum yin la de la rgyun chad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the ascertainment of the nature of the manifestation is direct perception, and there is no interruption of that.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pas chod kyang mthong ba rgyun chad par snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pas chod kyang mthong ba rgyun chad par snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though it is interrupted by conceptualization, the appearance of the seeing is not interrupted.

original: mgal me mthong ba bzhin dngos po'i //
analyzed: mgal me mthong ba bzhin dngos po'i //
translated: Like the appearance of a firebrandüîΩIf you assert that the thing

original: phyogs stobs ldan par 'dod na ni //
analyzed: phyogs stobs ldan par 'dod na ni //
translated: is powerful in that direction,

original: de gzhan la yang mtshungs @57b 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de gzhan la yang mtshungs @57b 'gyur zhing //
translated: then that is the same for others,

original: yi ge'ang cig car thos par 'gyur //
analyzed: yi ge'ang cig car thos par 'gyur //
translated: and the letters would be heard simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: 'o na gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pas mthong ba la chod par gyur pa yin na yang mthong ba'i dngos po bar na gnas pa de stobs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pas mthong ba la chod par gyur pa yin na yang mthong ba'i dngos po bar na gnas pa de stobs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: if the seeing is interrupted by a conceptualization of a different type, then the thing that is seen, which is in between, is powerful.

original: mthong ba'i dngos po stobs dang ldan pa des ma mthong ba gsal nas shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i dngos po stobs dang ldan pa des ma mthong ba gsal nas shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the powerful object that is seen does not clearly appear to the nonseeing consciousness,

original: chod par gyur pa'i mthong ba mi nges pa yin te /
analyzed: chod par gyur pa'i mthong ba mi nges pa yin te /
translated: it is uncertain that what is seen is obstructed.

original: 'di ltar mgal me myur du bskor ba mthong ba'i tshe bar na mthong ba yod na yang zil gyis mnan pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mgal me myur du bskor ba mthong ba'i tshe bar na mthong ba yod na yang zil gyis mnan pa'o zhe na /
translated: When one sees a rapidly spinning firebrand, if there is seeing in between, it is suppressed.

original: de lta na'o na gzhan du rigs mthun pa'i rtog pa la yang rtog pa med par mthong ba'i dngos po'i phyogs stobs dang ldan pa de yod pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba rgyun 'chad pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: de lta na'o na gzhan du rigs mthun pa'i rtog pa la yang rtog pa med par mthong ba'i dngos po'i phyogs stobs dang ldan pa de yod pa nyid kyi phyir mthong ba rgyun 'chad pa'i skabs med do //
translated: If that is so, then because the powerful side of the object that is seen without thought exists in other thoughts of the same type, there is no opportunity for the stream of seeing to be interrupted.

original: yang na khas blangs nas 'di skad du shin tu myur bar 'jug pa las tha mi dad par shes pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na khas blangs nas 'di skad du shin tu myur bar 'jug pa las tha mi dad par shes pa yin la /
translated: Or else, having accepted that, one might say, ‚ÄúConsciousness is not different from that which engages extremely quickly.

original: dngos su ni rtog pas chod pa snang ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos su ni rtog pas chod pa snang ba yin te /
translated: But in actuality, the object that is seen is interrupted by thought,

original: myur ba la bar nub par gyur nas rgyun mi 'chad par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: myur ba la bar nub par gyur nas rgyun mi 'chad par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is realized that the firebrand is seen without interruption, even though it sets in between.‚Äù

original: gal te shin tu myur bas chod pa'i shes pa mchod par snang ba yin na ni myur bar brjod pa'i yi ge dag cig car snang ba can du thos par 'gyur ba las de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te shin tu myur bas chod pa'i shes pa mchod par snang ba yin na ni myur bar brjod pa'i yi ge dag cig car snang ba can du thos par 'gyur ba las de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is the case that the cognition is perceived as very quickly interrupted, then the letters of the word ‚Äúquickly‚Äù would be heard as if they were all present at once, but that is not the case.

original: de bas na myur ba'i rim pa ma chod par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na myur ba'i rim pa ma chod par yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the quick succession is not the cause of the determination.

original: 'on te myur du brjod pa'i yi ge myur ba nyid ni lhan cig thos pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te myur du brjod pa'i yi ge myur ba nyid ni lhan cig thos pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the quick enunciation of the letters is not the reason for their simultaneous hearing,

original: de la lhan cig gcod pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhan cig gcod pa med do zhe na /
translated: then there is no simultaneous determination of them.

original: 'dir lan brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan brjod pa /
translated: Here is the reply:üîΩHere, even though all the objects are present simultaneously,

original: 'dir ni cig car don kun dang // 'dus can dbang rnams yod na yang //üîΩlnga po rnams kyi chod pa yang //
analyzed: 'dir ni cig car don kun dang // 'dus can dbang rnams yod na yang // lnga po rnams kyi chod pa yang //
translated: and the sense faculties are assembled,üîΩthe five cognitions appear as if they were interrupted,

original: chod med bzhin du snang ba'i blo //
analyzed: chod med bzhin du snang ba'i blo //
translated: as if they were not interrupted.

original: gang de ming gi mthar thug pa //
analyzed: gang de ming gi mthar thug pa //
translated: That is the limit of the name.

original: skad cig shes pa dang 'dre'i phyir //
analyzed: skad cig shes pa dang 'dre'i phyir //
translated: Because it is mixed with the momentary cognition,

original: chad par snang can de ngo mtshar //
analyzed: chad par snang can de ngo mtshar //
translated: the appearance of interruption is amazing.

original: de'i phyir blo ni cig car skyed //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ni cig car skyed //
translated: Therefore, the cognition arises simultaneously.

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: gang dag shes pa cig car ma yin par skye bar 'dod pa'i lugs kyis /
analyzed: gang dag shes pa cig car ma yin par skye bar 'dod pa'i lugs kyis /
translated: According to the system that asserts that consciousnesses do not arise simultaneously,

original: gang du cig car snang ba der myur du 'jug pa rgyu yin par smra ba de la 'di skad smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang du cig car snang ba der myur du 'jug pa rgyu yin par smra ba de la 'di skad smra bar bya ste /
translated: it is said that the cause of the rapid engagement of consciousness in an object is the simultaneous appearance of the object.

original: yi ge dag myur bar brjod na ji ltar cig car snang bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yi ge dag myur bar brjod na ji ltar cig car snang bar mi 'gyur /
translated: But if letters are pronounced rapidly, why don‚Äôt they appear simultaneously?

original: 'on te myur ba nyid de lta bur gyur pa de la med pa'i phyir /üîΩcig car nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te myur ba nyid de lta bur gyur pa de la med pa'i phyir / cig car nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they do not appear simultaneously because rapid pronunciation does not exist in that way,

original: 'o na gang na yul ma lus pa mnyam par 'dus pa dang / rnam par rtog pa bral bar ma gyur pa 'di na shin tu myur ba dang ldan pa med de /üîΩgang gi tshe gur @58a * //
analyzed: 'o na gang na yul ma lus pa mnyam par 'dus pa dang / rnam par rtog pa bral bar ma gyur pa 'di na shin tu myur ba dang ldan pa med de / gang gi tshe gur @58a * //
translated: then why is it that in this world, where all objects are gathered equally, there is no rapid engagement in an object free from conceptuality?üîΩWhen a woman anointed with saffron kisses the lower lip of a man, and he hears the sweet sound of her song,

original: kum gyi byug pas nye bar byugs pa'i 'gro ba bzang mo'i ma mchus ro myang ba dang glu snyan pa nyan pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: kum gyi byug pas nye bar byugs pa'i 'gro ba bzang mo'i ma mchus ro myang ba dang glu snyan pa nyan pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don dbang po thams cad dang cig car 'dus pa can gang yin pa'i dbang po rnams yod par gyur na yang /üîΩmthong ba lnga pos shes pa re re la chod pa de la de 'dra ba'i shin tu myur ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don dbang po thams cad dang cig car 'dus pa can gang yin pa'i dbang po rnams yod par gyur na yang / mthong ba lnga pos shes pa re re la chod pa de la de 'dra ba'i shin tu myur ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: If the sense faculties that simultaneously assemble with the objects such as form and so on exist,

original: cig car ma yin par snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car ma yin par snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that they would appear not simultaneously, because there is no such swiftness in the cognition of each of the five eyes that is obstructed.

original: de bas na de ltar chod par gyur kyang blo gang zhig 'das pa'i rigs mthun pa mthong bas ma chod pa bzhin du snang ba'i blo de ni ming gi mthar thug pa yi ge'i yul can skad cig ma'i shes pas chod pas ;
analyzed: de bas na de ltar chod par gyur kyang blo gang zhig 'das pa'i rigs mthun pa mthong bas ma chod pa bzhin du snang ba'i blo de ni ming gi mthar thug pa yi ge'i yul can skad cig ma'i shes pas chod pas ;
translated: Therefore, even though they are obstructed in that way, the cognition that appears as if it is not obstructed by a past cognition of a similar type is obstructed by the cognition of a moment that is the object of the final name, the syllable.

original: rgyun chad par snang ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar ba ste /
analyzed: rgyun chad par snang ba 'di ni shin tu ngo mtshar ba ste /
translated: This appearance of the interruption of the continuum is extremely amazing.

original: de'i phyir blo rnams ni cig car snang ba skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo rnams ni cig car snang ba skye bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, cognitions arise as simultaneous appearances,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'gal ba bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i 'gal ba bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aforementioned contradictions cannot be averted.

original: de bas ni yid ni cig car 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas ni yid ni cig car 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is engaged in a single instant. This is the position.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / snang ba la ni khyad med na'ang //
analyzed: gzhan yang / snang ba la ni khyad med na'ang //
translated: Even though there is no difference in appearance,

original: bar bcas bar med ji ltar rung //
analyzed: bar bcas bar med ji ltar rung //
translated: how could there be an interval or no interval?

original: yid kyi rtog pa 'ba' zhig la'ang //
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pa 'ba' zhig la'ang //
translated: Even in the case of a mere conceptual thought of the mind,

original: rim pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rim pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the order would not be apprehended.

original: 'dir la la ru bar dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir la la ru bar dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Here, some are with an interval,

original: gang na tha dad pa'i rigs kyi rtog pas chod pa'o //
analyzed: gang na tha dad pa'i rigs kyi rtog pas chod pa'o //
translated: where there is an interruption by a conceptual thought of a different type.

original: la lar ni bar med par snang ba ste /
analyzed: la lar ni bar med par snang ba ste /
translated: Some are without an interval,

original: gang na rigs mi mthun pa'i rtog pas mchod pa yod par ro //
analyzed: gang na rigs mi mthun pa'i rtog pas mchod pa yod par ro //
translated: where there is no interruption by a conceptual thought of a different type.

original: des na bar chad dang bar med par mthong ba ji ltar snang ba khyad par med par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na bar chad dang bar med par mthong ba ji ltar snang ba khyad par med par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could there be a difference in appearance, whether there is an interval or no interval?

original: yid kyi rtog pa mthong ba dang bral ba 'ba' zhig yul la zhen par byed pa can myur du 'jug pa can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi rtog pa mthong ba dang bral ba 'ba' zhig yul la zhen par byed pa can myur du 'jug pa can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mind is engaged in a mere conceptual thought that is free from seeing and is attached to the object and is engaged quickly,

original: rim gyis 'dzin pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the order would not be apprehended.

original: 'o na gal te cig car shes pa skye na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te cig car shes pa skye na /
translated: Now, if consciousness arises all at once,

original: ji ltar rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i yul la mig phye  bar gyur kyang res 'ga' snang ba med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rung ba'i yul na gnas pa'i yul la mig phye  bar gyur kyang res 'ga' snang ba med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the eye is open in a suitable place, why is there sometimes no appearance?

original: de la lan smras pa /
analyzed: de la lan smras pa /
translated: The response to that is:

original: la lar kun du chags sems ldan //
analyzed: la lar kun du chags sems ldan //
translated: In some cases, there is a mind that is full of attachment,

original: don nye ba la'ang 'dzin med gang //
analyzed: don nye ba la'ang 'dzin med gang //
translated: But there is no apprehension of an object that is near.

original: chags las gzhan skyed mi nus phyir //
analyzed: chags las gzhan skyed mi nus phyir //
translated: Because it is unable to generate another consciousness,

original: brtsad pa de ni gnyi gar mtshungs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtsad pa de ni gnyi gar mtshungs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The dispute is the same for both.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la lar kun du chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i skye bo mig dang 'brel pa'i don nye bar gyur pa 'dzin pa med pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la lar kun du chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i skye bo mig dang 'brel pa'i don nye bar gyur pa 'dzin pa med pa gang yin pa /
translated: In some cases, there is a person who has a mind that is full of attachment to a desired object, but there is no apprehension of an object that is near and connected to the eye.

original: yul gzhan la zhen pas bcom pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa can gyi shes pa gzhan skyed pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul gzhan la zhen pas bcom pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa can gyi shes pa gzhan skyed pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is unable to generate another consciousness that has the capacity to generate a consciousness that is overcome by attachment to another object,

original: yul gzhan @58b la gtod par mi nus pa'i sems kyis shes pa gzhan bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yul gzhan @58b la gtod par mi nus pa'i sems kyis shes pa gzhan bskyed par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could a mind that is unable to direct itself to another object generate another consciousness?

original: gzhan yang bdag cag gnyi ga la brtsad pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag cag gnyi ga la brtsad pa mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the dispute is the same for both of us.

original: 'on te yid gcig yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te yid gcig yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the mind is one,

original: dbang po gcig la chags pa ni shes pa gtod par byed pa'i nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan du zhen pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po gcig la chags pa ni shes pa gtod par byed pa'i nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir gzhan du zhen pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then when one sense faculty is attached, the mind is not attached to another object because the power of directing the consciousness is different.

original: de ltar na yang myur du 'jug pas yid kyis shes pa yang go rims med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te de la kun du chags pa chen po yod pa'i phyir /üîΩcig car 'dzin pa'i shes pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang myur du 'jug pas yid kyis shes pa yang go rims med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro // 'on te de la kun du chags pa chen po yod pa'i phyir / cig car 'dzin pa'i shes pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even so, because the mind engages its object quickly, it is understood that the mind cognizes its object in a random order.üîΩBut if you say that the mind does not cognize its object simultaneously because it has a strong attachment to it,

original: de lta na ni de la kun du chags pa tha dad pas nus pa bcom pa'i yid ni shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes ci'i phyir khas mi len /
analyzed: de lta na ni de la kun du chags pa tha dad pas nus pa bcom pa'i yid ni shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no zhes ci'i phyir khas mi len /
translated: then why not accept that the mind, whose power is destroyed by a different attachment, does not generate consciousness?

original: 'on te mgal mel rim par mthong ba skyes na yang /
analyzed: 'on te mgal mel rim par mthong ba skyes na yang /
translated: But if you say that although the mind that sees a firebrand circle is generated in sequence,

original: cig car snang ba skye ba ste /
analyzed: cig car snang ba skye ba ste /
translated: the appearance of the circle is generated simultaneously,

original: rim par snang ba can gyi rig pa rnams mtshams sbyar nas 'khor lor mthong ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rim par snang ba can gyi rig pa rnams mtshams sbyar nas 'khor lor mthong ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the consciousnesses that see the appearance of the circle are connected and the appearance of a circle is generated,üîΩwe reply:

original: smras pa / mgal me la sogs myur 'jig phyir//üîΩrjes su 'gro bas bcom pa can //
analyzed: smras pa / mgal me la sogs myur 'jig phyir// rjes su 'gro bas bcom pa can //
translated: Objection: Because of the rapid destruction of a firebrand, etc.,üîΩit is perceived as a circle.

original: mig gi 'khor lor 'khrul byas kyi //
analyzed: mig gi 'khor lor 'khrul byas kyi //
translated: The eye, having been deceived by the circle,

original: de mthong mtshams sbyor bas ma yin //
analyzed: de mthong mtshams sbyor bas ma yin //
translated: sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.

original: zhes bya ba ste /üîΩshin tu myur bar 'jug pa'i mgal me la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bskor ba gang yin pa des bcom par byas pa can gyi dbang po mig ces bya ba 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul nas skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / shin tu myur bar 'jug pa'i mgal me la sogs pa'i rjes su 'gro ba bskor ba gang yin pa des bcom par byas pa can gyi dbang po mig ces bya ba 'khor lo'i rnam par 'khrul nas skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Reply:üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.

original: 'khor lor 'khrul pa de mgal me mthong ba mtshams sbyar nas skyes pa ma yin no //üîΩde bas na rnam par shes pa lnga cig car nyid du skye'o zhes bya bar gnas so //üîΩ'on te don lnga po tsam la cig car snang ba 'khrul par khas len na ni /
analyzed: 'khor lor 'khrul pa de mgal me mthong ba mtshams sbyar nas skyes pa ma yin no // de bas na rnam par shes pa lnga cig car nyid du skye'o zhes bya bar gnas so // 'on te don lnga po tsam la cig car snang ba 'khrul par khas len na ni /
translated: The eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.

original: de lta na dngos po ma lus pa'i yul can cig car snang ba'i 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na dngos po ma lus pa'i yul can cig car snang ba'i 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction of the eye and the firebrand.üîΩThe eye, having been deceived by the circle, sees it, not by the conjunction

original: 'on te dngos po thams cad pa'i yid kyi shes pa yang cig car mngon sum gyi rnam pa bzhin du 'khrul par khas len par byed do zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po thams cad pa'i yid kyi shes pa yang cig car mngon sum gyi rnam pa bzhin du 'khrul par khas len par byed do zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But if you accept that the mental consciousness that perceives all things arises simultaneously and is mistaken like a direct perception, that is not so.

original: rim pa med pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rim pa med pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no valid knowledge of a nonsequential order.

original: cig car snang ba ni gsal bar gyur pa'i mngon sum las shes par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: cig car snang ba ni gsal bar gyur pa'i mngon sum las shes par 'gyur gyi /
translated: A simultaneous appearance is known from a direct perception that is clear.

original: de las bzlog pa'i yid kyi shes pa la med do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i yid kyi shes pa la med do //
translated: But that is not the case for a mental consciousness that is the opposite of that.

original: gal te bzlog par mthong ba med par 'khrul par rig na ni rig pa ma lus pa la thal ba 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: gal te bzlog par mthong ba med par 'khrul par rig na ni rig pa ma lus pa la thal ba 'di mtshungs so //
translated: If you know that it is mistaken because you do not see the opposite, then this consequence is the same for all awarenesses.

original: de'i phyir cig car nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i tshogs bzlog par rigs pa med pa'i phyir /üîΩcig car @59a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir cig car nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i tshogs bzlog par rigs pa med pa'i phyir / cig car @59a * //
translated: Therefore, because it is illogical that the collection of consciousnesses that experience simultaneously are reversed,

original: ba'o zhes bya ba 'grub po //
analyzed: ba'o zhes bya ba 'grub po //
translated: it is established that they are simultaneous.

original: de bas na rtog pa dang bral ba nyid mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rtog pa dang bral ba nyid mngon sum yin no //
translated: Therefore, being free from thought is direct perception.

original: de ltar mngon sum rtog pa med par rang gi gzhung gis bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum rtog pa med par rang gi gzhung gis bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained direct perception as being free from thought in our own system,üîΩnow, in order to refute the assertions of others, it is said:

original: da ni gzhan gyi gzhung bkod nas bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan gyi gzhung bkod nas bzlog par bya ste /
translated: Now, having set forth the opponent‚Äôs position, we will refute it.

original: kha cig dbang skyes la sogs phyir //
analyzed: kha cig dbang skyes la sogs phyir //
translated: Some say that because it arises from the sense faculties, etc.,üîΩIt is non-conceptual, like the cognition of a small child.

original: bus pa'i blo bzhin rtog med dang // bus pa'i rtog med kyi rgyu yang //
analyzed: bus pa'i blo bzhin rtog med dang // bus pa'i rtog med kyi rgyu yang //
translated: And the cause of the non-conceptual cognition of a small child

original: brda dman pa nyid yin smra ba //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brda dman pa nyid yin smra ba // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Is said to be the weakness of the signs.

original: ha ri sva mi la sogs pa kha cig dbang po las skyes pa'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang po'i blo la rtog pa yod pa ma yin par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: ha ri sva mi la sogs pa kha cig dbang po las skyes pa'i phyir dang / sogs pa'i sgras nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi dbang po'i blo la rtog pa yod pa ma yin par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Some, such as Hari, Svapo, and so on, say that because it arises from the sense faculties, and because it engages through the aspect of experience, and so on, as indicated by the term ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù the cognition of the sense faculties is said to be non-conceptual.

original: bus pa'i dbang po'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: bus pa'i dbang po'i blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of the sense faculties of a small child.

original: bus pa'i dbang po'i shes pa la rtog pa med pa ni brda 'dzin par mi nus pa rgyur smra'o //
analyzed: bus pa'i dbang po'i shes pa la rtog pa med pa ni brda 'dzin par mi nus pa rgyur smra'o //
translated: They say that the cause of the non-conceptual cognition of the sense faculties of a small child is the inability to apprehend signs.

original: de dag gis ni rtog med phyir //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rtog med phyir //
translated: Because it is non-conceptual,

original: bus pa'i mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: bus pa'i mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
translated: It would be the direct perception of a small child.

original: brda yi rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: brda yi rgyu dang bral ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it is devoid of the cause of signs,

original: de ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be that later.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: de ltar rgol ba de dag gis gzhung gis bus pa rnams kyi shes pa mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar rgol ba de dag gis gzhung gis bus pa rnams kyi shes pa mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the cognition of those who are childish due to the scriptures of those disputants would be direct perception.

original: 'on te bus pa'i shes pa ma lus pa rtog pa med pa nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bus pa'i shes pa ma lus pa rtog pa med pa nyid du 'dod do zhe na /
translated: But if you accept that all childish cognition is non-conceptual,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gzhon nu ma'i rang gi don byed pa la snga phyi brtag par byed pa'i rtog pa yod do //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i rang gi don byed pa la snga phyi brtag par byed pa'i rtog pa yod do //
translated: For the cognition of a young girl who is engaged in her own purpose is conceptual, as it investigates what is prior and what is subsequent.

original: 'on te de la rtog pa sngar med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de la rtog pa sngar med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is no prior conceptualization in that case,

original: 'o na phyis kyang rtog pas skyed par mi byed de brda yongs su dpyod pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na phyis kyang rtog pas skyed par mi byed de brda yongs su dpyod pa'i thabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then later also conceptualization does not generate it, because there is no means of investigating the sign.

original: yongs su dpyod pa ni rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su dpyod pa ni rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because investigation is conceptualization.

original: de yang bus ba la med na de ji ltar rgyu mtshan med par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur /üîΩgal te brda la ma byang ba'i //
analyzed: de yang bus ba la med na de ji ltar rgyu mtshan med par rtog pa skye bar 'gyur / gal te brda la ma byang ba'i //
translated: And if that does not exist for the childish, how could conceptualization arise without a reason?üîΩIf you accept that

original: yid yod des ni de 'dod na //
analyzed: yid yod des ni de 'dod na //
translated: because there is a mind that is not trained in signs,

original: de bzhin dbang skyes la yang 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin dbang skyes la yang 'gyur //
translated: then it would be the same for one arisen from the sense faculties.

original: 'di lta bu 'di lhag ldan yin //
analyzed: 'di lta bu 'di lhag ldan yin //
translated: This is an additional fault.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'on te bus pa yang brda lam byang ba'i yid tha snyad la zhugs pa yod de /
analyzed: 'on te bus pa yang brda lam byang ba'i yid tha snyad la zhugs pa yod de /
translated: But children do have minds that engage in conventional expressions that are trained in signs.

original: brda la ma byang ba'i yid des ni brda byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brda la ma byang ba'i yid des ni brda byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that mind that is not trained in signs is the one that creates signs.

original: rtog pa de phyis yid las 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa de phyis yid las 'dod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that thought is asserted to be later than mind,

original: de lta na 'o na ni dbang po las skyes pa'i rig pa la yang bus pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni dbang po las skyes pa'i rig pa la yang bus pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: then the awareness that arises from the sense faculties would be thought for children,

original: bus pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i blo brda 'dogs par rung bar brjod par bus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bus pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i blo brda 'dogs par rung bar brjod par bus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that arises from the sense faculties of children is said to be suitable to designate signs because it is the mind of a child.

original: 'on te dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir bus pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i blo rtog pa med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po las skyes pa nyid kyi phyir bus pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i blo rtog pa med pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the mind that arises from the sense faculties of children is not thought because it arises from the sense faculties,

original: de 'di 'dra ba dbang po las @59b skyes pa'i rtags 'di ni 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'di 'dra ba dbang po las @59b skyes pa'i rtags 'di ni 'brel pa nges pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then this sign that arises from the sense faculties is not ascertained to be related to the predicate.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that it is related to the remainder?

original: yang na gal te bus pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad la byang ba'i lus dang ldan pa la mig la skyes pa can gyi shes pa rtog pa med par ci ltar shes te /
analyzed: yang na gal te bus pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad la byang ba'i lus dang ldan pa la mig la skyes pa can gyi shes pa rtog pa med par ci ltar shes te /
translated: Or, if you say that the consciousness that arises from the sense faculty of the eye is nonconceptual, then how could a body that is trained in conventions know that which arises from the eye through a nonconceptual consciousness?

original: gnod pa can gyi shes pas gzhag pa med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i rtags med par dpe tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi shes pas gzhag pa med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i rtags med par dpe tsam gyis go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not understood through mere examples without a reason that is ascertained to be necessarily related to the object, since it is not established by a consciousness that is impaired.

original: 'on te dbang pos nye bar blangs pa'i shes pa skye ba de ni nye bar gyur pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /üîΩ'das pa dang ma 'ongs par nges pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang pos nye bar blangs pa'i shes pa skye ba de ni nye bar gyur pa'i rnam pa 'dzin pa'i phyir / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs par nges pa dang bral ba'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the consciousness that arises from the sense faculty that has taken hold of it is nonconceptual because it apprehends the aspect that is present,üîΩthen how could it be free from conceptualization because it is free from ascertaining the nature of the past and the future?

original: de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges pa dang bral ba 'di ji ltar grub /
analyzed: de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges pa dang bral ba 'di ji ltar grub /
translated: How is it established that it is free from ascertaining the nature of the past and the future?

original: snga ma dang phyi ma mngon du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma mngon du byed pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the past and the future are not manifest.

original: mngon du byed pa mngon sum ma yin na /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa mngon sum ma yin na /
translated: If the manifest is not manifest,üîΩthen how could it be ascertained?

original: 'o na ni rtags dbang po las skyes pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rtags dbang po las skyes pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But then it would be pointless for the reason to arise from the sense faculty.

original: mngon sum gyi shes par bya bas rtog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi shes par bya bas rtog pa med pa yin te /
translated: It is not conceptual because it is the object of direct perception.

original: nye bar gyur pa mngon sum byed pa ni mngon sum gyis myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa mngon sum byed pa ni mngon sum gyis myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the direct experience of what is present, it is experienced by direct perception.

original: 'on te mngon sum du byas pa'i rnam pa can du bus pa'i shes pa de las gzhan pa'i mngon du byed pa'i shes pa yang yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum du byas pa'i rnam pa can du bus pa'i shes pa de las gzhan pa'i mngon du byed pa'i shes pa yang yin pa de bas na /
translated: But if it is the cognition that arises from the aspect of what is made directly perceived, then it is the cognition that makes directly perceived something other than that.

original: ji ltar rtog pa med par ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtog pa med par ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: So how is it not established as nonconceptual?üîΩBecause it arises from the sense faculty, it is established by inference.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i phyir zhes rjes su dpag pa las yin no zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i phyir zhes rjes su dpag pa las yin no zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: bus pa la sgrub gang yin la //
analyzed: bus pa la sgrub gang yin la //
translated: Whatever is established for the childish

original: de nyid 'dir yang brjod par bya //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir yang brjod par bya //
translated: should be stated here as well.

original: dbang po'i blo dag mtshungs phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo dag mtshungs phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of the sense faculties is the same.

original: 'dis ni myong sogs bshad pa yin //
analyzed: 'dis ni myong sogs bshad pa yin //
translated: This explains experience and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang bus pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i don mngon du byed pa gang yin pa'i don mngon du byed pa tha snyad la byang ba'i rgyud las byung ba'i mngon sum la yang rtog pa med pa nyid grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang bus pa'i shes pa rtog pa med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa'i don mngon du byed pa gang yin pa'i don mngon du byed pa tha snyad la byang ba'i rgyud las byung ba'i mngon sum la yang rtog pa med pa nyid grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The non-conceptual nature of the consciousness that is produced is established by the direct perception that is the experience of the object, and the non-conceptual nature of the direct perception that is the experience of the object is established by the direct perception that arises from the continuum that is familiar with conventions.

original: sgrub byed du brjod par bya'i /
analyzed: sgrub byed du brjod par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, it should be said that this is the proof.

original: dbang po las skyes pa brjod pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa brjod pa 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the point of saying that it arises from the sense faculties?

original: dbang po'i shes pa rnams dngos po mngon du byed par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa rnams dngos po mngon du byed par mtshungs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because the sense consciousnesses are similar in that they experience objects.

original: gang yang nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags gzhan brjod pa de yang /
analyzed: gang yang nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags gzhan brjod pa de yang /
translated: Also, the other reason that was stated, ‚Äúbecause it engages the aspect that is experienced,‚Äù

original: don mngon du byed pa'i mngon sum 'dis bsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: don mngon du byed pa'i mngon sum 'dis bsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: is refuted by this direct perception that experiences the object,

original: rtog pa med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-conceptual nature is established.

original: 'di ltar mngon du byed pa nyid la rtog pa med pas khyab la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon du byed pa nyid la rtog pa med pas khyab la /
translated: Thus, the experience of the object is necessarily non-conceptual.

original: rtog pa med pa nyid ni rtog pa @60a * //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid ni rtog pa @60a * //
translated: And the non-conceptual nature is necessarily free from conceptualization.

original: dang bcas pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang bcas pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would contradict the fact that it is associated with conceptual thought.

original: yang na mngon du byed pa la ni rtog pa med pas khyab pa ste /
analyzed: yang na mngon du byed pa la ni rtog pa med pas khyab pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is pervaded by the absence of direct perception, because it is conceptual thought.

original: de'i phyir 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pas rtog pa dang bral ba mthong ba'i bdag nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pas rtog pa dang bral ba mthong ba'i bdag nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the pervasion by contradiction is observed, it demonstrates that it is free from conceptual thought and has the nature of seeing.

original: gal te rtog pa bkag pa nyid kyis mngon du byed par ston cing /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa bkag pa nyid kyis mngon du byed par ston cing /
translated: If it demonstrates direct perception by merely refuting conceptual thought,

original: des kyang mngon sum ston na ni /
analyzed: des kyang mngon sum ston na ni /
translated: and if that also demonstrates direct perception,

original: 'o na gal te rtog pa med pa nyid mngon du byed par grub na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rtog pa med pa nyid mngon du byed par grub na /
translated: then if the absence of conceptual thought is established as direct perception,

original: mngon du byed pas kyang mngon sum nyid sgrub pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis su rig pa yang mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon du byed pas kyang mngon sum nyid sgrub pa'i phyir zla ba gnyis su rig pa yang mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then since direct perception also establishes direct perception, even the cognition of two moons would become direct perception.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the distinction that it is nondeceptive.

original: 'o na 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin mod rtog pa dang bral bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'khrul pa med pa nyid yin mod rtog pa dang bral bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, if it is nondeceptive, what is the use of being free from conceptual thought?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,üîΩbecause it is not nondeceptive.

original: gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas khyad par du nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lugs la ltos nas khyad par du nye bar bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is specifically mentioned in relation to the other system.

original: de skad du yang mtshan nyid khyad par du byas pa ni gzhan gyi lugs la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de skad du yang mtshan nyid khyad par du byas pa ni gzhan gyi lugs la ltos pa ste /
translated: And thus it is said: ‚ÄúThe characteristic is specified in relation to the other system.

original: thams cad rtog pa med pa nyid dang thams cad 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: thams cad rtog pa med pa nyid dang thams cad 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: All cognitions are non-conceptual and non-erroneous.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis 'khrul pa med par yang dmigs kyis dgar bas rab rib bcas pa zhes bya ba phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'khrul pa med par yang dmigs kyis dgar bas rab rib bcas pa zhes bya ba phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Master [Vasubandhu] will later explain that ‚Äúhaving an object that is non-erroneous‚Äù is specified by ‚Äúhaving an object that is not distorted.‚Äù

original: yang na dbang po la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na dbang po la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because it operates in dependence on the sense faculty,

original: dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: dbang po la brten pa'i shes pa ni mngon sum ste /
translated: the cognition that is dependent on the sense faculty is perception.

original: de'i phyir mngon du byed par shes par bya ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon du byed par shes par bya ste ;
translated: Therefore, it should be understood as that which makes the object manifest.

original: shes pa thams cad mngon du byed cing 'jug pa ni rtog pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad mngon du byed cing 'jug pa ni rtog pa med pa nyid do //
translated: All cognitions are non-conceptual and non-erroneous in that they make the object manifest and operate.

original: yang na 'dis yul la khyab pa'i phyir mngon sum ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dis yul la khyab pa'i phyir mngon sum ste /
translated: Or, it is perception because it pervades the object.

original: yul gyi ngo bo nyid la khyab pa yang mngon du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gyi ngo bo nyid la khyab pa yang mngon du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the direct perception of the very nature of the object.

original: dbang po las skyes pa ma lus rtog pa dang bral ba can no //
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa ma lus rtog pa dang bral ba can no //
translated: It is free from conceptual thought, and it arises from the sense faculties.

original: yang na slob dpon ma 'khrul bar bzhed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na slob dpon ma 'khrul bar bzhed pa ma yin te /
translated: Or else, the master does not accept that it is nonerroneous,

original: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid do zhes bya bas mtshan nyid bshad do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba nyid do zhes bya bas mtshan nyid bshad do //
translated: because he explains the definition as ‚Äúfree from conceptual thought.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar zla ba gnyis su snang bar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zla ba gnyis su snang bar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the appearance of two moons refuted?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not.

original: thams cad mngon du byed pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mngon du byed pa mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all direct perception is direct perception of something.

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba yang gnyis su gsal bar yongs su gcod pas mngon sum kho nas yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba yang gnyis su gsal bar yongs su gcod pas mngon sum kho nas yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the appearance of two moons is direct perception that determines the manifestation of two moons.

original: gang du mngon du byed pa der de mngon sum ste /
analyzed: gang du mngon du byed pa der de mngon sum ste /
translated: Where there is direct perception, there is direct perception of that.

original: phyi rol gyi zla ba mthong ba la ni mngon du byed pa po ma yin la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zla ba mthong ba la ni mngon du byed pa po ma yin la /
translated: In seeing the external moon, there is no direct perception of the appearance of two moons.

original: de la ltos nas 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltos nas 'khrul pa'o //
translated: In dependence on that, there is error.

original: 'di ltar snang bar gyur ba'i zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol pa de na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar snang bar gyur ba'i zla ba gnyis kyi rnam pa las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol pa de na med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because, apart from the aspect of the two moons that appear, there is no external object that exists as it is imagined.

original: rtog pas @60b gzhag pa'i phyi rol la ltos nas rig pa 'khrul par brjod kyi /
analyzed: rtog pas @60b gzhag pa'i phyi rol la ltos nas rig pa 'khrul par brjod kyi /
translated: In dependence upon the external object that is posited by conceptualization, we speak of the error of cognition.

original: de kho na nyid du snang ba 'khrul bar srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kho na nyid du snang ba 'khrul bar srid pa ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, it is not possible for the appearance to be erroneous.

original: de skad du yang yid ni shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang yid ni shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: And it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind is not erroneous because it is the object of cognition.‚Äù

original: de dag gis ni mngon du byed pa nyid kyis mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bar grub pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni mngon du byed pa nyid kyis mngon sum rtog pa dang bral bar grub pa'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the position that perception is established as being nonerroneous and free from conceptuality by virtue of its being a direct perceiver.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / khyad par dang ni khyad par gzhi //
analyzed: gzhan yang / khyad par dang ni khyad par gzhi //
translated: The distinction and the basis of the distinction,

original: 'brel pa 'jig rten gzhung lugs ni //
analyzed: 'brel pa 'jig rten gzhung lugs ni //
translated: The relation, and the worldly conventions,

original: gzung ste de dag bsdoms nas su //
analyzed: gzung ste de dag bsdoms nas su //
translated: Are apprehended, and they are combined,

original: de ltar rtogs te gzhan du min //üîΩdper dbyug can bzhin rigs sogs kyi //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs te gzhan du min // dper dbyug can bzhin rigs sogs kyi //
translated: And thus it is understood, not otherwise.

original: bye brag dpyod pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag dpyod pa med phyir ro //
translated: For example, like the possessor of a stick, because there is no analysis of the particulars of the class.

original: de ltar sbyor ba dag med pas //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba dag med pas //
translated: Since there is no such application,

original: de phyir 'di la rtog pa'ang med //üîΩces bya ba la /üîΩkhyad par du gyur pa'i rigs la sogs pa rnams dang / rdzas khyad par can du gyur pa'i rdzas 'dzin pa ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de phyir 'di la rtog pa'ang med // ces bya ba la / khyad par du gyur pa'i rigs la sogs pa rnams dang / rdzas khyad par can du gyur pa'i rdzas 'dzin pa ni rtog pa ste /
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúconception‚Äù is the apprehension of a special substance, such as a special type, and so on.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.

original: rna cha la sogs pa so so'i khyad par dang / lha sbyin la sogs pa khyad par can de dag ldan pa'i rang bzhin na ma 'phrod pa 'du ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa mchog la sogs pa kha cig la 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa yang nges pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar 'brel pa khyad par med na yang rna ba'i bug pa la 'phyang bas rna cha can no zhes tha snyad 'dogs kyi /üîΩmgrin par btags pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rna cha la sogs pa so so'i khyad par dang / lha sbyin la sogs pa khyad par can de dag ldan pa'i rang bzhin na ma 'phrod pa 'du ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'brel pa mchog la sogs pa kha cig la 'dzin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa yang nges pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar 'brel pa khyad par med na yang rna ba'i bug pa la 'phyang bas rna cha can no zhes tha snyad 'dogs kyi /üîΩmgrin par btags pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of those special substances.üîΩThe conception of a special substance is the apprehension of a special substance, such as earrings, and so on, as the nature of a composite of the individual features of earrings, and so on, and Devadatta, and so on, as the nature of a composite of

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i rtog pa skyes pa gang yin pa dran pa dang brjod pas tha snyad kyi dus su bsdoms nas de ltar khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i rtog pa skyes pa gang yin pa dran pa dang brjod pas tha snyad kyi dus su bsdoms nas de ltar khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur par rtogs kyi /
translated: Later, when the thought ‚ÄúThis is a man with a stick‚Äù arises, it is a recollection and expression that combines the two times of the conventional. Thus, it is a cognition that is qualified by a qualifier.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not otherwise,

original: tha snyad kyi dus na dran pa ma rtogs par rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus na dran pa ma rtogs par rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because at the time of the conventional, there is no cognition of the qualifier without the cognition of the qualified.

original: dper na sngar sbyin na gzung zhing khyad par dbyug pa yang bzung nas de dag 'brel par yang bzung ste /
analyzed: dper na sngar sbyin na gzung zhing khyad par dbyug pa yang bzung nas de dag 'brel par yang bzung ste /
translated: For example, when one first apprehends the stick and the man, one apprehends the connection between them.

original: lag pas bzung ba'i dbyug pa nyid kyis dbyug pa can zhes brjod pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa gzung na dbyug pa can no snyam pa'i rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: lag pas bzung ba'i dbyug pa nyid kyis dbyug pa can zhes brjod pa la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa gzung na dbyug pa can no snyam pa'i rtog pa skye bar 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: When one apprehends the stick held in the man‚Äôs hand, one apprehends the man as the possessor of the stick. When one apprehends the worldly convention ‚Äúman with a stick,‚Äù the thought ‚ÄúThis is a man with a stick‚Äù arises.

original: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba rnams ni gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad par mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba rnams ni gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad par mthong ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: But since one never sees a universal, a quality, or an action as a different entity from the individual,

original: rigs la sogs pa de dang ldan pa de dang lhan cig sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa de dang ldan pa de dang lhan cig sbyor ba med de /
translated: That which possesses the class and so on does not join with it.

original: sbyor ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i lus can 'di la rtog pa yang med par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar tha dad par snang ba can @61a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa de nyid kyi phyir dbang po las skyes pa'i lus can 'di la rtog pa yang med par 'gyur te / 'di ltar tha dad par snang ba can @61a * //
translated: Because there is no joining, this body that arises from the sense faculties would not have any thoughts.

original: gyi sbyor ba yin nam /üîΩtha mi dad par snang ba can gyi yin grang na /
analyzed: gyi sbyor ba yin nam / tha mi dad par snang ba can gyi yin grang na /
translated: In this way, does the joining have the appearance of difference?üîΩOr does it have the appearance of nondifference?

original: de la gal te tha dad pa med par yongs su bcad pa'i don sbyor ba yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te tha dad pa med par yongs su bcad pa'i don sbyor ba yin na /
translated: If the meaning of the exclusion of difference is the joining,

original: de lta na ni tha dad pa med par mthong ba can de gcig pa nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: de lta na ni tha dad pa med par mthong ba can de gcig pa nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba med de /
translated: then in that case, because of seeing nondifference, there is no joining, because of being one.

original: sbyor ba ni dngos po gnyis la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dngos po gnyis la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because joining depends on two things.

original: 'on te tha dad par snang ba can gyi don gnyis sbyor na ni de'i tshe yang phan tshun tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad par snang ba can gyi don gnyis sbyor na ni de'i tshe yang phan tshun tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: But if the meaning of the joining of the two is the appearance of difference, then in that case, because of seeing each other as different,

original: shin tu yang sbyor ba med par gsal ba'i phyir sbyor ba bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu yang sbyor ba med par gsal ba'i phyir sbyor ba bden pa ma yin no //
translated: it is very clear that there is no joining, and therefore joining is not real.

original: yang rdzas la sbyor ba yod du chug kyang rigs la sogs pa la ni so sor tha dad par snang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang rdzas la sbyor ba yod du chug kyang rigs la sogs pa la ni so sor tha dad par snang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, even if there were conjunction with substance, there is no separate appearance of the class, etc.

original: rigs dang ldan pa la sogs pa rnams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa la sogs pa rnams sbyor ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no conjunction with that which possesses the class, etc.

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad par rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba rnams shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad par rigs dang yon tan dang bya ba rnams shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the class, quality, and action are not known as separate from the nature of the manifestation.

original: rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa la sogs pa tha dad par ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rigs dang rigs dang ldan pa la sogs pa tha dad par ma mthong ba nyid kyi phyir sbyor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there no conjunction because the class, that which possesses the class, etc. are not seen as separate?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: tha dad pa dag tha mi dad par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa dag tha mi dad par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: because what is separate does not arise as non-separate.

original: 'on te dus dang yul mtshungs pa can gcig tu snang ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus dang yul mtshungs pa can gcig tu snang ba'o zhe na /
translated: But they appear as one, having the same time and place?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: dus dang yul mtshungs pa can gyi rol sogs pa rnams tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dang yul mtshungs pa can gyi rol sogs pa rnams tha dad par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the taste, etc. that have the same time and place are seen as separate.

original: yul tha dad pa can yin yang ngo bo nyid tha dad par shes pa nyid kyis tha dad pa yin gyi /
