analyzed: yul tha dad pa can yin yang ngo bo nyid tha dad par shes pa nyid kyis tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Even though they have different objects, they are separate because they are known as having different natures.

original: yul dang dus tha dad pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus tha dad pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by a difference of place and time.

original: gal te yang de la ngo bo tha dad par khas mi len na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang de la ngo bo tha dad par khas mi len na ni /
translated: If you do not accept that there is a difference in nature,

original: 'o na yul la sogs pa tha dad kyang tha dad par shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na yul la sogs pa tha dad kyang tha dad par shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then even though there is a difference in object, etc., there is no difference in consciousness.

original: 'o na gal te mthong ba dag pas rigs la sogs pa dag mi shes pa de lta na yang mthong ba'i dus phyis rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pas gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i rigs pa la sogs pa shes pa ma yin namüîΩ/ 'di ltar dpag tu med par tha dad pa can gyi gsal ba rnams la ba lang zhes bya ba de nyid du shes pa yin gyi /üîΩba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pas rang bzhin phan tshun tha dad pa can gsal ba ston pa'o zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mthong ba dag pas rigs la sogs pa dag mi shes pa de lta na yang mthong ba'i dus phyis rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pas gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i rigs pa la sogs pa shes pa ma yin nam / 'di ltar dpag tu med par tha dad pa can gyi gsal ba rnams la ba lang zhes bya ba de nyid du shes pa yin gyi / ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pas rang bzhin phan tshun tha dad pa can gsal ba ston pa'o zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If, although the visual consciousness does not know the universal, etc., later, after the time of seeing, the subsequent consciousness does know the universal, etc., which is different from the nature of the manifest?üîΩIt is not reasonable to say that the universal is known as the same in all the different individual things, because the subsequent consciousness does not know the individual things.

original: de dag ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that the consciousness thinking ‚Äúcow‚Äù reveals the individual things, which are different from each other by nature, because they are different in nature.

original: smras pa / rjes 'gro can gyi rnam shes gang //
analyzed: smras pa / rjes 'gro can gyi rnam shes gang //
translated: Objection: That consciousness which is subsequent

original: de yang sgra dang gsal bar snang //
analyzed: de yang sgra dang gsal bar snang //
translated: Also appears as sound and the manifest.

original: kha dog dbyibs yig rnam pa yis //
analyzed: kha dog dbyibs yig rnam pa yis //
translated: By the aspect of color, shape, and letters,

original: stong pa ba lang nyid du brjod //
analyzed: stong pa ba lang nyid du brjod //
translated: The empty is said to be the nature of the cow.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: mthong ba'i dus phyis rjes su 'gro ba can gyi @61b shes pa gang yin pa de la gsal ba la gnas pa'i spyi gzhan du gyur pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus phyis rjes su 'gro ba can gyi @61b shes pa gang yin pa de la gsal ba la gnas pa'i spyi gzhan du gyur pa snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: That consciousness which is subsequent to the time of seeing does not appear as the transformation of the universal that abides in the manifest.

original: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid can rigs kyi lugs kyang snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid can rigs kyi lugs kyang snang ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the universal that has the nature of being subsequent also appears.

original: rnam par shes brjod par byed pa'i sgra snang ba dang / gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba can de ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes brjod par byed pa'i sgra snang ba dang / gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba can de ni /
translated: The sound that expresses the consciousness of the appearance that has the nature of the manifest

original: de la sgra med par spyi gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de la sgra med par spyi gzhan rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that without sound the other universal is not cognized?

original: 'on te sgra'i shes pa spyi'i rnam par rtog pa shes pa skye la /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i shes pa spyi'i rnam par rtog pa shes pa skye la /
translated: Or is it that the cognition of the universal in the form of an idea arises from the sound,

original: spyi'i rnam pa ni rigs las yin gyis /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa ni rigs las yin gyis /
translated: and the aspect of the universal is from the class,

original: gsal ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not from the manifest?

original: sgras brjod par bya ba skyes pa can gyi mthong ba skyes pa ni yongs su mthong ba'i kha dog dang / dbyibs dang snang ba'i rnam pa nges pa can du shes par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgras brjod par bya ba skyes pa can gyi mthong ba skyes pa ni yongs su mthong ba'i kha dog dang / dbyibs dang snang ba'i rnam pa nges pa can du shes par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the arising of the seeing that has the nature of the arising of the expressible object ascertained as the aspect of the color, shape, and appearance of the seen?

original: mi gsal ba dang kha dog dang bral ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i spyi gzhan snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba dang kha dog dang bral ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i spyi gzhan snang ba ma yin te /
translated: The universal that is not clear and is devoid of color and shape does not appear as another.

original: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa tsam rjes su 'brang ba can gyi blo nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa tsam rjes su 'brang ba can gyi blo nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of color and so on is experienced as having a universal.

original: 'on te spyi mi gsal ba kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa can nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi mi gsal ba kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa can nyid yin na /
translated: But if the universal is not clear and has the aspect of color and shape,

original: de ji ltar sgra dang 'brel pa'i shes pa spyi nges par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar sgra dang 'brel pa'i shes pa spyi nges par byed pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: how can the cognition that is related to the word not ascertain the universal?

original: kha dog sngon po la sogs pa dang / dbyibs shes par bya ba'i cha byad dang / yi ge ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas stong pa rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid can ba lang nyid du brjod par bya na /
analyzed: kha dog sngon po la sogs pa dang / dbyibs shes par bya ba'i cha byad dang / yi ge ba la sogs pa'i rnam pas stong pa rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid can ba lang nyid du brjod par bya na /
translated: If the universal is empty of the aspect of the color blue and so on and the shape that is to be known, and is empty of the form of the letter ‚Äúg‚Äù and so on, then it should be said that the universal is the nature of the cow that is empty of the aspect of the color blue and so on and the shape that is to be known, and is empty of the form of the letter ‚Äúg‚Äù and so on.

original: de ji ltar rnam pa gzhan can gyi gzhal bya gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pas mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam pa gzhan can gyi gzhal bya gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pas mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: How could a consciousness that has the aspect of another object that has a different aspect see it?

original: de'i phyir spyi snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, a universal does not appear.

original: rjes su 'brang ba 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa ni ming tsam yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba 'di ba lang ngo snyam pa ni ming tsam yin no //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúThis is a cow‚Äù that follows after it is merely a name.

original: ming nyid kyang tha mi dad pa'i don med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ming nyid kyang tha mi dad pa'i don med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could a name itself be without a referent that is not different from it?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: don gcig byed par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gcig byed par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the same in performing a single function.

original: ming tsam gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ro zhes le'u dang por bstan to /
analyzed: ming tsam gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ro zhes le'u dang por bstan to /
translated: It is taught in the first chapter that it is the same in performing a single function, which is merely a name.

original: // / yang na yongs su dpyod pa'i shes pa nyid mtshungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: // / yang na yongs su dpyod pa'i shes pa nyid mtshungs pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, the consciousness that analyzes it is the same,

original: don la mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don la mtshungs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: but the referent is not the same.

original: 'on te sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba can mthong ba skyes pa ni mi gsal ba'i rnam pa myong bar gyur pa spyi yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba can mthong ba skyes pa ni mi gsal ba'i rnam pa myong bar gyur pa spyi yin mod kyi /
translated: Or, the arising of the seeing that follows after the word is the experience of an unclear aspect, which is indeed a universal.

original: kha dog la sogs pa dang bral bar bye brag pas bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa dang bral bar bye brag pas bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the Vai≈õe·π£ika does not teach that it is free from color and so on.

original: de mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not clear.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / de nyid mtshungs pa nyid yin yang //
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid mtshungs pa nyid yin yang //
translated: Even though that is the same,

original: mig gi spyod yul du snang min //
analyzed: mig gi spyod yul du snang min //
translated: it does not appear as the object of the eye.

original: snang ba gnyis ni med phyir yang //üîΩblo yi tha dad rnyed par dka' //
analyzed: snang ba gnyis ni med phyir yang // blo yi tha dad rnyed par dka' //
translated: Because the two appearances do not exist,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is difficult to find a difference in awareness.

original: @62a * // gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mi gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa de nyid mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas len par gyur kyang /
analyzed: @62a * // gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba can gyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mi gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa de nyid mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas len par gyur kyang /
translated: Even though you accept that the aspect in which the nature of blue, etc., appears unclearly to the consciousness that is concomitant with it is the same nature,

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid mig gi spyod yul du mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can 'di mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid mig gi spyod yul du mi gsal ba'i rnam pa can 'di mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: you do not see this aspect that is unclear as the nature of the object of the eye.

original: de'i phyir mig gi yul du ma shes pa'i spyi'i rang bzhin rigs su ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi yul du ma shes pa'i spyi'i rang bzhin rigs su ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore how could the nature of the universal that is not known as the object of the eye become a type?

original: 'on kyang shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mi gsal ba ni khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa las tha mi dad pa'i phyir mi gsal ba ni khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: However, because it is not different from consciousness, the unclear aspect is the nature of the object.

original: ci ste don tsam thams cad la spyi dang khyad par gyis mthong bar 'gyur pa thams cad kyi blo nyams su myong ba ma yin nam ;
analyzed: ci ste don tsam thams cad la spyi dang khyad par gyis mthong bar 'gyur pa thams cad kyi blo nyams su myong ba ma yin nam ;
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the cognition of all universals and instances of mere objects is not experienced?

original: de yang spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa can gyi gzhal bya med bar skye ba thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa can gyi gzhal bya med bar skye ba thob par mi nus te /
translated: And it is not possible to generate a cognition that lacks a cognized object that has the aspect of a universal or instance.

original: de lta bu ni rig pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni rig pa'i chos yin te /
translated: This is the nature of cognition.

original: gang phyi rol na gnas pa'i yul mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gang phyi rol na gnas pa'i yul mthong ba'o //
translated: It is the seeing of an object that exists externally.

original: gal te yang rigs med par de'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye na /
analyzed: gal te yang rigs med par de'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye na /
translated: But if a cognition that has the aspect of that were to arise without a universal,

original: ji ltar bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyi rol du snang ba spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid la gnas pa'i phyi rol du snang ba spong bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: why wouldn‚Äôt it be the case that the appearance of something external that exists in the self would not be abandoned?

original: de ni snying po med pa ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni snying po med pa ste gang gi phyir /
translated: That is pointless because

original: dbang po las skyes pa'am rtog pa'i blo rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa rnyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'am rtog pa'i blo rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rnam pa can gyi ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa rnyed pa ma yin te /
translated: the cognition that arises from the sense faculties or the conceptual cognition is not found to have a nature that has the aspect of being concomitant or not being concomitant.

original: spyi dang spyi ma yin pa'i rnam pa can gyi snang ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi dang spyi ma yin pa'i rnam pa can gyi snang ba gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the two appearances that have the aspect of a universal and a non-universal do not exist.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gnyis su snang ba can dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yin nam /üîΩrtog pa'i blo yin grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gnyis su snang ba can dbang po las skyes pa'i blo yin nam / rtog pa'i blo yin grang na /
translated: Thus, does the cognition that appears as two forms arise from the sense faculty or from conceptual thought?

original: de la dbang po las skyes pa ni ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba snang ba can ma yin te /
analyzed: de la dbang po las skyes pa ni ldog pa dang rjes su 'gro ba snang ba can ma yin te /
translated: If it arises from the sense faculty, it is not a cognition that appears as a reversal or as a succession.

original: mthong ba ni gsal ba nyid du thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa yongs su gtsod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba ni gsal ba nyid du thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam pa yongs su gtsod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what is seen is a specific form that is not shared and is clear.

original: mig las skyes pa'i rig pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las lhag ba'i spyi'i ngo bor shes ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang mi snang bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yul ma yin te /
analyzed: mig las skyes pa'i rig pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid las lhag ba'i spyi'i ngo bor shes ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang mi snang bar gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yul ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that arises from the eye has the nature of clarity. It is not a cognition that has the nature of a generality. And an object that has the nature of something that does not appear is not an object,

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is absurd.

original: 'on te rtog pa'i blo rnam pa gnyis 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa'i blo rnam pa gnyis 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is a conceptual cognition that apprehends two forms,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de la mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kho na nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kho na nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that case, it would be an experience that has the nature of something unclear.

original: rtog pa la gsal ba'i rnam pa snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa la gsal ba'i rnam pa snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: And the appearance of a clear form to conceptual thought is not so.

original: de bas na blo 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su snang ba 'dzin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na blo 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su snang ba 'dzin pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, this cognition does not apprehend the appearance of two aspects.

original: de lta bas na gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rigs mthong ba med par bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rigs mthong ba med par bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is shown that the distinct class is not seen apart from the manifest.

original: 'on te 'phrod pa 'du ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rigs tha dad par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'phrod pa 'du ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba las tha dad pa'i rigs tha dad par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you think that the distinct class is not known to be distinct from the manifest by the power of the contact of the sense faculty,

original: dper na @62b gzhi khyad par gyi gzugs nye bar gyur na de'i rang bzhin nyid du shel sgong la snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na @62b gzhi khyad par gyi gzugs nye bar gyur na de'i rang bzhin nyid du shel sgong la snang ba yin gyi /
translated: just as when a form that is a special basis is present, the crystal appears to have the nature of that form,

original: gzhi'i gzugs las tha dad pa shel la mi snang bar shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhi'i gzugs las tha dad pa shel la mi snang bar shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: but the crystal is known not to appear to have a form that is distinct from the basis.

original: smras pa / dbang pos 'phrod 'du 'dzin med phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / dbang pos 'phrod 'du 'dzin med phyir //
translated: We say: Because the sense faculty does not apprehend the contact,

original: 'brel pa mthong ba med par gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'brel pa mthong ba med par gnas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the relation is not seen.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba ni dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba ni dbang po'i spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, because the contact is beyond the domain of the sense faculty,

original: dbang pos mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang pos mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not apprehended by the sense faculty.

original: rigs la sogs pa rnams kyi 'brel pa ma mthong bar nges pa ste /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa rnams kyi 'brel pa ma mthong bar nges pa ste /
translated: It is ascertained that the relation of the class and so on is not seen.

original: 'di ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das par pha rol gyis khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das par pha rol gyis khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the opponent himself has accepted that the contact of the cloth with the warp is beyond the senses.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa las 'das pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba ji ltar bdag nyid kyis rigs tha dad par snang ba 'joms par 'gyur /
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa las 'das pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba ji ltar bdag nyid kyis rigs tha dad par snang ba 'joms par 'gyur /
translated: How could the contact of the cloth with the warp, which is beyond sight and touch, destroy the appearance of the cloth as a different type?

original: btsod la sogs pa'i tshon rtsi ni rang nyid myong bar gyur pas snam bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad par mthong ba 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsod la sogs pa'i tshon rtsi ni rang nyid myong bar gyur pas snam bu'i ngo bo nyid tha dad par mthong ba 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: The colors of the cloth, such as red, destroy the appearance of the cloth as a different type from the warp, because they are experienced by themselves.

original: 'on te gzegs gzan gcig pu 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das par 'dod la ;
analyzed: 'on te gzegs gzan gcig pu 'phrod pa 'du ba dbang po las 'das par 'dod la ;
translated: But if the Vai≈õe·π£ika asserts that the contact of the cloth with the warp is beyond the senses,

original: rigs pa can gyi dbang po'i spyod yul du 'dod de /
analyzed: rigs pa can gyi dbang po'i spyod yul du 'dod de /
translated: and the NaiyƒÅyika asserts that it is within the domain of the senses,

original: 'di ltar snal ma la snam bu'o snyam du mig las byung ba'i shes pa skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar snal ma la snam bu'o snyam du mig las byung ba'i shes pa skye'o zhe na /
translated: then the cognition ‚ÄúThis is a cloth‚Äù arises from the eye.

original: de yang mdzes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mdzes pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not beautiful.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: snal ma 'di yang snam bu sogs //
analyzed: snal ma 'di yang snam bu sogs //
translated: This warp is also a cloth, etc.

original: sgra 'di rnams kyang rang gis byas //
analyzed: sgra 'di rnams kyang rang gis byas //
translated: These words are also self-produced.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la snal ma la snam bu dang / yal ga la sdong po'o snyam pa'i blo med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la snal ma la snam bu dang / yal ga la sdong po'o snyam pa'i blo med de /
translated: In the world, there is no cognition such as ‚Äúcloth is in the warp and woof‚Äù or ‚Äúa tree is in the branches.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir blo 'di lta bu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo 'di lta bu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because such a cognition does not exist,

original: ji ltar 'phrod pa 'du bar shes /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phrod pa 'du bar shes /
translated: how can one know that the warp and woof are assembled?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the case?

original: rigs pa can rang nyid mi bden pa'i lta ba la goms pa kho nas snal ma la snam bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra byas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa can rang nyid mi bden pa'i lta ba la goms pa kho nas snal ma la snam bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra byas pa'o //
translated: The logicians themselves, through mere habituation to the view that the warp and woof are not real, say ‚Äúcloth is in the warp and woof.‚Äù

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jig rten na grags she na //üîΩ'jig rten ba lang la rva zer //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jig rten na grags she na // 'jig rten ba lang la rva zer //
translated: How is this known in the world?üîΩThe world says ‚Äúcow‚Äù for the horn.

original: rva la ba lang 'jig rten min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩ'jig rten pa ni ba lang la rva yod pa dang / sa'i steng na sdong po dang 'khru shing yod do zhes grags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rva la ba lang 'jig rten min // zhes bya ba la / 'jig rten pa ni ba lang la rva yod pa dang / sa'i steng na sdong po dang 'khru shing yod do zhes grags pa yin gyi /
translated: The world does not say ‚Äúhorn‚Äù for the cow.üîΩThe world knows that a cow has horns and that there are trees and vines on the earth‚Äôs surface.

original: rva la ba lang dang lcug ma rnams la sdong po yod do snyam du 'jig rten pas rtogs pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: rva la ba lang dang lcug ma rnams la sdong po yod do snyam du 'jig rten pas rtogs pa ni ma yin na /
translated: The world does not know that the horn is a cow or that the vines are trees.

original: de ji ltar rtogs pa dang bral bar 'phrod pa 'du bar rjes su dpog pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar rtogs pa dang bral bar 'phrod pa 'du bar rjes su dpog pa yin /
translated: It is inferred that the two are in contact because they are realized as being separate.

original: 'on te ba lang gi rva zhes rtogs par bya ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ba lang gi rva zhes rtogs par bya ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Or is the expression ‚Äúcow‚Äôs horn‚Äù the cause of the realization?

original: rgyu med na yul tha dad par 'jug pa mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med na yul tha dad par 'jug pa mngon sum du rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If there were no cause, it would not be reasonable for the object to be engaged as separate.

original: ba lang 'di la rva yod do zhes bya bar @63a */
analyzed: ba lang 'di la rva yod do zhes bya bar @63a */
translated: The expression ‚ÄúThis cow has a horn‚Äù

original: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu can 'phrod pa 'du bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su gcod pa'i rgyu can 'phrod pa 'du bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: is the cause of the ascertainment that the two are in contact.

original: smras pa / lhag pa'i yan lag pa min can //
analyzed: smras pa / lhag pa'i yan lag pa min can //
translated: We say: It is not a special part,

original: tha dad dmigs su med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tha dad dmigs su med phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the separate is not observed.

original: 'phrod pa 'du ba med kyang 'dir mthong ba dmigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'phrod pa 'du ba med kyang 'dir mthong ba dmigs pa nyid de /
translated: Even though there is no contact, here the mere observation is the observation itself.

original: dper na nyi ma nub pa'i tshe ri'i rtse mor snang byed song ngo zhes bya bar rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyi ma nub pa'i tshe ri'i rtse mor snang byed song ngo zhes bya bar rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the sun sets, it is understood that the light has gone to the peak of the mountain.

original: gang la ba zhes bya ba'i ming yod pa de ni rva dang nog dang lkog shal gyi yan lag gi khyad par de dag dang bral bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la ba zhes bya ba'i ming yod pa de ni rva dang nog dang lkog shal gyi yan lag gi khyad par de dag dang bral bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which has the name ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not observed to be separate from those special parts, such as the horn, dewlap, and hump.

original: ba lang la rva yod do zhes blo skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ba lang la rva yod do zhes blo skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The idea occurs that the cow has horns.

original: rva la sogs pa'i yan lag gi tshogs tha dad pa'i ba lang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rva la sogs pa'i yan lag gi tshogs tha dad pa'i ba lang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But the cow is not the collection of different parts, such as the horns, etc.

original: gang la rva gnas pa de ba lang gi rva 'di yin no snyam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la rva gnas pa de ba lang gi rva 'di yin no snyam pa ma yin no //
translated: For the idea does not occur that the cow is the horns, etc., where the horns are located.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni rtogs pas bzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ni rtogs pas bzhag pa nyid do //
translated: The relation of support and supported is established by the imagination.

original: snal ma de dag las snam bu 'di byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa rab tu grags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snal ma de dag las snam bu 'di byas pa'o zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa rab tu grags pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it well known that the idea occurs that the cloth is made from those threads?

original: snam bu mthong ba na snal ma tshogs pa las gzhan pa'i snam bu yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: snam bu mthong ba na snal ma tshogs pa las gzhan pa'i snam bu yod pa ma yin la /
translated: When the cloth is seen, the cloth is not something different from the collection of threads.

original: gnod pa can bstan pa med par 'khrul pa'i shes pa'o zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: gnod pa can bstan pa med par 'khrul pa'i shes pa'o zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: And it cannot be said that the cognition is erroneous because no contradiction has been shown.

original: de'i phyir rtogs pa 'di'i yul snal ma dang snam bu'i khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtogs pa 'di'i yul snal ma dang snam bu'i khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of that idea is the difference between the threads and the cloth.

original: ci'i phyir snal ma'i tshogs pa snam bu yin no snyam sems na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir snal ma'i tshogs pa snam bu yin no snyam sems na /
translated: If you think that the collection of threads is the cloth,

original: smras pa / snal ma de rnams kyis snam bu //
analyzed: smras pa / snal ma de rnams kyis snam bu //
translated: we reply: The cloth is not the threads.

original: 'di zhes snal ma 'dus byas la //
analyzed: 'di zhes snal ma 'dus byas la //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù is the assembled, compounded thing.üîΩ

original: phyi ma 'bras bu brjod pa ste //üîΩnam yang dus gcig pa ma yin //
analyzed: phyi ma 'bras bu brjod pa ste // nam yang dus gcig pa ma yin //
translated: The cloth is said to be the effect of the threads,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: but they never exist at the same time.

original: snal ma'i sgras ni snam bu'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la brjod de /
analyzed: snal ma'i sgras ni snam bu'i sngon rol gyi gnas skabs la brjod de /
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúthreads‚Äù refers to the prior stage of the cloth.

original: dus phyis 'byung ba'i tshe bgo ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa byed pa la snam bu'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba'i tshe bgo ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa byed pa la snam bu'i sgras brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù refers to the later stage, when it is used for its purpose, such as being worn.

original: des na snal ma de rnams kyi snam bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i dag ni /
analyzed: des na snal ma de rnams kyi snam bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i dag ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúthis cloth is from those threads‚Äù

original: phyis snal ma rnams tha ga pa la sogs pas 'dus byas pa snam bu nus pa de las byung ba 'bras bur brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis snal ma rnams tha ga pa la sogs pas 'dus byas pa snam bu nus pa de las byung ba 'bras bur brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: refers to the cloth that is produced later by weavers and so on from the threads. It is called the effect that arises from the potential of the threads.

original: nam yang snal ma'i dus mtshungs pa can du snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bur brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang snal ma'i dus mtshungs pa can du snam bu la sogs pa 'bras bur brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the effect, such as the cloth, is never said to be simultaneous with the threads.

original: de bas na snal ma dang snam bu dag rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snal ma dang snam bu dag rten dang brten pa'i dngos po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the threads and the cloth are not in the relation of supporter and supported.

original: 'o na gal te gang gi tshe snal ma yin pa de'i tshe snam bu ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gang gi tshe snal ma yin pa de'i tshe snam bu ma yin la /
translated: But if the cloth does not exist when the threads exist,

original: gang gi tshe snam bu yin pa de'i tshe snal ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe snam bu yin pa de'i tshe snal ma ma yin te /
translated: When it is cloth, it is not yarn.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag dus tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cause and effect are different in time.

original: de ltar na snal ma'i dus na @63b snam bu dang bral ba'i phyir 'di dag ni snal ma'o 'di ni snam bu'o zhes rtogs ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na snal ma'i dus na @63b snam bu dang bral ba'i phyir 'di dag ni snal ma'o 'di ni snam bu'o zhes rtogs ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In that case, since at the time of the yarn the cloth does not exist, how could one understand, ‚ÄúThese are the yarns‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is the cloth‚Äù?

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /
translated: That is not correct, because

original: 'ga' zhig sgra rten ston pa na //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig sgra rten ston pa na //
translated: when someone points out the support of the word,

original: rgyu ru nye bar 'dogs pa 'am //
analyzed: rgyu ru nye bar 'dogs pa 'am //
translated: it is designated as the cause.

original: snal ma gcig ni gses nas kyang //
analyzed: snal ma gcig ni gses nas kyang //
translated: Or, having divided up a single yarn,

original: 'bras la snal ma zhes 'jug 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: 'bras la snal ma zhes 'jug 'gyur // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: the word ‚Äúyarn‚Äù is applied to the result.

original: snal ma'i 'bras bu ni snam bu nyid de de'i tshe snal ma med do //
analyzed: snal ma'i 'bras bu ni snam bu nyid de de'i tshe snal ma med do //
translated: Here, the result of the yarn is cloth itself. At that time, the yarn does not exist.

original: sngar snal ma rgyu yin pas btags nas snal ma'i shes pa dang snal ma'i sgra 'bras bu snam bu la skyo'o //
analyzed: sngar snal ma rgyu yin pas btags nas snal ma'i shes pa dang snal ma'i sgra 'bras bu snam bu la skyo'o //
translated: Previously, the yarn was designated as the cause. The consciousness of yarn and the word ‚Äúyarn‚Äù are applied to the result, the cloth.

original: 'jug par 'gyur te 'di ltar sngar gyi snal ma dran nas 'di dag snal ma'o zhes rtogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug par 'gyur te 'di ltar sngar gyi snal ma dran nas 'di dag snal ma'o zhes rtogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is so because, having remembered the former threads, one understands that these are threads, but not otherwise.

original: snal ma re re nas gses nas kyang snal ma'o zhes bya bar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snal ma re re nas gses nas kyang snal ma'o zhes bya bar 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And, having divided each thread, one would understand that each is a thread.

original: ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What would be the point?

original: snam bu la /
analyzed: snam bu la /
translated: In the cloth.

original: snal ma'i sgra'i rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: snal ma'i sgra'i rten bstan par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to indicate the basis of the word ‚Äúthread,‚Äù

original: 'di ltar snal ma de nyid bsdus nas khyad par can gyi dus su son pa na snam bu zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar snal ma de nyid bsdus nas khyad par can gyi dus su son pa na snam bu zhes brjod do //
translated: because, when those very threads are gathered and reach a special time, they are called ‚Äúcloth.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir dmag dang nags bzhin du snam bu ni kun rdzob tu yong ba nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmag dang nags bzhin du snam bu ni kun rdzob tu yong ba nyid yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, like an army and like a forest, cloth is only conventionally existent.

original: don dam par snal ma las tha dad pa'i snam bu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par snal ma las tha dad pa'i snam bu yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately, cloth does not exist as a different object from thread.

original: 'o na gal te snal ma las tha dad pa'i snam bu med na ji ltar snam bu'i sgra 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te snal ma las tha dad pa'i snam bu med na ji ltar snam bu'i sgra 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: But if cloth does not exist as different from thread, how could the word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù be used?

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med par brjod pas 'jug par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan med par brjod pas 'jug par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is not possible to use a word without an external basis.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir /üîΩphan gdags phan 'dogs byed nyid dam //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te gang gi phyir / phan gdags phan 'dogs byed nyid dam //
translated: That is not logical, because

original: ris chad mthong ba med pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: ris chad mthong ba med pa nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: the cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.

original: snam bu'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: snam bu'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.

original: tha ga pa la sogs pa'i grogs byed pas phul du byung ba can gyi snal ma rnams phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni snam bu'i sgra'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir snal ma de nyid phan gdags par byaüîΩba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos por gnas pas bgo ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa nye bar bsgrub pa ni snam bu'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: tha ga pa la sogs pa'i grogs byed pas phul du byung ba can gyi snal ma rnams phan tshun phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni snam bu'i sgra'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir snal ma de nyid phan gdags par byaüîΩba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa'i dngos por gnas pas bgo ba la sogs pa'i dgos pa nye bar bsgrub pa ni snam bu'i sgra'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.üîΩThe cloth is not seen to be different from the warp and woof.

original: yang na snal ma rnams la ris su chad pa ma mthong ba 'di ni snam su'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin te dper na thag bzangs la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa med na snal ma dag phan tshun rnam par chad nas khyer bar byed kyi /üîΩsnam bu'i dus na ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ris su chad pa mthong ba med pa nyid bum pa'i sgra'i rgyu yin gyi @64a * //
analyzed: yang na snal ma rnams la ris su chad pa ma mthong ba 'di ni snam su'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin te dper na thag bzangs la sogs pa phan 'dogs pa med na snal ma dag phan tshun rnam par chad nas khyer bar byed kyi / snam bu'i dus na ni de ltar ma yin pa'i phyir ris su chad pa mthong ba med pa nyid bum pa'i sgra'i rgyu yin gyi @64a * //
translated: Or, the cause of the convention of cloth is the non-observation of the division of the threads, just as the cause of the convention of pot is the non-observation of the division of the parts.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa'i yan lag can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa'i yan lag can ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-observation of the division of the parts is the cause of the sound of pot, but the possessor of the parts that is a different object does not exist.

original: de ltar yin du chug na gal te snal ma dang bral ba'i rdzas bum pa'i sgra'i rgyu med pa de lta na snal ma la bum pa'i sgra nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug na gal te snal ma dang bral ba'i rdzas bum pa'i sgra'i rgyu med pa de lta na snal ma la bum pa'i sgra nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if that were so, if the substance of pot that is separate from the threads is not the cause of the sound of pot, then the sound of pot would be designated in relation to the threads.

original: dper na skyes bu la seng ge'i sgra bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu la seng ge'i sgra bzhin te /
translated: For example, it would be like the sound of a lion in relation to a man.

original: rtsal che ba la dpa' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rgyu yod kyang seng ge'i sgra ni dngos su ma yin te seng ga'i rigs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsal che ba la dpa' ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rgyu yod kyang seng ge'i sgra ni dngos su ma yin te seng ga'i rigs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is a cause for the qualities of bravery and so on in a lion, the sound of lion is not actually so, because the lion‚Äôs species does not exist.

original: de bzhin du phan gdags dang phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan yod kyang snal ma la snam bu'i sgra ni dngos su mi 'gyur te de'i yan lag can med pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du phan gdags dang phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan yod kyang snal ma la snam bu'i sgra ni dngos su mi 'gyur te de'i yan lag can med pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: Likewise, although there is a cause for the state of being benefited and the state of benefiting, the sound of cloth is not actually so, because the whole does not exist.üîΩHere we say:

original: dang po brda'i spyod yul gang //üîΩ'khrul med can gyi shes pa dngos //
analyzed: dang po brda'i spyod yul gang // 'khrul med can gyi shes pa dngos //
translated: First, the object of a conventional symbol

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the actual thing of an undeluded consciousness.

original: gang zhig dang po'i brda'i spyod yul gyi dngos po de ni dngos yin te 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dngos po gang la shes pa mi 'khrul pa yod pa de ni dngos yin par 'jig rten du grags las /
analyzed: gang zhig dang po'i brda'i spyod yul gyi dngos po de ni dngos yin te 'khrul pa med pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dngos po gang la shes pa mi 'khrul pa yod pa de ni dngos yin par 'jig rten du grags las /
translated: Here, that which is the object of the first conventional symbol is the actual thing, because it is the object of an undeluded consciousness. Whatever thing has an undeluded consciousness is known in the world as an actual thing.

original: gang la dang po brdar byas pa'i dngos po dang chos mthun pas de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa las rtogs pa de ni nye bar btags pa ste 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la dang po brdar byas pa'i dngos po dang chos mthun pas de nyid du sgro 'dogs pa las rtogs pa de ni nye bar btags pa ste 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object that is understood by a cognition that is in agreement with the thing that was first signified is a secondary designation because it is the object of a mistaken cognition.

original: snam bu'i sgra ni snal ma nyid bgo ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid dang por brdar byas nas ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir dngos yin no //
analyzed: snam bu'i sgra ni snal ma nyid bgo ba la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid dang por brdar byas nas ma 'khrul pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir dngos yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù is a real thing because it generates a non-mistaken cognition that is capable of performing the function of weaving, etc.

original: 'on te don dam pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir snam bu'i sgra nye bar btags pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te don dam pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir snam bu'i sgra nye bar btags pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: But if the word ‚Äúcloth‚Äù is a secondary designation because the ultimate thing does not exist,

original: de lta na sgra rnams thams cad nye bar btags pa ste yod pa'i dngos po yul du byed pa med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes le'u dang por bstan to //
analyzed: de lta na sgra rnams thams cad nye bar btags pa ste yod pa'i dngos po yul du byed pa med pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes le'u dang por bstan to //
translated: then all words are secondary designations because they do not have an existent thing as their object, as was explained in the first chapter.

original: 'on te rigs la sogs pa rnams rjes su dpag pas yod par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te rigs la sogs pa rnams rjes su dpag pas yod par shes pa ste /
translated: But if you think that the existence of universals, etc., is known through inference,

original: ji ltar dbyug pa can du mtshungs pa'i rgyus skyes bu tha dad pa la yang dbyug pa can zhes bya ba'i blo mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can du 'gyur zhing /üîΩnag mo la sogs pa yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid la ba lang zhes bya ba'i blo rnam pa mtshungs pa can yod pa de'i phyir rnam par mtshungs pa can mthong bas dpag par bya bar rigs gsal ba tha dad pa dpag tu med pa
analyzed: ji ltar dbyug pa can du mtshungs pa'i rgyus skyes bu tha dad pa la yang dbyug pa can zhes bya ba'i blo mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can du 'gyur zhing / nag mo la sogs pa yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid la ba lang zhes bya ba'i blo rnam pa mtshungs pa can yod pa de'i phyir rnam par mtshungs pa can mthong bas dpag par bya bar rigs gsal ba tha dad pa dpag tu med pa
translated: Just as the cognition of a person who is similar in terms of having a stick arises in a similar way,

original: la yod par des so zhe na /
analyzed: la yod par des so zhe na /
translated: and just as the cognition of a cow exists in a similar way in relation to a black cow and so on, which are different in terms of their nature, therefore it is reasonable to infer the existence of a universal that is seen to be similar in terms of aspect.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos po las ni tha dad can //
analyzed: dngos po las ni tha dad can //
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal is not different from the thing.

original: rigs sogs la ni rjes dpog med //üîΩdbyugs pa la sogs @64b kun rdzob las //
analyzed: rigs sogs la ni rjes dpog med // dbyugs pa la sogs @64b kun rdzob las //
translated: There is no inference of a universal and so on.

original: thams cad du ni tha snyad 'dogs //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad du ni tha snyad 'dogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: All conventions are made in dependence on the relative, such as a stick and so on.‚Äù

original: dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa ste /
translated: Here, the universal is not different from the thing‚Äôs own characteristics.

original: rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa yan gar ba 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pa med de /
analyzed: rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa yan gar ba 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pa med de /
translated: There is no inference that apprehends a universal, quality, and so on as a separate entity.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa gcig pa can gyi brjod pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa gcig pa can gyi brjod pa'am /
translated: Thus, the expression ‚Äúhaving the same aspect‚Äù or

original: rigs pa yod pa nyid kyis rigs bstan pa'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rigs pa yod pa nyid kyis rigs bstan pa'o zhes brjod de /
translated: ‚Äúhaving the same reason‚Äù is used.

original: brjod pa dngos po yod pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa dngos po yod pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that the expression has as its basis the existence of a real entity.

original: dngos po thams cad la dbyug pa la sogs pa tha snyad 'dogs pa dbyug pa la sogs pa kun rdzob kho na las dbyug pa can du 'dogs so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la dbyug pa la sogs pa tha snyad 'dogs pa dbyug pa la sogs pa kun rdzob kho na las dbyug pa can du 'dogs so //
translated: For in the case of all entities, such as a stick, the expression ‚Äústick-possessor‚Äù is applied on the basis of the mere conventional designation ‚Äústick.‚Äù

original: de bas na gal te rtog pas mthong ba'i spyi'i rgyu la brten nas ba lang gi gsal ba la rnam pa mtshungs pa can du brjod pa de lta na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gal te rtog pas mthong ba'i spyi'i rgyu la brten nas ba lang gi gsal ba la rnam pa mtshungs pa can du brjod pa de lta na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: So if the expression ‚Äúhaving the same aspect‚Äù is used in regard to the manifestation of a cow on the basis of a conceptual cognition that sees a universal, then this is just establishing what is already established.

original: 'on te rgyu rigs la sogs pa yod pa nyid la brten nas mtshungs pa'i rtogs pa sgrub na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu rigs la sogs pa yod pa nyid la brten nas mtshungs pa'i rtogs pa sgrub na /
translated: But if the establishment of the cognition of sameness is based on the existence of a real entity, such as a universal,

original: de lta na ni dpe bsgrub byas stong par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni dpe bsgrub byas stong par 'gyur te /
translated: then the example is empty of the probandum.

original: dbyug pa can no snyam pa'i rtogs pa dbyug pa'i rgyu can nyid du rigs pas ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyug pa can no snyam pa'i rtogs pa dbyug pa'i rgyu can nyid du rigs pas ma yin te /
translated: For it is not reasonable to say that the cognition ‚Äústick-possessor‚Äù has a stick as its cause.

original: dbyug pa can gyi sgra dbyug pa'i rgyu can nyid yin na srog chags thams cad dbyug pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbyug pa can gyi sgra dbyug pa'i rgyu can nyid yin na srog chags thams cad dbyug pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: If the term ‚Äúholder of a staff‚Äù were based on the cause of the staff, then all living beings would be holders of a staff.

original: tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the term ‚Äúholder of a staff‚Äù is the cause of the staff, then all living beings would be ‚Äúholders of a staff‚Äù because there is no difference in their being distinct from a staff.

original: 'on te dbyug pa dang 'brel na dbyug pa can yin pa'i phyir thal ches pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbyug pa dang 'brel na dbyug pa can yin pa'i phyir thal ches pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is because of being related to a staff that one is called ‚Äúholder of a staff,‚Äù then it is not the case that the term is extended too far.

original: 'brel pa yang 'brel pa can gyi shes pa'i shes bya ma yin pa'i phyir /üîΩ'brel pa la yang 'brel ba gzhan rtogs par 'gyur bas de bzhin du 'brel pa thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yang 'brel pa can gyi shes pa'i shes bya ma yin pa'i phyir / 'brel pa la yang 'brel ba gzhan rtogs par 'gyur bas de bzhin du 'brel pa thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the relation is not the object of the cognition of the related object,üîΩthen the relation would be cognized even without a related object.

original: 'on te 'brel pa med par yang 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can du shes pa de lta na ni 'brel pa'i 'brel pa rtog pas gzhag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel pa med par yang 'brel pa dang 'brel pa can du shes pa de lta na ni 'brel pa'i 'brel pa rtog pas gzhag par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the relation is cognized even without a related object, then the relation would be established by thought.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa gzhan med kyang 'brel pa'i 'brel pa can rtog pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dngos po dag gi 'brel pa med kyang rtog pas mthong ba nyid kyi 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa gzhan med kyang 'brel pa'i 'brel pa can rtog pa ji lta ba de bzhin du dngos po dag gi 'brel pa med kyang rtog pas mthong ba nyid kyi 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though there is no other relation, just as a conceptual cognition has a relation that is related to it, in the same way, even though things do not have a relation, a conceptual cognition sees a relation.

original: de bas na kun rdzob nyid kyi rgyu mtshan las dbyug pa can zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba de nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na kun rdzob nyid kyi rgyu mtshan las dbyug pa can zhes bya ba'i tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba de nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the consequence that the reason is nonexistent because the expression ‚Äúthe man with the stick‚Äù is designated on the basis of the conventional itself is not tenable.

original: 'on te dbyug pa dang ldan pa bden pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te dbyug pa dang ldan pa bden pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: But it is true that the man with the stick exists,

original: rtog pas btags pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pas btags pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and it is not a conceptual imputation.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not true,

original: dbyug pa dang skyes bu las ma gtogs pa'i ldan par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbyug pa dang skyes bu dag ni mtshungs @65a * //üîΩpar ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbyug pa dang skyes bu las ma gtogs pa'i ldan par snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dbyug pa dang skyes bu dag ni mtshungs @65a * //üîΩpar ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: because apart from the stick and the man, there is no appearance of the man with the stick, and because the stick and the man are equivalent.

original: ji ltar skyes bu dbyug pa dang ldan pa'o snyam du rtogs pa de bzhin du dbyug pa skyes bu can no snyam du yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu dbyug pa dang ldan pa'o snyam du rtogs pa de bzhin du dbyug pa skyes bu can no snyam du yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Just as one understands ‚Äúthe man with the stick,‚Äù so too one would understand ‚Äúthe stick of the man.‚Äù

original: yang na rnam pa gnyis snang ba na dbyug pa dang skyes bu phan tshun ldan pa'o zhes pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gnyis snang ba na dbyug pa dang skyes bu phan tshun ldan pa'o zhes pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba las /
translated: Or else, when the two aspects appear, the idea arises ‚ÄúThe stick and the man are mutually related.‚Äù

original: de dag la khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But they do not exist as the principal and the secondary.

original: 'on te phan 'dogs par byed pas dbyug pa gtso bo'o zhe na /üîΩde la na ni phan 'dogs pa dang ni phan 'dogs pa dang phan gdags pa brtags te bzhag pa tsam yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te phan 'dogs par byed pas dbyug pa gtso bo'o zhe na / de la na ni phan 'dogs pa dang ni phan 'dogs pa dang phan gdags pa brtags te bzhag pa tsam yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the stick is the principal factor because it is helpful,üîΩthen the helpful and the helped are posited as such only through imputation.

original: kun rdzob nyid de la dbyug pa can gyi sgra'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun rdzob nyid de la dbyug pa can gyi sgra'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the stick is the cause of the term ‚Äúthe man with the stick‚Äù only in the conventional sense.

original: phan gdags pa dang phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po de yang mthong ba dang reg pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: phan gdags pa dang phan 'dogs pa'i dngos po de yang mthong ba dang reg pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the relationship between the helpful and the helped is not perceived by sight or touch.

original: de'i phyir dbyug pas khyad par can du gyur pa'i dus na dbang po'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyug pas khyad par can du gyur pa'i dus na dbang po'i yul ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the stick is qualified by the man, it is not the object of the sense faculty.

original: gzhan yang skyes bu so so la dbyug pa yang tha dad pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyes bu so so la dbyug pa yang tha dad pa nyid yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the man is different from the stick,

original: de ji ltar tha dad pa'i dbyug pa las tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi dbyug pa can rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar tha dad pa'i dbyug pa las tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi dbyug pa can rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: how could the man be cognized as having the aspect of being non-different from the different stick?

original: de bas na tha dad pa nyid rmo ba dang bzho ba'i bya ba tha mi dad par shes par gyur nas dbyug pa bzhin tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur yod pa yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gsal ba so so ba la 'gro ba'i bya ba'am /
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa nyid rmo ba dang bzho ba'i bya ba tha mi dad par shes par gyur nas dbyug pa bzhin tha mi dad pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur yod pa yin te / 'di ltar gsal ba so so ba la 'gro ba'i bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, the man exists as the cause of the convention of non-difference, like the stick, having been understood to be non-different from the activities of plowing and tending cattle, which are different.

original: dkar po'i yon tan tha dad pa yin yang rdzas la tha mi dad pa'i rtogs pa dkar po'o snyam pa dang 'gro ba'o snyam du grangs ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs kyi /
analyzed: dkar po'i yon tan tha dad pa yin yang rdzas la tha mi dad pa'i rtogs pa dkar po'o snyam pa dang 'gro ba'o snyam du grangs ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs kyi /
translated: Thus, even though the activities of going and the quality of whiteness are different in individual instances, the cognition of non-difference in substance arises, thinking white and going, in accordance with the number.

original: de la rigs rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: de la rigs rgyu mtshan can gyi shes pa skye ba ni med do //
translated: However, there is no cognition of the reason, the type.

original: 'on te yon tan dkar po dang las 'gro ba de la dkar po nyid 'gro ba nyid kyi spyi grangs bzhin du yod de /
analyzed: 'on te yon tan dkar po dang las 'gro ba de la dkar po nyid 'gro ba nyid kyi spyi grangs bzhin du yod de /
translated: Or do white qualities and the action of going exist in that which goes, like the universal of going?

original: rtogs pa tha mi dad pa 'di de'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa tha mi dad pa 'di de'i rgyu mtshan can yin no zhe na /
translated: The reason for this is that the cognition is not different.

original: de ni med de dkar po nyid kyi rigs rdzas la gnas pa ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang yon tan dkar po la yod pa yin na gzhan la 'jug pa rigs kyis skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni med de dkar po nyid kyi rigs rdzas la gnas pa ma yin gyi / 'on kyang yon tan dkar po la yod pa yin na gzhan la 'jug pa rigs kyis skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so. The universal of white does not reside in the substance,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but if it exists in the white quality, it is not the cause of engaging in another because it is not related to it.

original: 'on te rdzas la yon tan dkar po gnas la /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas la yon tan dkar po gnas la /
translated: If the white quality resides in the substance,

original: yon tan dkar po la dkar po nyid kyi rigs gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan dkar po la dkar po nyid kyi rigs gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: and the universal of whiteness resides in the white quality,

original: 'brel pa po dang 'brel pa las rtogs pa 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa po dang 'brel pa las rtogs pa 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then the cognition would engage in it due to the relation of the related and the relation.

original: 'brel pa dang 'brel pa la sogs pa skye na dngos po thams cad la brgyud nas 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa dang 'brel pa la sogs pa skye na dngos po thams cad la brgyud nas 'brel pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If the related and the relation arise, then all things would be indirectly related,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du shes pa skyed par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: and therefore cognition would arise from everything.

original: 'di dag @65b ni ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag @65b ni ci yang ma yin no //
translated: These are nothing at all.

original: de lta bas na dbyug pa la sogs pa las kyang rtogs pas bstan pa'i tha dad pa nyid las dbyug pa can zhes tha snyad 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na dbyug pa la sogs pa las kyang rtogs pas bstan pa'i tha dad pa nyid las dbyug pa can zhes tha snyad 'dogs kyi /
translated: Therefore, even in the case of a stick-holder, the expression ‚Äústick-holder‚Äù is imputed on the basis of the difference between the stick and the person, as indicated by the cognition.

original: don dam par dbyug pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par dbyug pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But ultimately, it is not the case that the stick-holder is characterized by the stick.

original: dbyug pa can gyi dpe la tha dad pa nyid can gyi dngos po'i rgyu can gyi shes pa ma grub pa de bas na dpe bsgrub bya dang bral ba yin no /
analyzed: dbyug pa can gyi dpe la tha dad pa nyid can gyi dngos po'i rgyu can gyi shes pa ma grub pa de bas na dpe bsgrub bya dang bral ba yin no /
translated: Since the example of the stick-holder is not established as a cognition that has a thing that is different as its cause, therefore the example is devoid of the probandum.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po brgyad pa /
translated: Book 8

original: da ni ma nges pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ma nges pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it is indeterminate, it is said:

original: smras pa / dngos po khang bzangs phreng sogs kyi //
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po khang bzangs phreng sogs kyi //
translated: The words ‚Äúpalace,‚Äù ‚Äúrow,‚Äù and so on

original: sgra rnams kyang gzhan la ltos min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyang gzhan la ltos min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: Do not depend on others.

original: rdzas la sogs pa dngos po drug po rnams la dngos po'i sgra dang / khang bzangs kyi phreng ba dang nags kyi tshogs la sogs pa la sgra 'jug par 'gyur yang /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa dngos po drug po rnams la dngos po'i sgra dang / khang bzangs kyi phreng ba dang nags kyi tshogs la sogs pa la sgra 'jug par 'gyur yang /
translated: The term ‚Äúentity‚Äù is used for the six categories such as substance, and the term ‚Äúrow‚Äù is used for a row of houses, and the term ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is used for a collection of trees, and so on.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: However, it is not the case that these terms are used in dependence on other reasons.

original: rdzas la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la dngos po nyid ces bya ba'i rigs gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams la dngos po nyid ces bya ba'i rigs gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because there is no other type called ‚Äúentity‚Äù that exists for substances and so on.

original: rigs ni dngos po gsum la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni dngos po gsum la 'phrod pa 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The type is the common locus of the three entities.

original: khang bzangs ni rdzas ma yin la /
analyzed: khang bzangs ni rdzas ma yin la /
translated: A house is not a substance.

original: de ji ltar de la phreng ba nyid kyi rigs yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ji ltar de la phreng ba nyid kyi rigs yod par 'gyur na /
translated: So how could the type ‚Äúrow‚Äù exist for it?

original: de bas na sgra de dag ji ltar gzhan la ma ltos par 'jug par 'gyur pa de bzhin du ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra yang yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de bas na sgra de dag ji ltar gzhan la ma ltos par 'jug par 'gyur pa de bzhin du ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra yang yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, just as those terms are used without depending on other things, so too the terms ‚Äúcow‚Äù and so on are used.

original: ba lang nyid kyi rigs med pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang nyid kyi rigs med pa'o //
translated: Therefore the type ‚Äúcow‚Äù does not exist.

original: 'o na gal te khang pa'i rdzas ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te khang pa'i rdzas ma yin te /
translated: If a house is not a substance,

original: rigs mi mthun pa shing dang so phag la sogs pa rnams rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa shing dang so phag la sogs pa rnams rdzas mi rtsom pa'i phyir /
translated: because dissimilar substances such as wood and bricks do not compose it.

original: shing la sogs pa dang ldan pa khang bzangs yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa dang ldan pa khang bzangs yin no zhe na /
translated: A mansion possesses wood and so on.
